loans.name: Juvy

texts.en: Mrs. Juvy F. is 40 years old. She is married and a resident of Dullan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She has five adult children. Juvy sells tuba (a native wine from coconut) to different stores in the nearby barangays (neighborhoods). Her husband is very supportive of her, helping her all the way. Juvy joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in October 2008 to access financial assistance for her small business. She has taken loans several times already. Today, she applies for a 25,000 Philippines pesos loan for house renovation. Juvy wishes that she will someday be able to own a comfortable house and to see her children successful in their chosen careers.

loans.use: For house repair

loans.name: Los Triunfadores - Chilca Group

texts.es:
Fanny Sànchez V., es socia de la alcancia comunal "Los Triunfadores" del distrito al que pertenece, Chilca. Es madre soltera con 1 hijo de 3 años de edad.
Fanny Sànchez empezò este negocio con un capital que le facilitò su hermana; ya que su hermana cuenta con una ferreterìa grande bièn equipada. 
Fanny es madre y padre para su pequeño hijo; ella tiene muchas expectativas para èl en el futuro, anhela darle una buena educaciòn y crianza.
Fanny le ha puesto todo su entusiasmo a este negocio y espera seguir creciendo.
El prèstamo otorgado serà para la compra de mercaderìa y poder abastecer la ferreterìa, y asì suban sus ventas.
(En la fotografìa la Señora Fanny està de pie, es la tercera empezando por la izquierda y està vestida de chompa color gris)
(*) La persona que no se encuentra en la fotografìa, es la Señora Haydee R. G., quièn estaba de viaje por motivos familiares.
texts.en:
Fanny Sànchez V. is a member of the "Los Triunfadores" (The Winners) community bank which is located in her district of Chilca.  She is a single mother and has one three-year-old child.

Fanny started this business with some capital that her sister gave her since her sister owns a large, well-stocked, hardware store.

Fanny is both mother and father to her young son.  She has a lot of hopes for his future.  She hopes to provide him with a good education and to bring him up well.

Fanny has put all her enthusiasm into this business and she hopes that it will continue to grow.  She will use her loan to buy merchandise and stock her hardware store so that her sales increase.

(In the photo, Fanny is standing up, third from the left, wearing a gray sweater).

(*) The person missing from the photo is Mrs Haydee R. G. who was away for family reasons when the photo was taken.

loans.use: To buy products for a hardware store

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 38 years old and still single. To make a living, Jimmy owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jimmy is happy that because of his farm, he is able to help his family financially.

Jimmy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Jimmy has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jimmy is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
Isidro tiene 22 años, su pareja es Mary Paredes y aún no tienen hijos. Es comerciante desde hace 3 años, realiza sus ventas en forma directa y también en forma de pedidos en las despensas, cuenta con clientela formada a quienes en forma semanal los visita dependiendo de la zona en que le toque trabajar.
Empezó con la ayuda de su padre, quien le brindó un pequeño capital para comprar en forma diaria sus mercaderías e ir vendiendo por los barrios, pues sin vehículo salía a realizar sus ventas caminando y si debía irse a zonas más lejanas se manejaba en colectivo, posteriormente sus ventas se vieron en alza y optó por retirar una motocicleta de una casa comercial que le permitió abrir oportunidades de negocio en zonas más lejanas aún y formar una clientela, con quienes se encuentra trabajando sin ningún problema.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva por la oportunidad de solicitar el préstamo pues con ello podría comprar chupetines, caramelos, galletitas, pilas y afeitadoras, entre otras cosas; para aumentar sus ingresos y poder estar preparado para formar una familia.
El cree que pocas organizaciones ofrecen la oportunidad de progresar económicamente tal como lo hace Kiva.
texts.en:
Isidro is 22 years old; his partner is Mary Paredes, and they have no children as yet.  For 3 years he has been a merchant, selling directly and through orders placed at stores.  He has a regular customer base, whom he visits weekly, depending on the area where he is working at the time.
He started out with help from his father, who gave him a small sum to buy his merchandise daily and go around selling in the various neighborhoods.  With no vehicle, he would sell his goods on foot, and if he needed to travel to more remote areas, he used buses.  His sales subsequently increased, and he chose to take out a motorcycle from a dealer, which enabled him to develop business opportunities in areas that were even more remote, and build customers, with whom he continues to work with no problems.
He is grateful to the Paraguayan Foundation and Kiva for the trust shown in granting him a loan, since he will be able to buy candies of various types, cookies, batteries, and shavers. This helps him to increase his income and be prepared to start a family. He believes that there are few organizations that offer the opportunity to progress economically like Kiva does.

loans.use: To buy candies, shavers, batteries, cleaning items, etc.

loans.name: Nyerere Group

texts.en:
Richard M., who is in his late twenties, is married with three children.  He has a business of selling fish (lobster).  He is been in this business for 10 years. His business is open from 8.00 am to 9.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Richard's 5th Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. He has paid back his loans successfully. He hopes to obtain a loan to finish paying back the outstanding debt on the machine for his boat.

Richard will share his loan with his loan group, "Nyerere" which has a total of  11 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Richard is behind, 3rd from right back row.

loans.use: to finish paying back the outstanding debt on the machine for the boat.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza vive en la ciudad de Cartagena y es una mujer imparable, se dedica a muchas actividades: confecciona ropa, ofrece el servicio de alquiler de lavadoras  y también  vende mercancías a crédito,  como cosméticos, interiores femeninos,  ropa informal;  Su hogar lo conforma su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 23 a 40 años y que aun son su gran inspiración para el trabajo intenso que Lorenza realiza.  Este es su segundo financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y considera que su vida ha tenido un cambio del 50% con su crédito, porque ha conocido que puede moverse aun más en el mercado, cumplir sus obligaciones y ganar dinero.  Su sueño es tener un almacén de variedades y ayudar en aumentar el bienestar familiar cada día más.
Por eso con su credikiva se propone fortalecer su mercado de mercancías variadas y comprar perfumes, cosméticos, ropa interior y blusas que tiene encargadas por sus clientes, así con la venta de estas mercancías  aumentara sus ingresos y también su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Lorenza lives in the city of Cartagena.  She is an unstoppable woman.  She is involved in lots of activities:  she makes clothes, she leases washing machines and she also sells items on credit like cosmetics, women’s underwear and casual clothes. Her home consists of her spouse and four children whose ages range from 23 to 40 and who are still a great inspiration for the work Lorenza does.

This is her second loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She considers her life has changed 50% with the loan because she’s realized that she can move even more in the marketplace, can meet her obligations and earn money.  Her dream is to have a variety store and to help her family’s wellbeing more each day.

She plans to use her Kiva loan to strengthen her assorted merchandise market and to buy perfume, cosmetics, underwear and blouses that her customers have ordered.  The sale of this merchandise will increase her income as well as her working capital.

loans.use: to buy fabric and merchandise like perfume, cosmetics, underwear and blouses.

loans.name: Deborah Group

texts.en:
Sichelesile N., 28, has applied for a loan from Kiva partner MicroKing Finance to restock stationery. She will utilize the loan money to buy binding and laminating material, as well as books and ball point pens for resale. She also offers typing and photocopying services and has eight years of business experience. She employs five people. 

Sichelesile comes from the city of Gweru, which is normally referred to as the city of progress. She takes good care of her four children aged 10, eight, six and two, of whom three are attending school. Her husband works for scripture union and together they take care of two other dependents. 

Sichelesile is hopeful that a capital injection will prove beneficial for the future growth of her business. She desires to open and operate a big bookshop and Internet cafe. She is also very grateful for the financial support to women and the empowerment of women. 

Note: In the photo, the lady seated is Sichelesile.

loans.use: To buy binding & laminating material and books for resale

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael J. is 34 years old, a married mother of two children. She practices mixed farming, which she has been doing  for the last 15 years. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a registered client. As a result, she has applied for her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to prepare the land for the next planting season. 

Rael hopes to use the profit from this loan to reinvest back into her business. Her hope and dream is to become a great farmer. She is a vigorous woman who is dedicated to her work and who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to prepare the land for planting

loans.name: Maleeha

texts.en: Maleeha is a 60-year-old hardworking mother. She had to work because her husband has a health condition that doesn't allow him to work. They have 12 children. Two of the children are married. To be able to support her big family, Maleeha start cutting vegetables, packing them and selling them either frozen or fresh. She has been doing that for five years now. During these five years, she was able to be the supplier for a few grocery stores in her area. Now Maleeha has applied for a loan to buy more vegetables and a freezer to increase her productivity to be able to cover her customer’s needs.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and a freezer

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 30 years old and married. He started a business three years ago selling various goods such as clothes, biscuits, sugar, lotion, soap, etc. Joseph works from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day.

Joseph has requested his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy the above-mentioned goods to sell. He will use the profit generated from this loan to reinvest in his business and to buy a motorcycle to help him.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as clothes, biscuits, sugar, lotion, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is divorced and currently taking care of a child. She operates a food joint where she cooks food like banku with okra stew, rice with stew and fufu with soup. Ekua wants to increase the quantity of food cooked so she needs a loan from Kiva to buy more ingredients. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to build a better place where people can come and eat.

loans.use: to buy more food stuffs to cook to sell.

loans.name: Magdaleno De Jesus

texts.es: Magdaleno De Jesús tiene 55 años, su actividad es la venta y elaboración de artesanía. Hace más de 12 años que tiene este medio de vida, es un hombre  persona muy emprendedora y disfruta de hablar con sus clientes. Es por eso que solicita este crédito con el fin de invertir en la compra de barro, pinturas, acuarelas entre otros. Su objetivo es invertir en su actividad para poder generar ganancias a su hogar que son muy necesarias.
texts.en: Magdaleno De Jesús is 55 years old and he prepares and sells handicrafts. He has been engaging in this activity for more than 12 years, he is a very resourceful man and he enjoys talking to his customers. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy potter’s clay, dyes and watercolors among other products. His goal is to invest in his activity in order to earn the money he needs to provide for his family.

loans.use: To  buy potter’s clay, dyes and watercolors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Alida

texts.es: Alida, es una mujer trabajadora de 24 años, que convive con Percy. Ambos tiene 3 hijos: María, Cris y Yamile. En armonía ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Patay. Hace 5 años que en compañía de su esposo, comenzaron a incursionar en la agricultura, su principal actividad económica. Desde las primeras horas del día, Alida cuidada de sus cultivos de papa, arveja y flor de gladiolo. Lo que más le gusta a ella son los momentos de la merienda, pues ahí puede pasar un tiempo agradable junto a su esposo. De igual manera, le agrada vender su producción en el mercado mayorista de Tarma. Pero como padres responsables Percy, su esposo, también se dedica al arado de la tierra con los 2 toros que poseen; ganando un promedio de S/. 60 a S/. 70 nuevos soles diarios. Ahora ella desea mejorar sus sembríos, pues los planes son aprovechar al máximo su cosecha de flor de gladiolo que se encuentra en la mitad de su crecimiento. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Picaflores de Patay”, y esté es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde gusta de compartir momentos de aprendizaje en cada reunión que asume con su asociación. Por ello espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para seguir con sus objetivos. Alida, sembrará 7 sacos de semilla de flor de gladiolo; por ello de recibir su apoyo invertirá en la compra de semillas y 4 sacos de fertilizantes naturales, que es lo necesario para que comience con éxito su sembrío.
texts.en:
Alida, age 24, is a hardworking woman who lives with Percy. They have three children: María, Cris, and Yamile. All of them live in harmony in their home in the village of Patay. Five years ago, Alida and her husband began farming as their main business activity. From the early morning hours of the day, Alida looks after her crops of potatoes, peas, and gladiola flowers. What she enjoys most are the moments when she can have a meal and spend time with her husband. She is equally grateful to be selling her crops at the wholesale market in Tarma. Being responsible parents, she and her husband Percy spend time plowing other people’s land with the two bulls that they own. They earn an average of 60 to 70 PEN each day. Now she wants to improve her crops. Alida has plans to maximize her harvest of gladiola flowers since her crops are halfway through the growth cycle.

She is a member of the Communal Bank “Picaflores de Patay” and is receiving her fifth loan from MFP. Alida enjoys the time she gets to learn with the other members at each group meeting. She hopes to gain everyone’s support so that she can continue with her goals. Alida plans to plant seven sacks of gladiola seeds. For this reason, she will invest in the purchase of seeds and four sacks of natural fertilizers so that she can have a successful planting.

loans.use: to purchase gladiola seeds and four sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Diana Marbelly

texts.es:
Diana, de 33 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de León, tiene dos hijos de 15 y 3 años de edad respectivamente, ella es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de mariscos en un local ubicado en el mercado de la terminal de buses  de León. Inicio en este negocio a travez de su familia pues quien vendía mariscos era su madre, ambas trabajaban juntas vendiendo mariscos pero con el tiempo su madre se jubilo y le cedió el negocio ella lleva 5 años dirigiendo el negocio desde el retiro de su madre. 
Requiere el préstamo para comprar un freezer donde pueda almacenar sus mariscos. De esta manera podrá conservar mejor sus productos, reducir el gasto que le genera comprar hielo para mantener frescos sus mariscos. Su próxima meta es hacerle mejoras su local y comprar 2 termos para almacenar mariscos.
texts.en:
Diana, 33, lives in the city of León.  She has two children who are 15 and 3 years of age, respectively.  She’s a merchant.  She sells seafood in a stand located in the market in León’s bus terminal.  She started the business through her family because her mother sold seafood.  They both worked together selling seafood but her mother retired and passed the business on to her.  She’s been running it for the last five years since her mother retired.

She needs the loan to buy a freezer to store her seafood so that she can preserve her products better and reduce the cost of buying ice to keep it fresh.  Her next goal is to make some improvements to her stall and to buy two insulated chests to store the seafood.

loans.use: to buy a freezer to store her seafood.

loans.name: Kutatoi

texts.en:
Kutatoi is 26 years old, single and supports his parents. He operates a butchery, which he has been doing for the last two years.

He learned about KADET through a KADET customer. He has applied for his first loan of KES 40,000. He plans to purchase cows to slaughter and sell in his butchery, and he also wants to expand his butchery.

With the anticipated profit he will use it to open another butchery. His dream is for his business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase cows to slaughter and sell in his butchery, and he also wants to expand his butchery

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 24-year-old married lady. Elizabeth runs a retail shop in Voi. She has been in this business for the past year. 

Elizabeth has been a KADET client and this marks her first borrowing to finance her business. With this loan she plans to expand her business by purchasing sugar, salt, soft drinks, maize meal and wheat flour for her business. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand her business. 

Her dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: purchase sugar, salt, soft drinks, maize meal and wheat flour

loans.name: Abelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA”; este banco muy simpático está ubicado a 30 minutos de la Ciudad del Cusco en el poblado llamado Yuncaypata, este es un típico pueblito en el que se conserva toda la herencia andina pura, y viven todos en comunidad apoyándose en la época de siembra y cosecha, cuidando a sus hijos y a sus animales, es un pueblo muy bonito y es quechua hablante, está en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Abelinaa; la socia tiene 42 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solo vive con los de 16 y 14  años de edad;  la socia trabaja en agricultura  y también tiene animales menores, la socia tiene cuyes, gallinas, chanchos, ovejas,  la socia también tiene una tienda de abarrotes y se dedica a la venta de verduras, la socia en esta ocasión desea el crédito para comprar todo referente a productos de abarrotes como son, arroz, azúcar, fideos, harinas, leche, enlatados y otros productos que en la zona no se encuentra y escasea mucho. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de abarrotes como azúcar, arroz entre otros.
La socia agradece y valora el préstamo mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente como lo ha ido haciendo con sus anteriores créditos.
texts.en:
Abilina belongs to the "Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata" Village Bank.  It's a very nice bank located thirty minutes from the city of Cusco, in the village of Yuncaypata, a typical village where they keep up all the Andean traditions and everyone lives together in the community, helping each other out during planting and harvesting seasons, and caring for the children and animals. It's a very pretty Quechua-speaking village in the department of Cusco.

Abilinaa is forty-two, married, and has five children; only the fourteen- and sixteen-year-old live with her.  She works in agriculture and has young animals, including guinea pigs, hens, pigs, and sheep.  She also has a grocery store and she sells vegetables. 

At this time, Abilina would like a loan to buy all kinds of grocery items, like rice, sugar, noodles, flour, milk, canned goods and other items because these products can't be found in this area and people often run short. Abilina appreciates and values the loans she gets at the bank and she promises to make her payments in a disciplined manner as has with her prior loans.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of grocery items like sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Theary

texts.en:
Theary, pictured here, is a weaver, while her husband, Borin, is a rice farmer. They have been married since 1988 and have three sons and one daughter. Theary and her family live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Theary is asking for another loan of 500 USD to purchase materials to continue her weaving business. She will also use a part of her loan to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her weaving business and repair her house

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is married and blessed with four children.  For the last eighteen years, she has been selling dried and fried fish to make a living.  She has employed one person to help her to manage the business. She has been able to boost her business with her previous loans from Faulu Kenya.  In the next five years, she wants to become more financially stable. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy more fish for resale.

loans.use: To buy more fish.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 24 years old and a single lady. She has operated a retail shop for the last two years, with a monthly profit of KES 16,100.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a group of registered clients with KADET LTD, and she is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy sugar, sweets, soft drinks and wheat flour for sale.

She will save the anticipated profits  and pay school fees for her child. In future she hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy sugar,  sweets, soft drinks  and wheat flour for sale.

loans.name: Alasgar

texts.en: Alasgar is a 58-year-old man who has been engaged in livestock breeding for the last seven years. He is married and has four children. Alasgar breeds calves and sells them for a profit in the local bazaar. He raises the cattle for five to six months before selling them. His monthly income is 120 AZN. Alasgar applied for a loan of 1500 AZN. He will use the loan to purchase a cow, three bulls, and fodder. This will be his third loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase a cow, three bulls, and fodder.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Dina has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Dina has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Dina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Rajabek

texts.ru: Рачабек предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области он уже три года. Ему 23 года. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Он берет кредит для приобретения запчастей автомобиля.
texts.en: Rajabek offers a taxi service. He has been in this line of work for three years already. He is 23, married and has one child. He is requesting a loan to buy spare car parts.

loans.use: buy spare car parts

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a widowed woman with five children, all of whom are grown-ups. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a juice selling business and charcoal business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she also owns residential houses which contribute to her income. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transporting charcoal to her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to renovate her residential houses and purchase charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to renovate her residential houses and purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Claudia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Claudia del Carmen es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 27 años quien se dedica al comercio de ropa desde hace 3 años.  Ella inicio este negocio con unos ahorros luego con los préstamos ha ido aumentando.
Claudia inicio en Adim con crédito grupal y ahora se ha graduado a crédito individual, con el cual piensa comprar mercadería por lo que era necesario.
texts.en:
Claudia del Carmen, 27 years old, is a working woman and entrepreneur and has been selling clothes for the last 3 years. She began this business with some savings and later expanded it through loans.

Claudia started as a member of an Adim communal bank group and now she has advanced to an individual loan, with which she will buy necessary merchandise.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing merchandise

loans.name: Burul

texts.ru: Бурул 53 года, замужем. В поисках источника финансирования, в 2000 году Бурул начала свой бизнес в животноводстве, стартовав с покупки 4 голов овец.  Благодаря упорному труду Бурул, на сегодня в ее хозяйстве имеется 20 голов овец, что позволяет получать прибыль около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бурул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного скота. Доходы от кредита Бурул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Burul is 53 years old and married. In search of a source of funding, Burul in 2000 began her own business in animal husbandry, having started with the purchase of four heads of sheep. Thanks to the persistent hard work of Burul, her household today has 20 sheep which allows her to receive a profit of about 5,000 Som (KGS) per month. 

In order to further develop her business, Burul applied to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 50,000 Som (KGS) to purchase additional livestock. Burul plans to invest income from the loan to further increase the number of her domestic animals.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Andres 		Heliodoro

texts.es:
Don Andrés, de 58 años de edad, es originario de León , es padre de 7 hijos , el es comerciante , vende leche y también se dedica a la crianza de cerdo. Su nivel escolar es básico solo finalizo su sexto grado de la primaria. Aunque su experiencia en la agricultura la obtuvo desde muy joven cuando se iba a trabajar junto con sus  padres al campo. Hoy en día sus negocios solo son la crianza de cerdo y venta de leche. 
El realizo el crédito para compra de cerdos de desarrollo. Ya que le gustaría tener un granja de cerdos reproductores de raza y especializarse en su crianza para tenerlo en optimas condiciones y hacer su negocio mas sostenible. Pues su objetivo es darle un mejor nivel de  vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Don andrés, 58, is from León and is the father of seven children.  He works as a merchant selling milk, and also raises pigs.  His education went only as far as the sixth grade but he has much experience in agriculture since he began working with his parents in the fields when he was very young.  Now he earns a living raising pigs and selling milk.

He is requesting a loan to buy pigs and use them to produce breeds on a farm.  He wants to specialize in this type of breeding under optimum conditions and make his business sustainable.  His goal is to give his family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora is single with two children and all go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members. She  and has been in this business for 2 years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas,onions,tomatoes .  She works on retail basis seven days a week.  She is aspiring of buying a plot of land.  She resides in a rented house with access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas,onions,tomatoes

loans.name: Hipolito

texts.en:
Hipolito and his wife are from Mexico State and they moved to Merida city 7 years ago. Both are determined to start a new life and have a business. When they arrived to the city, they started with a food sales business that was accepted by the people of Merida and they had success. With this business, they could earn money and they decided to invest in another business selling shoes. Now they manage these two business and their sons support them in their businesses.

Hipolito comments that thanks to the income they earned from the businesses, he could educate his sons. At this moment they need capital to invest in shoes because he needs to have an inventory for this season as his demand always rises this time of the year. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of $ 475 USD and he promises to repay it in 5 months, at least.

**This text has been translated from the original business description**

Hipólito y su esposa son originarios del Estado de México, emigraron a la ciudad de Mérida hace 7 años convencidos de iniciar una nueva vida y poner un negocio. Al llegar a la ciudad, comenzaron vendiendo comida con muy buena aceptación, inclusive del negocio de las comidas surgió capital para invertir en la venta de calzado. A la fecha manejan los 2 negocios y sus hijos los apoyan en estas actividades. Menciona que gracias a los ingresos de los negocios han podido darles educación a sus hijos. En estos momentos les hace falta capital para incrementar sus inventarios de calzado, pues a fin de año la demanda se incrementa; es por lo anterior que están solicitando apoyo crediticio por la cantidad de US $ 450 pagaderos en 5 meses.

loans.use: purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Hannah would like to buy organic manure and build a temporary business premises for selling it.

loans.name: Pech

texts.en: Pech H. is 35 years old and works in a casino earning $6.30/day.  His wife (pictured here because H. was unavailable) does the same, and she also is a tailor in her extra time.  Hov and his wife have 1 daughter that has learned her mother's skills and helps with her tailoring projects.  H. will use this loan to buy 4 sewing machines for his wife and daughter.  They plan on starting a business to rent out the sewing machines and teach people how to use them so they can eventually work in the garment factory.  In the future, they would like to hire some employees themselves and start a small garment company.

loans.use: To buy four sewing machines

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Mrs. Anna E. is a good cook. She was taught cooking by her mother and for over 10 years, she has been cooking for her community. She hails from Asaba in Delta State. She is requesting a loan of $625 to expand her little restaurant business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for her restaurant

loans.name: Améwotoéna

texts.fr:
At 53 years of age, Mrs. Améwotoéna A. is married to a polygamous man and has four (4) children. Very active, her principal activity is the fabrication and sale of cassava flour, called "gari." This is a very profitable business because her customers are primarily wholesalers. Being unable to grow cassava herself anymore, she is satisfied with buying fields' worth of cassava and making the most use of it. Currently, she is very limited by her means because the demand has grown very high. Thus, she wants to increase her production in order to suitably satisfy her clientele. She is therefore asking for a loan of $400 in order to make her purchases at lower cost and to realize higher profits.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 53 ans, Madame A. Améwotoéna est mariée à un homme polygame et est mère de quatre (4) enfants. Très active, son activité principale est la fabrication et la vente de la farine de manioc « gari ». C’est une activité très rentable car sa clientèle est la plupart grossiste. Ne pouvant plus cultiver elle-même le manioc, elle se contente d’acheter les champs de manioc et l’exploiter. Aujourd’hui, elle est très limitée par les moyens car la demande est devenue très forte. Elle désire donc augmenter sa production afin de pouvoir satisfaire convenablement sa clientèle. Elle sollicite pour cela un crédit de $400 afin de pouvoir faire les achats à moindre coût et réaliser de bon bénéfice.

loans.use: To buy cassava to make gari

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago L. L. inherited a craft that his father practiced with great love and dedication. After his father’s passing, Santiago had to assume the responsibility of the shop, as well as of his brother and mother. He is also married and has a daughter of only two and a half years. Presently he is not making enough money to cover his family’s expenses.

Santiago is requesting a $250 loan in order to buy materials and have more products to offer. He is committed to repay the loan in four months. With your help, Santiago will manage to make a living for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Santiago L. L. heredó un oficio que su padre ejercía con mucho cariño y dedicación. Después de la muerte del papá de Santiago, él tuvo que hacerse cargo del taller, de su hermano y madre, además de que está casado y tiene una hija de apenas dos años y medio de edad. Actualmente no le está alcanzando para poder solventar todos los gastos que su familia representa.

Santiago está pidiendo un préstamo de US $250 para poder comprar materia prima y así poder tener más productos que ofrecer. El plazo que está dispuesto a pagar su dinero es de 4 meses. Con tu ayuda Santiago podrá sacar adelante a su familia que necesita de él.

loans.use: He needs money to purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca is well known in her community for the high quality handicrafts she and her family make. They use all kinds of materials to craft ornate forms which are highly prized by tourists. With the money she makes she is able to help her husband, a farmer, to support their family. The couple would also like to open a soft-drink stand as it would surely be successful in the hot jungle. They are confident that their hard work will benefit their four children. Please help them raise the funds they need to see this plan put into action.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rebeca, es muy conocida en su localidad por sus excelentes trabajos D. artesanía que produce junto a su familia, ella utiliza diversidad D. materiales con el que empieza muy hábilmente a formar distintas formas y figuras que se conjugan D. manera muy bella, para lograr hermosos productos que son muy solicitados por los visitantes que llegan hasta su localidad.Ella realiza esta actividad para contribuir económicamente con su familia y su esposo, quien se dedica a la agricultura. Juntos desean también tener lo necesario para lograr abrir un negocio D. venta D. gaseosas que debido al gran calor tiene una gran demanda. Confían en que todo el trabajo realizado, dará frutos en sus cuatro hijos a quienes aman inmensamente. Nosotros podemos contribuir con la suma que les hace falta , para que estos planes puedan realizarse.

loans.use: To set up a refreshment stand.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
In November of 1990, one month after her husband suffered an accident, Virginia began to wrap presents and sell items in her region, like earrings, necklaces, and tablecloths she made with fabric she obtained at a low price. She started to make money to be able to pay the expenses of her home and her children's education. Virginia dreams about seeing her children graduate from college so they will have a better future. Four years ago, the opportunity to sell shoes presented itself, which has given her good results since she lets her clients buy on credit.

However, the car that she uses to collect from her clients isn't working right now, so this is why she is requesting a loan of $750 which she will repay in 6 months. She will use the money to repair her car and to buy more merchandise to be able to have a larger variety of items and to be able to collect from her clients. With your help, Virginia will be able to give her three children an education.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

En noviembre de 1990 tras un mes de que su espos sufrió un accidente, Virginia se dedicó a envolver regalos y vender curiosidades de la localidad, como aretes, collares y manteles hechos por ella, con telas que conseguía a bajo precio, comenzó a sacar dinero para poder mantener los gastos de su casa y los de la escuela de sus hijos ya que Virginia sueña con que sus hijo terminen la universidad para que tengan un mejor futuro que el de ella. Hace cuatro años se le presentó la oportunidad de vender zapatos, lo cual le a dado mejores resultados, puesto que deja a crédito los zapatos a sus clientes.

Sin embargo el carro que utiliza para poder cobrarle a sus clientes actualmente se encuentra descompuesto, es por eso que Virginia Está solicitando un crédito de US $750 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Virginia podrá arreglar su carro y comprar más mercancía para poder darle variedad a sus artículos además de poder salir a cobrarle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Virginia podrá darle estudios a sus tres hijos.

loans.use: To repair her car which she uses to collect from her clients and to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.en: Rosa María is a twenty-three year old mother of three children, who sells men’s and women’s clothing in Altagracia, a community of Santo Domingo.  She runs the business in a rented house.  Rosa María buys the garments in the capital or in Elías Piña, a frontier city with Haiti.  Many of Rosa María's friends and neighbors visit her house day after day to purchase her clothing.  She hopes her business’ success will help her to support her family financially. With her loan, she will buy clothing in bulk to restock the inventory.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk to stock up her store

location.town: Altagracia VI Community, Santo Domingo N

loans.name: Amina

texts.fr:
Mrs. Amina A. was born in January 1973 in Gapé (Prefecture Zio), and has been selling smoked fish since she abandoned her studies in 1983. The mother of four (4) children, she takes care of her children by herself, thanks to the income from her business selling smoked fish. Mrs. A. struggles to run her business and make her children happy. She is asking for a loan in order to increase her buying power and to better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Amina née en Janvier 1973 à Gapé (P/Zio), est revendeuse de poissons fumés depuis qu’elle a abandonnée les classes en 1983. Mère de quatre (4) enfants, elle est seule à s’occuper des enfants grâce aux revenus de son commerce de poissons fumés. Madame A. se bat pour mettre en œuvre son activité et rendre heureux ses enfants. Elle sollicite un financement pour augmenter son pouvoir d’achat et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: To sell fish

loans.name: Atsou

texts.fr:
Born on March 1, 1977 in Lomé, Mr. Atsou M. married Miss Hétchéli Lawson who is a dressmaker. His primary business is raising laying hens in Agoè. He began this business in 2002, but with many difficulties related to building an enclosure for his poultry. With a first loan of US$ 1200, which he faithfully repaid, he was able to complete the construction of the enclosure and purchase 50 chicks. Once the chicks mature they each produce an egg a day. Mr. Atsou M. went on to sell these eggs in trays of thirty eggs each.

This loan in the amount of US$1200 which he is presently requesting will allow him to buy 350 chicks which will eventually replace his former layers. In this fashion, he will be able to maintain a constant supply of eggs for his customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Né le 1er mars 1977 à Lomé, Monsieur M. Atsou s’est marié à Mademoiselle LAWSON Hétchéli qui est une couturière. Son activité principale est l’élevage des poules pondeuses à Agoè. C’est au cours de l’année 2002 qu’il a démarré cette activité avec beaucoup de difficultés liées à la construction de l’enclos. Avec un premier crédit d’un montant de 500.000 FCFA qu’il a bien remboursé, il a terminé la construction de l’enclos et a acheté cinquante poussins. Les poussins devenus poules, elles pondent un œuf chacune par jour. Monsieur M. Atsou dispose ces œufs en plateaux de trente et procède à la vente.

Le crédit d’un montant de 500.000 FCFA qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter trois cent cinquante poussins qui viendront en remplacement des poules à reformer. Ainsi, il pourra maintenir à normale la fréquence de livraison d’œufs à ses clients.

loans.use:
Purchase of chicks

Achat de poussins

loans.name: Mujeres Progresistas De Almada Group

texts.es:
The group is composed of 20 hard-working women from the A. neighborhood of the city of Caacupé. The group is currently in the 5th cycle of the Enterprising Women program. A large number of the participants are recycling artisans—they transform car tires into items such as planters, flip flops, mats, and vases, among others.

The group is composed of 20 hard-working women from the A. neighborhood of the city of Caacupé. The group is currently in the 5th cycle of the Enterprising Women program. A large number of the participants are recycling artisans—they transform car tires into items such as planters, flip flops, mats, and vases, among others.

Others have traditional small grocery stores where people can buy food and household products, such as: meats, canned goods, rice, flour, sugar, and cleaning products, among others. Last, but not least, are the women who are street vendors who sell clothing and accessories for women, and others who sell cheese and manioc starch exclusively.

Their products are exhibited next to the main road that links Caacupé to the city of Tobatí and visitors like them very much. The group has participated in various fairs held in the city of Tobatí and their products were well liked by the tourists, who marveled at the ingenuity and delicate work of the artisans. This brought about good sales for their products.

The 20 women are managing an average line of credit of gs. 750,000 each. The group was created thanks to the services offered by the Fundación Paraguaya through Freddy Bordón, who is the advisor for the women’s groups in the Caacupé office. This is how he was able to bring together all the artisans of the neighborhood and form the group that bears the name “Mujeres Progresistas de A.” (Progressive Women of A.).

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

El comité está integrado por 20 señoras trabajadoras del barrio A. de la ciudad de Caacupé, el grupo esta actualmente en el 5to. Ciclo del programa Mujeres Emprendedoras, gran parte de las integrantes son artesanas recicladores y su trabajo lo realizan en la transformación de la cubierta de vehículos en objetos como, planteras (macetas), zapatillas (fit flops), alfombras, floreros, entre otros.

Otras poseen tradicionales despensas en donde la gente puede ir a comprar comestibles o insumos para el hogar como: carnes, productos enlatados, arroz, harina, azúcar, productos de limpieza, entre otros. Por último están señoras que realizan ventas ambulantes de diferentes mercaderías como ropas y accesorios para damas y otras que se dedican a la venta exclusiva de queso y almidón.

Sus productos son exhibidos al costado de la ruta principal que une Caacupé con la ciudad de Tobatí y la misma son muy apreciadas por los visitantes.El grupo como comité ha participado en varias exposiciones realizadas en la ciudad de Tobatí y sus trabajos fueron apreciados por turistas que quedaron maravillados por el ingenio y el trabajo delicado de las artesanas, esto trajo consigo un buen movimiento de ventas de sus productos.

Las 20 señoras están manejando una línea de crédito promedio de gs. 750.000 por cada integrante, este comité fue creado gracias a la promoción de los servicios que ofrece la Fundación Paraguaya por intermedio de Freddy Bordón quién es el asesor de comités de mujeres en la oficina de Caacupé y fue así como se logró juntar a todas las artesanas del barrio, formando el grupo que lleva por nombre “Mujeres Progresistas de A.”

loans.use: To buy tire automobile tire inner tubes for recycling and merchandise such as: sugar, yerba (an herb used to make a kind of tea), milk, cookies, manioc starch, and beef. It will also be used to buy women’s, men’s, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Loveness

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 37-year-old Loveness P.. She is widowed and has three children, ages 3, 13 and 19. In 2002, Loveness opened a liquor store. She has applied for a loan to buy additional stocks of beer and soda in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of beer and soft drinks.

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr:
Oumou Koné, 30, is married and has four children between 11 and 3 years old. She lives with her husband and children in Sogomougou district in Koutiala. Like many women in Mali, she did not have the opportunity of going to school and had to find a way to earn income from a young age. After numerous setbacks, she decided to sell local drinks three years ago.

She has received a share of three group loans and one individual loan through SORO YIRIWASO and all have been repaid approporiately. With this latest loan, she is intending to buy 5 sacks of sugar, 10 cases of bags of juice, and 70 plastic bags in Koutiala. The juice powder is mixed with water, flavoring, and sugar to obtain the local drink. Then this drink is put into bags and cooled for several hours. This work occurs daily, and sales are out of the home and at the market. Mrs. Koné's local drinks are very popular and she has a big daily turnover.

In future, she hopes to diversify her business by adding the dyeing of clothing.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Oumou koné à 30 ans, mariée, mère de 4 enfants (qui sont entre 11 et 3 ans). Elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants au quartier sogomougou de Koutiala. Comme beaucoup de femmes au Mali, elle n’as pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école et était obligée d’embrancher une activité génératrice de revenus dès son jeune age. Après beaucoup d’échecs, elle décida de vendre des boissons locales depuis trois ans.

Elle a bénéficié de trois prêts solidaires et d’un prêt individuel avec SORO YIRIWASO tous remboursés correctement. Avec le prêt actuel, elle compte acheter cinq (5) sacs de sucres, dix (10) cartons de sachets de jus et 70 sachets plastiques à Koutiala. La poudre de jus est mélangée avec de l’eau, des aromes et du sucre pour obtenir la boisson locale. Ensuite cette boisson est ensachée et mis au frais pendant quelques heures. Cette activité est menée chaque jour et la vente se fait à domicile et au marché. Les boissons locales de Madame Koné sont très appréciées et elle réalise des ventes importantes par jour.

Dans l’avenir elle compte diversifier son activité en y ajoutant de la teinture d’habits.

loans.use:
to stock up on ingredients for juice

Pour acheter des stocks de matière premières pour le jus

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria is 56 years old, she wasn’t able to finish elementary school, she is married and has 6 children.

She belongs to the Zepita community bank, she decided to became a member of the bank due to the need of capital to prepare “chicharron” (fried pork) and sell at the market of Zepita on Thursdays. She also joined the bank to make friends and share her problems with them; she doesn’t have family living close to the area. Her first loan of $115 USD (S/.300) was used to purchase 50 pounds of corn, 75 pounds of freeze-dried potato and 100 pounds of potatoes.

She increased her capital with the previous loans, now she raises the pork she uses to prepare chicharron. With the $200 USD (S/.500) loan, to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 3 pigs that she will raise.

Maria indicates that her business is getting better and by being with the bank she learns to be responsible and punctual. Her future dream is to expand her business and support her children to have their own business.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

María tiene 56 años de edad, su nivel educativo es primaria incompleta, es casada y madre de seis hijos.

Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal Zepita, decidió ser socia del Banco Comunal por falta de capital, para preparar chicharrón de chancho en el campo ferial de Zepita los días jueves y además quería tener amigas para compartir sus problemas, ya que ella no tiene familiares en la zona. De esa manera su crédito inicial fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles, con ello compró 2 arrobas de maíz, 3 arrobas de chuño, 1 quintal de papa.

Con todo sus préstamos anteriores aumento su capital, ya que ahora realiza el engorde de chanchos para degollar y preparar chicharrón de chancho, por ello con el crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 4 meses, invertirá en comprar 3 chanchos que engordará.

María, manifiesta que esta mejorando su negocio y además estando en el Banco aprende ser responsable y puntual, su sueño a futuro es ampliar su negocio y apoyar a sus hijos hasta que tenga sus negocios propios.

loans.use: Purchase 3 hogs

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 28 years old. She is married with one child, aged 5. She has been a firewood and bites seller since 2006. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 90 from her sales.

Fatma now hopes for a loan to buy more firewood to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to expand her business

loans.name: Kibibi's Riziki Haigawanywi Group

texts.en:
Kibibi is 26 years old. She is a divorced mother of three children, aged eight, six and one years old. She has been a charcoal and chapati seller since 2007. She works every day from 6 am to 8 pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Kibibi is now looking for a loan to buy more charcoal in order to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Kiwanja, who runs her own restaurant.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Phut

texts.en:
Mr. Phut P. is 31 years old, and he makes charcoal to sell and fishes in his area for a living. He has been operating his business since 2006, and he typically earns approximately US$8 per day. In addition, he is married to Mrs. Vorn Nak, who is a 29-year-old farmer. Phut has two children, both of whom are young and attend school.

To generate additional income, Phut is seeking a loan in the amount of US$1,000 to purchase three oxen to use in connection with his charcoal-selling business; more specifically, the oxen would be utilized to transport charcoal to customer's homes. Moreover, a portion of the loan proceeds would be used to grow rice and for his fishing operation.

loans.use: To purchase three oxen to transport charcoal to customer's homes

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi: Chị Phạm Thị  Thảo 52 tuổi tham gia Quỹ năm 1994. Trải qua hơn 10 năm tham gia Quỹ vay vốn phát triển kinh tế. Các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ đều được gia đình chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, gà và ngan. Hiện tại gia đình chị đang nuôi 20 con lợn thịt, 100 con gà và ngan. Thu nhập từ chăn nuôi hàng năm của gia đình là 35.000.000đ, tới đây gia đình chị có kế hoach đầu tư vốn vào chồng rau và cây ăn quả, gia đình chị có 2 con, 1 đang đi học, 1 con đã đi làm lương tháng ổn định 2.000.000đ/ tháng, chồng chị đi làm thuê thu nhập 50.000đ/ ngày. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 13.000.000đ đầu tư vốn vào làm vườn.
texts.en:
Chị Phạm Thị Thảo - 52 years old - joined the TYM Fund in 1994. Participating in the program for over 10 years has transformed her financial situation. With every loan, her family put the funds towards raising pigs and chicken. Currently her family is raising 20 pigs and 100 chicken. The annual income from raising livestock is 35,000,000 VND. Now the family has the plan to get capital to grow fruits and vegetables. Her family has 2 children - 1 is in school and 1 is working with a steady salary of 2,000,000 VND per month. Her husband works as a hired hand for 50,000 VND per day. This loan cycle, the family is asking for 13,000,000 VND to invest in their garden.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Growing Fruits and Vegetables

loans.name: Khakim

texts.en:
Khakim M., 47, and his wife are raising four children. They are his inspiration to work hard every day and continue with his business. When Khakim lost his job, he was left without steady income. After long suffering, he decided to open a grocery store near his house.

Khakim is trying to generate income not only for his family's consumption but also to be able to create savings for the dowries of his daughters and future weddings of all of their children, but it is very hard. Today Khakim is planning to increase the range of his inventory. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting 1200 USD for a term of 15 months. Support this man of much strength and courage to keep working! Your generosity can change his family’s lives.

loans.use: purchase more inventory

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Mr. Keo V. was born in 1955 and he now lives in Anlong Chamna village in Kampong Speu province. He is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar or wine. His wife, Mrs. Hang Im, is a grocer. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so Mr. Keo V. decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory.

Mr. Keo V. has six children, one of whom is a teacher while another one is a construction worker. Others two help their parents with the current business while the remaining two are attending the local school. His wife is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products for his wife's inventory

loans.name: Erika Pilar

texts.es:
ERIKA PILAR V. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Guerreras” ubicado en el Jr. Padre Gimer N° 129 del Distrito de Callería, tiene 29 años de edad, 02 hijos, su esposo es administrador, es socia 03 años de Manuela Ramos.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compro un poco de joyas, perfumes, vende en el mercado, a crédito, su cobranza es diario, vende en el mercado de Bellavista del Jr. Maya de Brito.

Con este préstamo de S/.3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará más joyas de productos Unique, perfumes, la venta es igual en el mercado a crédito, el cobro es diario, la venta crece cada vez más.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por apoyarla y así formar su pequeña empresa, es lo que más anhelaba.
texts.en:
Erika Pilar V. R. belongs to The Warriors (“Las Guerreras”) Community Bank, located in Jr. Padre Gimer N° 129 in the district of Callería. She is 29 years old, has 2 children, and her husband is an administrator. She has been a member of Manuela Ramos for 3 years. The first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos was for 300 soles. She bought some jewelry and perfumes that she sells in the market on credit. She recovers this daily. She sells her products in the market in Bellavista in Jr. Maya de Brito. With this loan of 3000 soles, she will buy more unique jewelry products and perfumes. She will sell these in the market on credit. Her recovery is daily, and her sales will grow more every time. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for supporting her and, because of this, she has begun her small business, which is what she wanted most.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more jewelry and perfumes so that her business will grow

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma has owned a small charcoal store in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for 2 years. She belongs to the Tusife Moyo group loan (Group code 2051). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. Every day, she works at her business for 7 hours. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Fatma is 30 years old, married, and has three children: ages 15, 8 and 4.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Tuichiboy

texts.en: Tuichiboy K. is 29 years old. He lives in the B.Gafurov region and he is married and has 3 children. He doesn’t have special education but, like many rural residents, he is engaged in the livestock business which brings in the general family income. Tuichiboy raises and sells livestock. Today he is applying to KIVA for financial support in the form of a business development loan of 1600 TJS for 6 months for the purchase of a pedigree bull.

loans.use: Purchase a pedigree bull

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: El señor Rene L. R. es soltero, y comenta que desde un año hubo recorte de personal en la maquiladora que el trabajo y el fue uno de las personas que liquidaron. Con el dinero que le dieron de la liquidación el prefirió en invertir en un negocio de abarrotes y esta funcionando muy bien, solo que el desea tener una tienda bien surtida, con variedad para que haya de todo tipos de articulo  para no perder clientes y satisfacer sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Mr. Rene L. R. is single and he says that a year ago there were job cuts in the factory where he works and he was one of the people they left go. With the money that they gave him with the termination he preferred to invest it in a grocery business and this is going very well, although he wishes to have a well-stocked store with a variety of items so that there are all kinds of items so as not to lose customers and meet their needs.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for his store

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega la señora María S. desde hace cinco años se dedica a su actividad de pulpería habiéndola establecido con mucho esfuerzo con el propósito de mantener a su familia compuesta por sus tres hijos los cuales busca la manera de cómo llevarles el sustento en sus estudios.

Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los productos de pulpería y así seguir adelante en este negocio
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, María S. for the past five years has dedicated herself to her small grocery store. Having established it with much effort her intention was to maintain her family composed of three children, and she is hoping to find a way for support them in their studies. Currently she has sought Ceprodel to be benefited with a loan to purchase products for her small grocery store and in that way continue moving forward in this business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase product for her small grocery store.

loans.name: Choinyambuu

texts.en:
Choinyambuu B. lives with her husband, daughter, and two granddaughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter is 31 and works for a local mining company. Both her granddaughters go to a local high school in Ulaanbaatar.

Choinyambuu has a small retail business selling pharmaceuticals. She started her business in 2001 by opening a pharmacy in the downtown area of Ulaanbaatar. As her business grew, she expanded by opening up a second location. As a trained pharmacist she is able to produce some of the medicines by herself. In the future, she hopes to open more pharmacies in attractive locations in the city. She requests a loan to purchase more medicine for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more medicine for her business

loans.name: Andres

texts.en:
Andres G. makes a living primarily from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. He is 67 years old, married and has two adult children. He lives in the town of Plaridel. Andres has been in business for over ten years.

In 2009, Andres joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Andres has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 PHP from PMPC. Andres is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be his second loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in fishing business

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
There are four borrowers who are jointly taking this small loan. Mrs. S. has been selected to be group leader by the other members. She is 28 and the mother of five children who are of school-age. She currently earns a living raising a few pigs from home. Additionally, she is a requirement worker for a construction company. She is married to Chantha, age 48, a military policeman.

Recently, S. sold her pigs to a slaughterer but she can't acquire another pig to raise due to the family's financial problems. Therefore, she has decided to seek a loan for capital to purchase pig-feed and a piglet to raise.

The other three borrowers are:

R., who has two businesses: distilling wine and raising pigs. She is looking for a loan to buy a motorcycle to ride and support her business action.

T., who will be using the loan to order mats, nets, and cradles to sell.

S., who will use the loan to repair an existing motorbike that has broken down.

loans.use: To purchase pig-feed and a piglet to raise

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine E. is from the village of Purok 4A, Barangay Santiago, Iligan City. She is 50 years old. Josephine is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In June 2009, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Josephine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Purok 4A, Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Istatkhon

texts.en:
H. Istatkhon is 29 years old. She has a son with her husband. Istatkhon has been running her own business for more than four years. She has a small saloon where she sells and rents traditional and national wedding dresses. Traditionally families in Tajikistan are large and consequently there are many marriages so Istatkhon has a lot of clients. The stability of her business allows her to make a considerable contribution to the family income. This is Istatkhon's second loan with IMON International and during the previous loan cycle she was accurate and precise in the loan payments. Istatkhon is requesting $ 1300 USD in order to purchase more wedding dresses.
Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. Tajikistan is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.
Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve agricultural production and the manufacturing sector nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.
IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase of wedding dresses

loans.name: Maria Usnara

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 35 años de edad que reside en el caserío Huaca de Barro del distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace un año que se dedica a la compra aves de corral en los caseríos cercanos y todos los dias viaja muy temprano al mercado de la ciudad para venderlas, este pequeño negocio le ayuda en parte con los gastos de su hogar ya que su esposo, al igual que la mayoría de hombres de la zona, trabaja eventualmente como peón de labores agrícolas.

María tiene tres hijas de 17, 14 y 8 años de edad que estudian en un colegio cercano al lugar donde viven. Ella sabe que el progreso de sus hijas depende de sus estudios, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de más animales y así hacer crecer su negocio para captar más ingresos y poder seguir educando a sus hijas.

Ella goza de muy buenas referencias entre los vecinos de Huaca de Barro, los cuales reconocen que es una persona responsable y muy colaboradora cuando se la necesita.
texts.en:
María is a 35-year-old mother who lives in the town of Huaca de Barro in the Mórrope district, two hours from the city of Chiclayo. For the past year she has earned her living buying poultry in nearby towns, and going to the city market early every day to sell them. Her small business helps out with some of the household expenses since her husband, like most of the men in the area, works intermittently as a farm laborer. María has three daughters, aged 17, 14, and 8 who go to school nearby. She knows that her daughters’ progress depends on their education. Consequently, she has decided that she needs to seek a loan for 1000 soles to buy more animals so she can grow her business and earn more money to keep educating her daughters. She enjoys high regard among her neighbors in Huaca de Barro, who recognize that she is a very responsible person who contributes whenever necessary.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy poultry to sell

loans.name: Ndoumbé

texts.fr: Ndoumbé P. est âgée de 34 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle fait du commerce de mangues en détail. Cette activité lui permet d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et prendre en charge la scolarité de ses enfants.

loans.use: Commerce de fruits

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Cette femme s’est spécialisée dans le commerce de tubercules, plus précisément d’ignames. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 2004 à Lomé dans son quartier d’Agbalépédogan. En plus de la vente d’ignames à la devanture de sa maison, elle vend aussi les soirs des frites d’ignames que savourent beaucoup de personnes ; ces frites sont appelées localement « koliko ». Pour s’approvisionner en ignames, elle se rend le plus souvent dans le Nord du Togo, à Bassar situé à une centaine de kilomètres de Lomé. Elle se rend à Bassar parce que les meilleures ignames du pays se trouvent dans cette localité. C’est pour lancer une nouvelle commande q’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES  pour acheter un taxi-bagages d’ignames ; le prêt servira également à s’approvisionner en condiments, en huile et acheter 05 sacs de charbons de bois pour la préparation de koliko. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant.
texts.en:
This is a woman who specializes in the commerce of tubers, yams to be exact.  She has been in this business since 2004 in Lomé in her district of Agbalépédogan.  In addition to selling yams in front of her house, she sells fried yams in the evenings that many people savor;  these fries are called koliko locally.  To supply herself with yams, she usually goes to northern Togo, in Bassar, located about 100 km from Lomé.  She goes to Bassar because the best yams in the nation are found in the area.  To start a new order for goods, she's requesting a WAGES loan to buy a luggage-taxi of yams;  the loan will also be used to stock up on condiments and oil and to buy 5 sacks of charcoal for making koliko.  She is married and the mother of one child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy yams and condiments for cooking

loans.name: Dudu

texts.en:
Dudu V., age 28, runs a variety shop and is requesting a loan to increase her stock and improve her product selections. Her husband is a policeman. They have three children, all of whom attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to further invest in her business by establishing a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To increase and improve her store inventory

loans.name: Granito De Arena Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Granito de Arena” esta representado por la señora Berna y conformada por 13 miembros del barrio Narciso Campero, en general las socias se dedican ala venta de productos como comida, frutas, cerámica y a actividades como empleadas domesticas, carpintería, albañilería y transporte de pasajeros. Sus negocios se encuentran en las diferentes zonas de la ciudad, por lo que no tienen mucha competencia con otros negocios similares, siendo sus negocios  rentables. Los socios indican que invertirán en incrementar el capital  de sus negocios de las diferentes actividades que tienen.
Las socias del  banco han demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en el pago de sus cuotas en el  anterior ciclo demostrando responsabilidad en todo momento. Según el reporte de la  central de riesgos  se puede ver que tienen buenos antecedentes crediticios en otras instituciones financieras.
texts.en:
The "Granito de Arena" group is represented by Ms. Bern and is composed of 13 members of the Narciso Campero neighborhood. In general, members sell products such as food, fruit, pottery and in activities such as domestic work, carpentry, masonry and the transport of passengers. Their businesses are located in different areas of the city, so there is not much competition with other similar businesses, so their businesses are profitable. The partners say that the they will invest the increase in capital in their businesses of different activities that they have. The bank's members have shown responsibility and timely payment of their amounts in the previous cycle at all times, demonstrating responsibility. According to the report from the central risk department, one can see that they have a good credit history with other financial institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational Capital

loans.name: Ilgar

texts.en: Ilgar was born in 1980. He lives in the Fuzuli region. 3 years ago he started a sheep breeding business. Now Ilgar is requesting a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 10 sheep to improve and increase his sheep breeding business.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep

loans.name: Jesus Hector

texts.es: El señor Jesús Héctor C. P. es casado con la señora Juanita López Olivares y son una pareja madura muy unida, ya todos sus hijos están casados. El señor Jesús Héctor trabaja para una empresa de comida congelada en el área de encargado desde hace 8 años. Ellos como una familia unida esta tramitando este crédito ya que desean ampliar su vivienda para una mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Jesús Héctor C. P. is married to Mrs. Juanita López Olivares. They are a very close couple, since all their children are already married.

Mr. C. works for a Frozen food company in the packing area, and has been there for the last 8 years. They are asking for a loan that will be used to remodel their home to make it more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build walls at a home

loans.name: Rosa Cefelmira

texts.es:
La señora ROSA CEFELMIRA, tiene 65 años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal SEMILLITAS CREATIVAS. La socia  presenta estudios hasta 5to D. secundaria, tiene 5 hijos quienes no dependen económicamente D. ella. ROSA se dedica a  la fabricación y perfilado D. calzado en un pequeño taller que tiene en su domicilio. Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevo soles, compró cuero, cuerina, hilos, pegamentos, etc.  Con este crédito D. 1,700 nuevos soles, comprará cuero, plantillas al por mayor, pegamento , hilos, hebillas, etc. 
Ella sueña con exportar su calzado a las diferentes provincias del Perú.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Cefelmira is 65 years old and lives in the District of El Porvenir, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She belongs to the Communal Bank “Semillitas Creativas” (Little Seeds of Creativity). Rosa completed her education through the 5th year of secondary school. Her five adult children are all financially independent.

Rosa designs and manufactures shoes in the small workshop in her home. With her first loan of 300 soles, she bought natural and artificial leather, thread, glue, and other supplies.

She is now requesting a loan of 1700 soles to buy leather, insoles in bulk, glue, thread, buckles, and other items. Rosa dreams of exporting her shoes to different provinces in Peru.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials & supplies for making shoes

loans.name: Katerero Twimukye Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
T. Damiano is 38 years old and married with three children between the ages of four and seven. He also takes care of three orphans. For the last four years, Damiano has run a business in Omwimasiro selling produce, from which he is able to make 50,000 UGX profit a week, although his business is affected by changes in the weather and price fluctuations.
Damiano hopes to expand his business further in order to be able to educate his children for future self-sustainability. He is requesting a loan to increase his stock by buying more produce to sell as a retailer.

loans.use: To buy more produce for resale

loans.name: Maura Estela

texts.es:
La señora Maura M. se dedica a trabajar arduamente en una organización en el municipio de Somotillo en el departamento de Chinandega con la finalidad de obtener los ingresos para llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación y beneficiar a sus hijos.
Actualmente ella tiene la necesidad de mejorar su vivienda y es por esto que solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los materiales de construcción porque sus sueños son tener un techo digno donde vivir y donde sus hijos se puedan desarrollar. Espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito será otorgado y así mejorará sus condiciones.
texts.en:
