Mrs. Maura M. dedicates herself to working hard in an organization, in the municipality of Somotillo, in the department of Chinandega, with the goal of earning an income for a means of support for her household and to benefit her children. Currently, she needs to improve her household and for this reason, she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of construction materials. Her dreams are to have a decent home and to live where her children can thrive. She really hopes that her loan will be granted and then she will be able to improve her circumstances.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 45 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia.
Desde hace 2 años intensificó sus labores ganaderas, vendiendo animales (vacas y toros) en las ferias ganaderas de su localidad. Asimismo, vende la leche de sus vacas después de ordeñarlas por las mañanas. Paralelo a esto, cultiva papa, quinua, trigo y maíz, los que vende al por mayor en el mercado de abastos de su ciudad.
Para estas tareas cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa, ya que es la principal actividad económica para su familia, por lo que uno de los planes de Pedro es sembrar pastos y forraje para alimento de los animales que piensa adquirir en el futuro, a fin de tener un establo ganadero. 

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, se siente contento de ser un nuevo integrante en su banco comunal y está muy deseoso de participar activamente con su grupo. El dinero que solicita lo utilizará para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para los pastos con los que alimenta a sus animales, pues de ello depende su buena producción de leche y peso, para su venta.
texts.en:
Pedro is 45 years old, and lives with his wife and their two children in their own house. For two years he has been stepping up his livestock breeding work, selling animals (cows and bulls) in the livestock markets in his town. He also sells the milk from his cows after milking them every morning. Parallel to this, he grows potatoes, quinoa, wheat, and corn, which he sells wholesale in the wholesale food market in his city.

For this work, he counts on the help of his wife, since it is the main business for the family, so therefore one of Pedro's plans is to plant grass and forage for feeding the animals that he thinks he will buy in the future, in order to have livestock stable.

This is the first time that he has a loan with MFP, he is happy to be a new member of his community bank and is very eager to actively participate with his group. The money that he is requesting will be used for the purchase of fertilizers for the grasses, with which he will feed his animals, since he depends on them for good production of milk and weight to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for the farming of grasses

loans.name: Hum

texts.en:
Mrs. Hum N. is 49 years old and lives in Dak Por village in Takeo province. She is a coconut seller and her husband, Mr. Chantha Kheng, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice to support his family living. This couple has a child who is enrolled in the local public school.

Although this family tries to work hard with their businesses, they still earn less income than needed to support their family. Thus they want to start a new business breeding a cow but they do not have enough money to buy it. So Mrs. Hum N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en:
Godwin sells electronics and electrical materials at retail prices to his customers.  He has been in this business for a long time. He hopes to own an electronics company in the future.  

He is 45 years old and married with four children.  His wife sells building materials to support their home. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction with his customers. He is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more electronics to sell.  He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell

loans.name: Lucina

texts.en: Lucina, 41 years old, is a married woman from Agusan Del Sur. She invested in rice farming in 1995. She still does farming now with her husband. She said that farming is a big help to her family. It gives them food and is also a source of income. She wants this business of hers to prosper. She applied to CEVI to have financial support for her business. She asked for a loan, which amounts to PHP 5,000. With this amount, she will be able to buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Luna Nueva I Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama LUNA NUEVA, porque comentan que a partir de este momento han comenzando un nuevo momento en su vida y, uno muy importante. Está ubicado en la comunidad de Zapotlan, perteneciente al municipio de Zapotlan de Juárez en Hidalgo y, es un grupo conformado por 10 integrantes.
María Esperanza Sánchez E.  es integrante del grupo, tiene 38 años y dos hijos de 3 y 4 años es casada y estudio la secundaria, se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos (chalupas, enchiladas, taquitos dorados, tostadas) desde hace dos años. Comenta que quiere su préstamo para comprar mesas para su negocio ya que por el momento cuenta con dos mesas y ya le son insuficientes para atender a sus clientes. Quiere que sus hijos crezcan y estudien una carrera con el objetivo de ser alguien importante en la vida.  
Ivonne M. Rodríguez es la presidenta del grupo, vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos de 14, 11 y 7 años, durante dos años se ha dedicado a la renta de videojuegos, es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a su familia y trabajo, es considerada por el reto del grupo como una buena líder. Requiere de su préstamo para comprar refacciones de los videojuegos y poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a las personas que asisten a hacer uso de estos. Ella tiene muchos deseos de conocer el mar con su familia y por eso se esmera en su trabajo. 
Esta foto fue tomada en la casa de la Sra. María Luisa Sánchez E.,  integrante del grupo LUNA NUEVA, que está ubicado en la cabecera municipal de Zapotlan de Juárez en el Estado de Hidalgo. Es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos de 13 y 7 años, estudio la secundaria y, se dedica a su taller de costura que inició hace 22 años, hace pantalones y shorts dependiendo de la temporada. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilo y así poder atender los pedidos que tiene ya pactados con algunas maquilas cercanas a su domicilio. Tiene la inquietud de poder apoyar a las mujeres de su localidad, ofreciéndoles empleo para que tengan un mejor nivel de vida.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son:

N. T. NEYDA ANGELICA	VENTA DE COSMETICOS

S. J. MARIA ELENA	VENTA DE COMIDA

P. S. BRISEIDA YEENIA	VENTA DE LENCERIA POR CATALOGO

E. C. NATALIA EDITH	VENTA DE CALZADO Y ROPA

V. A. PATRICIA	PAPELERIA Y MERCERIA

S. E. MA ADELAIDA	VENTA DE PERFUME Y LENCERIA

S. B. YESSICA MARLEN	VENTA DE ZAPATO POR CATALOGO
texts.en:
This group is called "LUNA NUEVA" (New Moon) because they say that from this point forward a new, very important, movement has begun in their lives. It is located in the Zapotlan community of Zapotlan de J. in Hidalgo. The group has ten members. Maria is a member of the group and is 38 years old, is married, and has two children, ages 3 and 4. She has a junior high school education, she sells Mexican food (chalupas, enchiladas, taquitos, tostadas), and has been doing so for the past two years. She tells us that she is requesting this loan in order to buy more tables for her business. At the moment she only has two and they are not enough to serve all of her customers. She wants her children to grow up and study a career that will make them important in life. Ivonne is the president of the group. She cohabitates and has three children, ages 14, 11, and 7. For the past two years she’s been in the business of renting video games. She is a very responsible person, dedicated to her work and family. The rest of the group considers her to be a good leader. She needs this loan in order to buy new video games to be able to offer better service to her customers. She has a great desire to see the ocean with her family some day. This is why she works so hard. This photograph was taken at María’s home, also a member of the “Luna Nueva” group. She is a single mother with two children, ages 13 and 7. She has a junior high school education and has a sewing shop that she started 22 years ago. She makes pants and shorts depending on the season. She is requesting this loan in order to buy thread, to be able to deliver her current orders. She really would like to help the ladies in her neighborhood, by offering them employment and giving them the opportunity to improve their lives. The other members are: Neyda – Cosmetic Sales Maria Elena – Food Sales Briseida – Catalog linen sales Ntalia Edith – Clothing and shoe sales Patricia – Paper goods Ma Adelaida – Perfume and linen goods Yessica – Shoe sales via catalog

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory and supplies

loans.name: Shella May

texts.en: Shella May M. is from the village of Nicdao, Baungon, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old. Shella May is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Shella May owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling gasoline in the local community. Shella May has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Shella May joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shella May has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Shella May is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Shella May from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: God Bless Business Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “God Bless Business” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are small-scale salespeople. They have come to SMT, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone, to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each borrower in order to expand the size and quality of their businesses. Consequently, they will be able to better support their children.

Salamatu K. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group of borrowers. Salamatu was born in Lunsar, a small town in northern Sierra Leone. She is twenty-eight years of age, married to a businessman, and they have two children. Salamatu sells palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), vegetable oil, ground-nut/peanuts, soaps, dishes, rubber bowls, etc. She has been a businesswoman for five years. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items in wholesale to add to her current ones.

loans.use: To buy palm-oil, vegetable oil, ground-nut/peanuts, soaps, dishes, rubber bowls, etc.

loans.name: La Familia Renacer 3,4 Group

texts.en:
Sergida is the coordinator of her group, L. Familia Renacer (The Family Reborn), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding S., a large city known for tobacco production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Sergida is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling a variety of items including mostly products for salons, but also pants and shirts. She will use the profits to invest in new doors and windows and for her home as well as school supplies for her children. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy products for salons plus pants and shirts to sell

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. JOSEFA TIENE 51 AÑOS, ESTA CASADA Y TIENE CONCO HIJOS. ELLA PERTENECE AL GRUPO "EL TRIUNFO" FORMADO POR 9 INTEGRANTES QUIENES LA ELIGIERON COMO SECRETARIA D. LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO. ELLOS VIVEN EN EL DISTRITO D. CARABAYLLO.
HACE SEIS AÑOS, LA SRA. JOSEFA EMPEZÓ CON SU BODEGA, QUE SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN SU DOMICILIO Y TIENE D. NOMBRE "EVA MARÍA". EMPEZÓ CON MUY POCO CAPITAL CON LA IDEA D. APOYAR A SU ESPOSO EN LOS GASTOS D. LA CASA. LE HA IDO BIEN, PERO ELLA SIGUE TRABAJANDO CON EL MISMO EMPEÑO Y ENTUSIASMO PARA PODER HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO.
SU PRÓXIMA META ES CONVERTIR SU BODEGA EN UN MINIMARKET.
EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA D. VITRINAS PARA SU BODEGA.
texts.en:
MRS. JOSEFA IS 51 YEARS OLD. SHE IS MARRIED AND HAS 5 CHILDREN. SHE BELONGS TO THE “EL TRIUNFO” GROUP WHICH IS MAD. UP OF 9 MEMBERS. THEY ELECTED HER SECRETARY OF THE GROUP’S BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THEY LIVE IN THE CARABAYLLO DISTRICT. SIX YEARS AGO MRS. JOSEFA OPENED A WINE STORE. IT IS LOCATED IN HER HOME AND IS CALLED “EVA MARÍA”. SHE BEGAN WITH VERY LITTLE CAPITAL, WITH THE IDEA OF HELPING HER HUSBAND WITH HOUSEHOLD EXPENSES. IT HAS GONE WELL BUT SHE CONTINUES TO WORK WITH THE SAME DETERMINATION AND ENTHUSIASM IN ORDER TO EXPAND HER BUSINESS. HER NEXT GOAL IS TO CHANGE HER WINE STORE INTO A MINIMART. SHE WILL INVEST THE LOAN SHE HAS APPLIED FOR IN THE PURCHASE OF DISPLAY CABINETS FOR HER WINE STORE.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: SHE WILL BUY DISPLAY CABINETS FOR HER WINE STORE

loans.name: Determination Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Rose describes herself as hard-working and someone who loves selling and serving customers. She is 59 years old and is the leader of the 'Determination' borrower group, made up of six members.  Rose trades in vegetables like tomatoes in the community market, the business through which she makes income to support her family. 

Like many vegetables, tomatoes provide much flavor to local sauces and soups and almost every local dish contains tomatoes. This makes selling tomatoes a profitable business. Rose is excited to be taking out this loan, which she plans to invest in the purchase of  four boxes of tomatoes to expand her market. Rose also engages in farming as her secondary business. She hopes to mobilize more savings to rent a kiosk to improve her business

Rose is married to a farmer but they do not have any children. The other members of the group are mostly farmers. She describes her group members as being loyal and as the leader she ensures regular meeting attendance and repayment of loan installments.

loans.use: To purchase boxes of tomatoes

loans.name: Severa

texts.en:
Severa L. is a 44-year-old married woman from the village of Lapasan Cagaya de Oro City. She and her husband have 4 school-age children. To earn a living, Severa owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. More specifically, her primary source of income is derived from buying and selling of rice in her local community. Severa has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2004, Severa joined HSPFI to gain much-needed access to financial services. In turn, she was able to engage in business activities and to thereby improve her standard of living. Recently, Severa successfully repaid a previous loan in the amount of 28,000 PHP from HSPFI. This prior loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Severa is now requesting another loan, this time in the amount of 31,000 PHP ($675), which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. Notably, this loan would be the twelfth loan taken out by Severa from HSPFI. She plans to use any additional revenue generated from the business as a result of this loan to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and its reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To improve and expand her business by purchasing additional products

location.town: Lapasan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Baljid

texts.en: Baljid D. is 46 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in Arhangai province, central part of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her elder son is a student and her younger son attends a local middle school. Her husband makes a variety of wooden products including home furniture. Baljid operates a used-clothing retail business which she began in 2004 with the help of her family. She is getting more customers every day. Baljid started her business with the working capital of 1,000,000 MNT, but now it exceeds 3,000,000 MNT. She would like to expand her business and says, "My only wish is to be able to support my children to be better people in the future”. Baljid is requesting a 1,050,000 MNT loan to purchase clothing in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia at a wholesale price.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack O. A. is thirty-two years old, is single, and does not have any children yet. His business is located at a busy estate in Mombasa known as Barsheba. Mombasa is in the coastal region of Kenya and is well-known for its many many tourist attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian Ocean’s white beaches.

Shadrack owns a general store near the residential area known by the name Shad. He has been selling such items as rice, flour, oil, detergents, sugar and other items to the local people for the last seven years. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that he has to run the business all by himself because he believes that it always needs his supervision. Thus, he is not able to attend to many other personal matters as all his time is spent in the business.

Shadrack is using his Kes 60,000 loan to buy more general items to expand his business. He hopes to diversify and grow a tour company which he has already started. He says he has initiative and describes himself as innovative and smart.

loans.use: To increase his stock of flour, sugar, oil, snacks and detergents

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es:
María de 37 años, vende carne de cerdo en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

Cuando ella era pequeña su familia vendía carne de cerdo para poder mantenerse económicamente, cuando ella se caso también decidió tener esta actividad para mantener su familia, poco a poco comenzó a comprar cerdos y tener un criadero. Ahora ella trabaja con ayuda de sus hijos vendiendo carne de cerdo, ella los comprar y después lo mata para vender la carne. 

Ella vende la libra de cerdo a $2.00, por lo que el préstamo lo quiere para comprar mas cerdos para criarlos. En el futuro quiere tener su propio local porque ahora el criadero lo tiene en el patio de su casa.
texts.en:
María sells pork products in front of her house. She lives in Guasmo de Guayaquil, an urban area where most of the residents are informal merchants.

When she was a young girl, her parents sold pork to support their family financially. When María got married, she decided to pursue the same line of work to support her own family. With a little bit of effort, she was able to buy some pigs and build her own pig pen. Now she works with the help of her children selling pork. She buys the pigs and later butchers them to sell the meat.

María sells the pork for $2.00 per pound. She will use the loan to buy more pigs to raise. In the future, she wants to have her own shop because she currently operates her business in her front yard.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire more pigs

loans.name: Suhair

texts.en:
Suhair is a 30-year-old wife and mother of three daughters and two sons. Her husband, Ismael, is a plumber who has been working for 10 years.  Ismael has his own workshop.  He does plumbing and installs water networks for new houses and buildings, in addition to selling pieces of water networks.

Ismael is a National Palestinian Authority employee and a plumber. After 10 years, Ismael needed new tools for his profession. Suhair suggested taking a $1,500 loan from FATEN for this purpose.

Ismael appears in the picture at his workshop.

loans.use: To purchase plumbing tools

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma B. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 32 years old. Gemma is single. To make a living, Gemma owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products like 'yema' (a Flipino delicacy made from condensed milk and sugar) in the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gemma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Gemma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: C5281 New Life Group

texts.en:
Donatha is 36 years old and married with two children who are 12 and 17 years old.  Donatha is the leader of a group called “New Life” and this group has owned a public secretariat since 2005.  The business hours are from early in the morning until late in the evening.

Donatha and her team need to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, they will expand their business by buying some additional equipment such as computers, etc.  With additional computers, the number of their clients will increase; thus, the profits will allow this team to keep reinvesting for better financial stability.

loans.use: To buy some additional equipment

loans.name: Mariana Ines

texts.es:
La Señora Mariana C. es socia del banco comunal Renacer Uncovia, vive por el sector de Uncovia en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por sus bellos paisajes, su centro histórico  que fue proclamado el primero de diciembre como patrimonio de la humanidad.
 
Doña Mariana se dedica al comercio de cosméticos en especial de la marca de Yanbal, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 4 años, sus productos los vende de lunes a viernes en el tiempo libre que tiene, que es cuando sus hijos están estudiando.
 
La Señora Mariana tiene de 36 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y su segundo hijo en la escuela, su esposo trabaja como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendado.

Se encuentran en su cuarto ciclo y los créditos anteriores le han beneficiado para crecer en su negocio. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más cosméticos como perfumes, cremas, etc.
 
Su meta es seguir trabajando para poder comprar su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariana C. is a member of the Renacer Uncovia Communal Bank, she lives around the Uncovia area in the city of Cuenca, a city known for its beautiful landscapes, and its historic center was declared December 1st as a world heritage site.

Mrs. Mariana sells makeup especially Yanbal brand, work that she has being doing for some 4 years, she sells the products Monday through Friday in the spare time that she has, which is when her children are in school.

Mrs. Mariana is 36 years old, is married and has 2 children who are 17 and 8 years old, her first son is in high school and the second is in elementary school, her husband works as a private employee, they don’t have their own home which is why they rent.

This is Mrs. Mariana’s fourth loan and the previous loans have helped her grow her business. The new loan is to buy more makeup and items like perfumes, creams, etc.

Mariana’s goal is to keep working to buy her own home.

loans.use: To buy creams, perfumes, and makeup.

loans.name: Anhbayar

texts.en: Anhbayar O. is a 22 year old single man who lives with his parents and siblings in Hovd province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. His mother works as a cook. Two of his siblings attend university while his other two siblings attend local school. Anhbayar operates a raw material retail business in his town. He began his business in 2005 with the help of his brother and after hard work and determination, has built a stable operation. He is planning to purchase many goats at wholesale price in order to sell in the upcoming winter when prices for cashmere from goats might rise. Anhbayar is a business-minded and well-balanced man. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more goats to sell for profit.

loans.use: To purchase goats

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn P. is 30 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. She is from the village of Mabini, Baliangao. To make a living, Jenalyn grows assorted crops to sell. Out of this activity, Jenalyn is able to earn a monthly net income of 4000 PHP. 

In 2006, Jenalyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jenalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Jenalyn is requesting her tenth loan of 3,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm supplies. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Mabel Esther

texts.es: Mabel Rodríguez  tiene 46 años y vende ropa elegante para damas y niñas, en su negocio variedades Luca,  lo cual hace al por mayor y detal. Ella es casada y con dos hijos en las edades de 18 y 21 años de edad , se dedicó al negocio desde muy joven cuando llegó a Barranquilla con la ilusión de cursar estudios superiores , pero como no tenia como pagarlos decidió trabajar en almacenes de ropa, donde adquirió su experiencia, y una vez nació su primer hijo se retiró del trabajo como empleada y con la liquidación de sus prestaciones sociales, emprendió su sueño de ser empresaria, que fortaleció con financiamientos por parte de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la que logró ampliar su infraestructura física, y  tener mayores inventarios con los que ha conseguido incrementar el numero de clientes. Ella cuenta que en el año 1992 dio inicio a su negocio, pero como invirtió en la  compra   del local y en dos vitrinas, se quedó sin capital para surtir, así fue como acudió  a su cuñada quien como operaria de una fabrica de ropas la apoyó, así Mabel compraba telas e insumos y ella fabricaba de acuerdo a los diseños que  esta última proponía. En  el año 1996, acudió en un grupo solidario a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización que desde ese momento  le ha dado la mano, ella inició con $300.000 COP y hoy está aplicando a un crédito de $1.400.000 COP, por la línea de  credikiva, que es  el octavo financiamiento que hace a esta organización; con él comprará un computador portátil para el registro financiero y el control administrativo de su microempresa, que en la actualidad está muy bien estructurada y con éste equipo mejorará los tiempos de control. Mabel Rodríguez se siente una mujer muy exitosa y esto lo ha logrado con el apoyo de su familia y su gran capacidad de resistirse ante las adversidades trabajando de buena fe; así ha conseguido aumentar la calidad de vida de su familia y fortalecer su espíritu libre e independiente y auto sostenible. Su sueño es tener una sucursal que fortalezca la rotación de inventarios y aumente sus utilidades. Mabel cuenta que en su negocio le ha tocado ingeniárselas, para que las nuevas tendencias de la moda no la dejen por fuera del mercado, porque sus estilos son clásicos y gustan a un perfil especial de mujeres y niñas en las fiestas especiales como grados primeras cominuiones y eventos muy formales .
texts.en: Mabel Rodríguez is 46 years old and sells elegant clothing for women and girls in her varieties shop, Luca, at wholesale and retail prices. She is married and has two children aged 18 and 21 years old.  She has been in business since a young age when she arrived in Barranquilla with the dream of completing Higher education studies, but as she was unable to pay for them she decided to work in a clothing department store where she gained her experience.  Once her first child was born she left her job and, using her social security benefits, she fulfilled her dream of being a businesswoman. She strengthened her business with financing from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organisation which allowed her to extend her physical infrastructure and increase her stock levels, and so increase her client base. She tells us that when she started her business in 1992, she had no capital to supply as she had invested it in buying the shop and two glass cabinets, so she went to her sister-in-law who worked as a machine operator in a clothing factory. Mabel bought materials and supplies and worked according to the designs suggested by her sister-in-law. In 1996 she joined the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo group, an organisation which has lent her a hand ever since. She started out with $300,000 COP and today she is applying for a loan of $1,400,000 COP, via Kiva, which is the eighth loan that she will have had from this organisation. With the loan she will purchase a laptop computer to record her finances and manage the administration of her small business, which is already well structured and with this piece of equipment she will improve the way that she manages her time. Mabel Rodríguez feels that she is a very successful woman and has achieved this with the support of her family, and due to her capacity for resistance when faced with adversities while working in good faith. This has allowed her to improve the quality of her family's life and strengthen her free, independent and self-sufficient spirit.  Her dream is to have an office to build her stock rotation and increase her profits.  Mabel says that her business has taught her to manage her profits so that new trends in fashion do not put her out of business, because her classic styles appeal to a special type of women and girls attending special parties such as first grade communions and very formal events.

loans.use: To buy a laptop computer to record her finances and manage the administration of her small business.

loans.name: Fairness Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “Fairness” group. They are small-scale businesswomen in the northern city of Makeni. They have requested a loan of SLL 1,400,000 for each person in the group. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses. 

Rugiatu K. (pictured in the right) is the leader of this group. Rugiatu was born in Makeni. She is about forty years old and married to a businessman. They have four children. Rugiatu has twenty-two years of experience in business. She sells palm oil, rice, and clothing. With her share of this loan, she will buy gallons of palm oil, bags of rice and lots of clothing to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, rice and clothing to add to her stock

loans.name: Big

texts.en: Big S., 33, is a farmer, earning an income of USD 3 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for the rubber plantation. Her husband is a taxi-driver, earning an income of USD 6 per day. The family has to spend USD 41 on food, USD 3 on electricity supply, and USD 5 on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a machine to cut firewood for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a machine to cut firewood

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 22-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents. He helps his father with the family’s income. This young man opened a barber shop in 2002 in his town. Because of his good business reputation, he was able to build a good number of customers who are very satisfied with his work. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to remodel his shop’s decor to attract more customers and then increase his revenue.

loans.use: To renew his shop’s decorations

loans.name: Samuel A.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the SLMWBO School, in Mayawlaw village, near Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. This school was founded in 1982 by the SLMWBO Mission to provide education to the children of this community. 

This is the first loan that the members of this institution are accessing from Kiva lenders through SMT. With the help of this loan, some members of staff will start a small business and those who are already running small businesses will invest the loan into their business. Some of the staff members will be using the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay either for their children in their education or pay for themselves to pursue further studies. Others will use their loan in home building projects.  

Samuel A. K. is the leader of this group of teachers. Age forty-two, Mr. K. is a husband and also father to five children. A native of Maraka village, Mr. K. has been in the teaching profession for twenty-eight years now. He has requested for this loan in order to improve his life. He will invest part of the loan in business and use the rest to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: For business investment and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Ikuá David Group

texts.en:
The Ikua David Group of San Ignacio, Misiones, is engaged in general trade. Mrs. Sonia G., for example, sells perfumes, toys and cleaning supplies, among other things. She is asking for a loan to expand her suite of products to better meet customer needs.

With this loan the group moves to the 2nd level, and they are very encouraged to work as a team. They want to continue working in a responsible and united way to reach higher levels of the program.

loans.use: Buying enamels, toys, school supplies, cleaning supplies, toiletries, etc.

loans.name: Rubyrosa

texts.en:
Rubyrosa M. is from the town of Guibang, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 32 years old. Rubyrosa is married and has 3 infant children. To make a living, Rubyrosa owns & operates a business providing electronic loads and billiard playing to the local community. Rubyrosa has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Rubyrosa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rubyrosa has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. That loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. 

Rubyrosa is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 6th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos Alberto L. P. tiene 40 años, vive en Unión Libre vive con la compañera y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Carlos se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial Murillo y los vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es superarse.

Le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto L. P., 40, is living with his spouse and child in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province. He has one child.

The members of the “SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS” communal bank located in Amarillos which belongs to Ventanas Canton are short cycle corn and rice farmers.

Carlos farms corn and rice.  He buys his products at Comercial Murillo and sells them there as well.

He is requesting the loan to plant corn and rice, to buy farming supplies and fertilizer for his crops.   Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  The challenges he faces are infestations, illnesses and the variations in the weather.  

His dream is to get ahead.  He enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and fertilizer for the crops.

loans.name: Escolastica

texts.es: La Sra. Escolástica vive en la comunidad D. el Torno distante a 29 km D. la ciudad capital, es D. ocupación comerciante D. productos D. la medicina natural, el destino del crédito es para comprar una computadora para los estudios D. sus hijos, La Sra. Escolástica tiene  tres hijos D. los cuales uno esta a su cargo, su esposo se dedica a la venta D. madera, hace unos dos años que se dedica a esta ocupación; se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo financiero que se le ha dado, es nacida en el departamento D. Potosí a su corta edad se vino a trabajar a esta ciudad donD. formo su familia y ahora esta feliz con su trabajo y ver a su familia con mejores condiciones D. vida.
texts.en: Ms. Escolástica lives in the community of Torno, a 29 kilometer distance from the capital city.  She works as a natural medicine trader. The loan is for the purchase of a computer for her children's education. Ms. Escolástica has three children, of whom one is still dependent. Her husband has been dedicated to selling wood for the past two years. She feels grateful to the institution for the financial support that has been given. She was born in the Potosi region and came to work in this city at a young age where she started a family. She is now happy with her work and seeing her family in a better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a computer

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar tiene 33 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la crianza y venta de animales menores. Con estos negocios él se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia y de solventar su economía diaria.

Edgar desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la producción de sus animales y percibir mayores ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Edgar is 33 years old, single, and lives with his family in the Olmos district.  Olmos is an agricultural area of considerable commercial activity that is located in the province of Lambayeque, more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Edgar works in raising and selling small animals.  With this business he is responsible for providing for his family's daily expenses.  Edgar would like to purchase nutritious food for the animals to improve their health and breeding, and thus increase his profits.  He has requested a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase nutritious food for his livestock.

loans.name: Fabiola Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señora Fabiola T. es socia del banco comunal La Paz vive por el cantón Girón, el mismo que es reconocido por sus Valles, sus lugares turísticos, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, son personas muy amables y de un gran carisma.

La Señora. Fabiola tiene 34 años y vive en unión libre, tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 13 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja  solo para sus gastos personales, su segunda hija estudia en el colegio. Su esposo labora en un taller propio en donde confecciona ropa deportiva, no tiene casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

Doña Fabiola es oriunda de la provincia de los Ríos, ha llegado a la ciudad hace 6 años. Ella trabaja en una pollería, esta actividad  la realiza hace 2 años, labora de domingo a domingo  desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche.
 
Se encuentra en el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa como: blusas, camisetas,pantalones, etc. para iniciar con este negocio.
 
Su meta es  terminar su casa que está construyendo en Babahoyo.
texts.en:
Fabiola T. is a member of the “La Paz” (Peace) Communal Bank.  She lives in the Girón canton.  This canton is known for its valleys, its tourist locations, its people who are devoted to commerce, raising animals, and farming.  They are very kind people with a great deal of charisma.

Fabiola, age 34, is in a common-law-marriage.  She has two children, ages 18 and 13.  Her first child works for his personal expenses.  Her second child attends school.  Her husband works in his own shop where he makes sportswear.  She does not have her own house; they rent where they live.

Fabiola is from the Ríos province, and she came to the city six years ago.  She has been working in a poultry store for two years.  She works from Sunday to Sunday from seven in the morning until seven at night.

This is her third loan in the communal bank.  She will use it to buy clothes like blouses, t-shirts, and pants, etc. in order to start  this business.

Her goal is to finish her house, which she is building in Babahoyo.

loans.use: to buy blouses, t-shirts, and pants, etc.

loans.name: Israel

texts.es: El señor Israel es Chef y realiza contratos para eventos sociales especialmente buffets  semanalmente. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de insumos como ser: todo tipo de carnes, arroz, verduras, condimentos  y otros. Vive en casa de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltero y no tiene hijos. El cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que se le otorgaron  anteriormente ya que pudo mejorar y aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Sr. Israel is a chef and has contracts for social events, especially providing buffets on a weekly basis. This loan will be used to buy supplies such as all types of meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and other products.

Israel lives at home with his parents in the District of Obrajes in the city of La Paz. He is single and has no children. Israel is very pleased with the previous loans he has received since they have enabled him to improve and increase his operating capital.

loans.use: to purchase meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and other supplies for his catering business.

loans.name: Aziz Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Aziz Fatima is married and mother of four children: two daughters and two sons. All of them are studying in different classes. Her husband operates a clothes-selling business. He purchases clothes from Lahore and Faisalabad which are famous for their textile industry and he then sells to different cloth shops on profit. He offers his clients a good variety of clothes, that’s why he earns good profits.  

Aziz also sells clothes along with her husband. Her client base is neighboring women.  Aziz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. Through the loan, he will buy clothes in bulk quantity and of different sorts which will help him offer more variety to his clients and earn better profits.   
 
Aziz is confident that after investment her husband’s business will grow further and make him more income. He has been operating this business for the past 10 years and Aziz is very confident about her husband’s business growth.  She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.   

Note; In the photo, the lady raising a hand is Aziz Fatima.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: La señora Verónica es empleada de una oficina desempeñando las funciones de secretaria. El crédito lo requiere para la cancelación de los trámites de la carrera que estudia. Vive en casa de su esposo, ubicada en la zona de Alto Pura Pura de la ciudad de La Paz;  es casada y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en: Verónica works as a secretary in an office. She needs a loan for administrative fees and expenses at her university. Verónica is married and has two children; she lives with her husband in the Alto Pura Pura zone of La Paz city. This is her first loan from IMPRO.

loans.use: To pay administrative fees required to obtain her university degree.

loans.name: Corazon De Estaño Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CORAZON DE ESTAÑO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Adela, está compuesta por nueve integrantes que están dirigida por una mesa directiva, donde la señora Gimena ocupa el cargo de secretaria. Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa, venta de frutas, venta de hortalizas, tienda de ferreteria, venta de juguetes, tejido y cortes de mantas, tienda de ropa, venta de salchipapa.

La señora Gimena,  indica que es el primer ciclo que trabaja en Pro Mujer, e ingreso por invitación. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas, que inicio hace un año atrás, tejiendo para otras personas, posteriormente ella pensó iniciar su propio negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de lana para el tejido de mantas, los que comprará de la Feria de Alto Lima  y posteriormente elaborados sus productos los venderá a solicitud de una clienta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The 'Corazón de Estaño' community bank is about to start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Adela regional office.  The group has nine members who are managed by a board of directors.  Gimena is the board secretary.  The businesses that the ladies carry out are varied and include: selling clothes, selling fruit, selling vegetables, running a hardware store, selling toys, knitting blankets, running a clothes store and selling 'salchipapa' (traditional fast food).

Gimena tells us that this is the first loan cycle that she has participated in with Pro Mujer.  She joined through an invitation.  Gimena currently has a business knitting blankets.  She started the business one year ago.  She used to knit for other people and then decided to start her own business.

Gimena will use this loan to buy yarn for knitting blankets.  She will buy her supplies in the street market in Alto Lima.  When her products are made, she will sell them to customers on request.  This work allows her to make money to support her family.  She is single and has two children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Gimena replied that she likes the training sessions.

loans.use: to buy yarn

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 34 years old, married and blessed with two children aged 11 and 9. She has been running a computer bureau for the last six years.  She does photocopying, typing and scanning. She wants a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a CPU, cartridges, toners and empty CDs. In the next five years, she wants to have opened up a cyber café and a photo studio.

loans.use: To buy a CPU, cartridges, toners and empty CDs

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha comes from the village of Speti, Imereti Region, West Georgia. He is 56 years old and married. His family consists of four persons: Gocha, his wife Deniza, 25-year-old daughter and 22-year-old son. Gocha works as a joiner. He produces different wooden products (furniture, household goods) in his workshop and sells them locally. Deniza works as teacher in a local school. 

Along with his main job, Gocha also finds time for the family's farming business. They have three milk cows and two pigs. Deniza produces cheese and sells it at the local market. The piglets are also sold locally. 

The total average monthly income of the family is 600 Laris. 

Gocha requests a loan to purchase a new, modern joiner's bench for wood processing. The new plan will allow him to diversify his production and offer new products to the customers. At the same time, the quality of his work will increase and he’ll be able to sell more products, as well as slightly raise the prices. The income of the family will increase and they’ll be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a joiner's bench for his workshop

loans.name: Karya Murni Abadi Group

texts.en: I Gede lives in Pejarakan, Singaraja, North Bali. Though I Gede often helps his wife, he also raises pigs in his yard to supplement his family’s income. I Gede is the treasurer of the Karya Murni Abadi group, which is made up of 10 neighbors from the same village. This is the group’s third loan with MUK.  With the Rp. 1,000,000 that I Gede receives, he will purchase two local species piglets with a price of Rp. 150.000 each, renovate the barn and purchase pig feed.  He plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as suckling pigs.  With his earnings, he plans to purchase more pigs.  With the income from his pig raising, he hopes to be able to pay school fees.

loans.use: To purchase two piglets

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is married and has two grown children who live with her. She sells sports outfits and footwear in the central market of her home town Melitopol. Nadezhda’s kiosk is located in a busy part of the market which helps her keep her business running. She has been in this trade for 10 years. 

Nadezhda’s trade has benefited a lot from lending services. She has repaid all her previous loans without any problems. This time Nadezhda is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase assorted merchandise and generate additional income. She enjoys working with this type of inventory and believes it is a niche where she feels most comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Laura Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señorita Laura tiene 30 años de edad, es peluquera y está viviendo con sus padres y hermanos. Tiene una peluquería en el centro de la ciudad de Itá en la cual trabaja con la ayuda de sus hermanos.
Laura empezó trabajando en esta profesión con su madre hace como 10 años en su propia casa, y con mucho esfuerzo y gracias a los ahorros que tenía consiguió capacitarse en el exterior y de esa forma ser una profesional especializada. Actualmente posee una buena experiencia en dicha profesión lo cual le ayuda  para sacar adelante a toda su familia.
Comenta que tiene muchas clientas y clientes, los cuales siempre acuden a ella por el buen servicio que esta presta a sus clientes. Dice que todo el esfuerzo que realiza es por darle a su familia lo mejor, y que de esa forma tengan un mejor estilo de vida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes, gel, tijeras, cera y otros insumos necesarios para la peluquería. Agradece por la oportunidad que la Fundación le da, ya que de tener el crédito le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Laura is 30 years old, a beautician, and lives with her parents and brothers. She has a beauty shop in the center of Ita city in which she works, with the help of her brothers. Laura began working in this profession with her mother some 10 years ago in her house, and with much effort, and thanks to savings she had, Laura managed to prepare herself to become a professional specialist. At present, she has good experience in this profession, which helps her to advance all of her family.

Laura comments that she has many clients, female and male. She says all her efforts are to provide her family with the best, so that in this form, she can have a better lifestyle.

Laura is requesting a loan to buy coloring, gel, scissors, wax, and other necessary supplies for her beauty shop. She is grateful for the opportunity the Foundation provides, because having credit will be a  great help for her.

loans.use: buy coloring, gel, scissors, wax, and other necessary supplies for her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Reynaldo De Jesus

texts.es: Reynaldo De Jesús tiene 24 años, es casado. El se dedica al negocio de la venta de ropa, el tiene una tienda de venta de ropa para damas y caballeros niños cosméticos. Pues inicio hace 6 años, pues siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar los ingresos de su familia el atiende a sus  clientes muy amable es así que sus clientes se sienten a gusto. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes entre otros.  Su meta siempre ha sido poder establecer mejorar su negocio, de tal manera que pueda vender al por mayor.
texts.en: Reynaldo de Jesus is 24 years old and married. For six years, he has had a shop where he sells women's, men's, and children's clothing. He has always worked hard to bring in more money to support his family, so he gives his customers great service so they'll feel at ease in his shop. He will invest his loan in buying pants, shirts, skirts, and suits, among other merchandise. His goal has always been to expand his business so he can sell his merchandise wholesale.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, suits, and so on.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
El señor Edilberto se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal, sus ventas las realiza ambulantemente en la frontera de El Salvador - Honduras y sus clientes son las personas que viajan y que ocupan de estos productos para el viaje, mas que todo son personas que manejan equipo pesado.
Edilberto vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos que van a la escuela de la comunidad.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi estar mas surtido ya que las necesidades de sus clientes son mas grandes.

Su sueño es remodelar su vivienda y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Edilberto sells personal care products and conducts his business at the border between El Salvador and Honduras. His clients are people who travel and use his products for their trips, and the majority of customers are people that handle heavy equipment.

Edilberto lives with his wife and their two children who attend a community school. This loan will be used to purchase merchandise and enable him to offer his customers a greater variety of products to meet their growing needs. Edilberto's dream is to remodel his home and provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase toothpaste, toothbrushes, flashlights, razors and batteries to offer his customers

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Samnang (in the photo), 27, is single. He lives with his widowed mother along National Road Five, about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Samnang is a garment worker and drives a motor taxi when he is free. He is asking for a loan of 800 USD to purchase a cow to raise. He hopes he will be able to earn extra income from selling calves when the cow delivers a baby.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to raise.

loans.name: Kache

texts.en:
Kache is a married woman with four school-going children. Her husband Rajab, who is employed, contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She has a house with piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Kache has operated a cafe for the past year; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces the major challenge of theft. She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for her cafe. She decided to join Yehu because it gives people funds to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for her cafe.

loans.name: Oyunerdene

texts.en: Oyunerdene is 34 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in Ger, Mongolian yurt in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her husband works at a construction site and her kids are school students. She started her tailoring business in 2009 with her friend. Mostly, she sews traditional clothes (deel). Now that her customers are increasing, she needs to buy a more powerful and fast sewing machine. She is a strong and diligent woman who says, "My business is expanding and I want to keep up with it". She is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Nambilo Group

texts.en:
Joseph is the facilitator of the Nambilo B group. Joseph and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Joseph takes care of 12 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Joseph had an excellent maize yield harvesting 18 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Joseph was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acres of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joseph and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Joseph will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Nambilo B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

He is pictured in the photograph with his group members.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sombang Lestari Group

texts.en:
With the last loan, Ni Kadek managed to get a profit of 200,000 Rupiah (IDR) per month. That gain was very helpful to the family's finances as they are currently experiencing difficult times due to the increasing expenses of the necessities of life. 

Ni Kadek and the Sombang Lestari group decided to continue borrowing from MUK since it is especially helpful in developing their piggery businesses. This loan will be used to buy two piglets and pig feed. She hopes this business can support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy two piglets for fattening and pig feed.

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia is requesting for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s sweetmeat selling business.

With the loan investment, he will buy ingredients such as sugar and cooking oil etc in larger quantities to make better quality and larger quantities of sweetmeat to sell to his clients.
 
The quality and taste of sweetmeat which he provides to his customers is very good, that’s why his products have a high demand among his clients.

Safia is a housewife and performs her household tasks very well. In her spare time she also helps her husband in his business by preparing sweetmeat for him.

She is hopeful that a loan investment will help her husband gain maximum benefit from his business.

Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Safia.”

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil and other ingredients for making sweetmeat and selling.

loans.name: Lion Group

texts.en:
Moses is the facilitator of the Lion group. Moses and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Moses takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Moses had a very good maize yield harvesting 8 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Moses was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Moses and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Moses will educate his children.

In 2012, the members of Lion group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Samawati Group

texts.en:
Wiliam, who is in his early thirties is single.  He has been driving a motorcycle "Bajaji" for about three years now.  He works from 6am to 10pm and he is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Wiliam’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he wants to use for buying spare parts for his bajaji.  Wiliam’s dream is to one day be able to buy a plot of land and build his own house.

Wiliam will share this loan with his loan group, "Samawati", which has a total of seventeen members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his bajaji.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 36-year-old widow with four children.

She has been in the business of selling cabbages, onions, and tomatoes for the last eight years, from which she earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is applying for her first loan of KES 10,000. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She hopes to use the funds to buy more grocery stock for resale (cabbages, onions, and tomatoes) and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, onions, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Vuochteang's Group

texts.en:
Vuochteang is fifty-six years old, married and lives in a village of the Sa Ang district of Cambodia. She has four children, one of whom works at a garment factory.

Vuochteang has been earning a living by growing and selling taro for the past twenty years. She currently earns less than 4 USD each day to feed her family.

Vuochteang has been with VisionFund for two years, and she has successfully paid back her loans with them. Now she leads a group of three members who are applying for a 2,800,000 KHR loan.

With her portion of the loan, Vuochteang wants to buy taro seedlings and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow more taro to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy taro seedlings and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Venantie

texts.en:
Venantie is 50 years old. She is married with 5 children aged between 6 and 17.All of them go to school. She has been running a business selling clothes for the past three years. She will use the loan to buy more clothes to sell.

Venantie plans to use the profits from her business to pay her children's school fees and provide food for the family. In the future, she would like to own a big shop.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Bokk Jom est mis en place depuis le 30 décembre 2009, il est composé de neuf femmes issues du même village. L'activité dominante est le petit commerce.



La responsable Kiné est âgée de 42 ans,elle est mariée mère de trois enfants et a en charge son petit fils; elle mène une activité de petit commerce de légumes et fait parallèlement de l'élevage de moutons, elle a une bonne expérience dans ces secteurs. Sur la photo elle est assise à droite avec un châle bleu-blanc autour des épaules.

Elle achéte les légumes ( choux,aubergines, carottes,navets....) et les moutons dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour revendre dans son village. 


Son prêt lui servira à diversifier et agrandir ses activités afin de se faire beaucoup de revenus sur les légumes et moutons.


Elle aide son mari pour les dépenses de la famille sur le plan scolaire et sanitaire et souhaite développer son épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Bokk Jom was established on December 30, 2009. It comprises nine women from the same village. The dominant work is small-scale commerce. 

Kiné is the group's official and is 42 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She also has a grandson to support. Her small business involves vegetables and concurrently the raising of sheep. She has good experience in these sectors. In the photo, she is seated at the right and wearing a blue-white shawl around her shoulders. 

Kiné purchases vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, carrots, turnips…) and sheep from the weekly markets and then sells them in her village. 

Her loan will serve to diversify and expand her businesses in order to make a lot of income from the vegetables and sheep. 

She helps out her husband with the family expenses with regard to schooling and health care. And she wishes to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to resell

loans.name: Maria Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MARIA est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Julienne, celle qui a la main levée sur la photo est âgée de 52 ans et est mariée à un certain Gabriel. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Julienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assumées par le couple. Julienne n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour y arriver, Julienne vend du sodabi (boisson locale) par la technique de distribution depuis trente ans. Julienne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Julienne ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MARIA, sollicitent un septième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter de boisson alcoolisée locale

loans.name: Venko

texts.en:
Everybody in the town knows Venko K.. He is one of the most popular carpenters in the region. For 15 years he worked in the wood factory in town but 3 years ago, he decided to start his own business.

His workshop is on the first floor of the house he builds for 6 years. Venko K. makes any kind of woodwork – furniture, doors, windows, frames. Smolian is close to one of the most popular winter resorts in Bulgaria and therefore lots of hotels and houses are being built nearby. So Venko has many orders for these buildings.

He works alone and nobody helps him but although the work is hard he is not complaining. All the money he earns he puts into the house he builds. There is still to much work until the house will be finished but his dream is to live there with his family.

loans.use: Buying wood for his work

loans.name: Ninet

texts.en: S. is a market woman who sells used clothing. She buys the clothing in bales and later retails them to her community's market. Of late she is unable to go to the market to sell because she cannot buy in bales to sell. She needs assistance of $750 from Kiva to enable her to buy clothes in bales to sell.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Naomi wants to buy a dairy cow and animal feeds.

loans.name: Queen Victoria

texts.en: Mrs. Queen Victoria O. is a good cook who learnt her business for 5 years. She started her business in the year 2002 in the area of Asaba, Delta State. She is 37 years old, married with four children. She needs a loan of $550 so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and cooking ingredients

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Aged 24, Mrs. Ablavi Z. is the mother of three children and lives with her husband in difficult conditions. Her husband is illiterate and has no trade to speak of. The children’s future is in jeopardy. But the bravery of this young woman gives the household much hope. Having obtained an initial loan of $300, she set up a small grocery business. Today, having repaid her loan, she is asking once again for help with the sum of $750, which she can put into the business. Supporting this family is also a humanitarian act for the children's future.

Agée de 24 ans, Madame Z. Ablavi est mère de trois (3) enfants et vit avec son mari dans des conditions difficiles. Le mari analphabète n’a aucun métier sous la main. L’avenir des enfants est presque compromis. Mais le courage de cette jeune femme donne beaucoup d’espoir au foyer. Avec un premier crédit de $300 qu’elle avait obtenu, elle a initié un petit commerce d’alimentation générale. Aujourd’hui, après avoir bien remboursé son crédit, elle sollicite de nouveau un appui d’un montant de $750 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce. Soutenir cette famille est aussi une œuvre humanitaire pour l’avenir des enfants.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Buying and selling of general foodstuffs

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.en: For eleven years I have had this little business selling food in the market for San Miguel in the town of Guanacaste, Honduras. I have quite a few clients because they like the soups and foods such as meat, rice and salads. The soups of beef and vegetables are very delicious. Now I need to buy more meat and vegetables to make my meals, and help my family with the income from the sales.

loans.use: Buy vegetables, beef, chicken, condiments and more

loans.name: Margoth

texts.es:
Margoth is a hard-working exemplar mother. Since she formed her family next to her husband, she started working full-time in onion farming and production. She is very efficient at this work because of all of the experience she gathered working next to her parents year after year. This laborious job which she performs passionately fills her with optimism and joy because these efforts go directly to benefit her only recently born daughter.

The wish of this exemplar mother is to build the house that she's always dreamed about but has never been able to make a reality. In order to make her dreams come true she is requesting a money loan. She will invest this capital into her daily activities in order to obtain more profits from her sales. She promises to use your help appropriately. Her and her diligent husband appeal to our support to concrete their plans.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Margoth, es una empeñosa y ejemplar madre, que desde que formó su familia junto a su esposo, se dedicó por completo a la labor de cultivo y producción de cebollas; actividad que realiza eficientemente gracias a la experiencia que fue adquiriendo año tras año junto a sus padres.Esta laboriosa labor que desempeña apasionadamente la va llenando de optimismo y alegría, porque su esfuerzo se desplega en beneficio de su única y querida hija que acaba de nacer.El deseo de esta ejemplar madre es realizar junto a su familia la construcción de su anhelada casita, sueño que hasta ahora no han podido efectuar y para concretar sus planes solicita un préstamo de dinero, capital que invertirá en su actividad diaria a fin de obtener mayores ganancias con la venta de sus productos, así mismo promete utilizar adecuadamente tu ayuda. Ella y su diligente esposo apelan a nuestro apoyo para concretar sus planes.

loans.use: Increment capital for production growth.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị T., 50 years of age, has been a member of the TYM Fund since 1997. She is living with her husband and three children. In addition to farming its six acres of rice paddy, the family is running an animal husbandry business. The stock is usually composed of hundreds of pigs, hundreds of egg laying hens and chickens for meat, the main source of food for near by poultry processing plants and people in the area. As the result of her efficiency, the income of Mrs. T.’s family has increased from 50USD, before her joining the Fund, to 160USD a month, currently. She figures that in order to expand the family’s animal husbandry business she would need to apply for a loan of 775USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị T., 50 tuổi, là thành viên vào Quỹ từ năm 1997. Chị hiện đang sống cùng chồng và 3 con. Gia đình chị làm 6 sào ruộng. Ngoài việc làm T.ần nông chị còn mạnh dạn cùng chồng đầu tư chăn nuôi gia súc gia cầm. Trong chuồng nhà chị lúc nào cũng có hàng trăm con lợn thịt, vài trăm con gà thịt và đẻ, cung cấp nguồn thực phẩm rất giá trị cho các nhà máy thức ăn gia súc gần nhà chị và cho người dân trong vùng. Nhờ làm ăn có hiệu quả T. nhập của chị T. tăng từ 50USD/tháng (trước khi vào Quỹ) lên 160USD/tháng. Để việc đầu tư phát triển chăn nuôi hiệu quả chị T. rất cần vốn để phát triển chăn nuôi với quy mô lớn hơn, chị đang đề nghị mức vốn vay là 775USD.

loans.use: Expanding the family's animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea S., 42, works with her husband on their rice paddy growing rice and various kinds of vegetables, making collectively about $5 each day from selling their output. One of her children is employed by a nearby garment factory and one is a student. Mrs. Chea S. and her husband would like to request a loan to purchase a large quantity of peppers from the growers and resell them for a profit, and the leftover of the money is to buy more seeds and fertilizer for their crop expansion.

loans.use: To purchase large quantity of pepper from the growers and resell them for a profit, and the leftover of the money is to buy more seeds and fertilizer for their crop expansion.

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
When the TYM Fund came to Thanh Lâm village in May, 2000, Mrs. Hoàng Thị Tất, 49 years old, checked out the organization then decided to join. At that time, the family’s economy was in deep hardship. Her oldest son just got a construction job, and there was nothing else besides farming a little patch of rent rice paddy. For dwelling, they got a modest [i]three section[/i] hut. She took out loan to invest in her new business, trading vegetable and grain. With her income, income from her son’s construction job and together with a loan from her relatives, she is building their first house which costs 10,000USD. This time she is applying a loan of 950USD to buy more grain. The monthly family’s income is 22-USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Tháng 5 năm 2000, khi Quỹ Tình thương về xã Thanh Lâm, sau khi tìm hiểu, chị Hoàng Thị Tất, 49 tuổi, là một trong những thành viên đăng ký tham gia. Điều kiện gia đình chị lúc ấy thuộc diện khó khăn, con trai lớn mới đi làm, ngoài vài sào ruộng khoán ra chị cũng không biết làm gì thêm. Ngôi nhà 3 gian tạm bợ, tuềnh toàng tránh mưa nắng rất khổ cực. Sau khi tham gia vay vốn, chị Tất luôn sử dụng đúng mục đích và có hiệu quả, con trai lớn đi xây dựng cũng có ý thức tiết kiệm cho gia đình. Ngoài ra chị cũng có thêm nghề phụ là hàng ngày thu mua rau ngô bao tử đặt hàng cho khách hàng Hà nội. Sau bảy năm tham gia Quỹ với sự tự tin, cần cù, chịu khó, chị Tất đã tích lũy được một số vốn. Cộng với vốn vay họ hàng, chị đang xây dựng căn nhà mới rất khang trang trị giá hơn 10000USD. Khi chúng tôi đến hai vợ chồng chị niềm nở tiếp chúng tôi và không giấu được niềm vui mừng khi ngôi nhà mơ ước của anh chị đang được cất lên. Tâm sự của anh chị là tiếp tục gắn bó với Quỹ để xây dựng cuộc sống gia đình ngày càng ấm no, tốt đẹp hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị Tất xin vay 950USD để thu mua rau ngô bao tử. Thu nhập hàng tháng của gia đình là 220USD.

loans.use: Buy grain

loans.name: Marta Felipa

texts.es:
Marta Felipa B. is a strong woman worthy of being a role model to others due to how hard she works in her business raising cattle, which is the sole source of supporting her four small school-aged children who also help their mother when they have the time to do so.

From a young age she has dedicated herself to this difficult work which makes it possible for her to support her family without any difficulty. Today she finds herself in need of buying calves to raise and therefore she is seeking CEPRODEL’s support in obtaining a loan that would enable her to buy these animals and continue to support her home and family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Marta Felipa B. es una dama muy esforzada y digna de imitar debido a que trabaja fuertemente en el negocio de crianza de ganado con el único fin de mantener a sus cuatro pequeños hijos en edad escolar y que también apoyan a su madre cuando tienen tiempo de hacerlo.
