That is why she wants a loan, and she will buy merchandise to buy a business. In the future, with her husband, a bricklayer, she wants to save and give a better future and quality of life for their small children.

loans.use: to buy candies and materials to make sweets.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling at retail to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. Her major dream is to expand her business and establish another stall in the future.

With the Kshs 35,000, she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase two bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Saidu K.'s Group

texts.en:
Presented to you above in the photo are members of a primary school in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 9,400,000 SLL in order to meet their immediate financial problems.  At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. 
Their leader is Saidu. Saidu was born in Makeni, 43 years ago. He is married, and the couple has 4 children.  Three of the children are attending primary and secondary schools. Saidu is pursuing further studies. He has requested this loan in order to pay his college fees.

loans.use: to pay his college fees

loans.name: Rieles Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Rieles” está conformado por las siguientes personas: Don Felipe, Doña Celia, Doña María del Carmen, ellos son de una comida pequeña pero con mucha cultura y costumbres la comunidad se caracteriza por ser tranquila donde sus habitantes son personas campesinas, obreras u comerciantes.
Le pusieron este nombre de los “Rieles” porque ellos viven cerca donde están unos rieles y porque siempre han vivido ahí, ellos saben que por ahí pasaba el tren desde hace mucho tiempo eso fue lo que les cuentan sus antepasados, sin embargo, los riles cayeron y ahora están en mal estado claro ahí ya no circula ningún tren pero ahí siguen los rieles.
Don Felipe quien es el representante comenta: "desde que recuerdo lo rieles han estado ahí, entonces cuando nos preguntaron qué nombre le queríamos poner al grupo decidimos ponerle “Rieles”" ël tiene 47 años de edad, esta casado con la señora María Carmen desde hace 26 años, ahora ninguno de sus hijos depende de ellos ya que todos se casaron y viven aparte.
Solicito el crédito para comprar 6 cerditos los cuales los conocemos como los famosos lechones, en casa tiene cuatro cerditas, y un semental, en su actividad ganadera tiene de experiencia 15 años.
Comenta por el momento no tiene ningún problema, ni siquiera que sus cerdos se enfermen ya que el prefiere comprar lechones y no de granja ya que los de granja son muy delicados al frio y no están acostumbrados al campo todo lo contrario a los lechones no se enferman aunque estén en el frio y si se les quiere sacar a pastar al campo no pasa nada.
Aunque en su casa tiene sus corrales bien construidos tiene 6 los cuales su meta será llenarlos todos de puerquitos lechones, ya que acaba de vender unos. Y se ha quedado casi sin cerdos.
Don Felipe le da las gracias a FRAC  “Gracias por el préstamo porque le ayuda de mucho de ya que sus cerditos a mantenerlos sanos y fuertes”
texts.en:
The group "Rieles" consists of the following  people: Don Felipe, Doña Celia, Doña María del Carmen. They are from a small community but one that has a lot of culture and many customs. The area is noted for it serenity where the inhabitants are farm labourers, workers or traders.

They named the group "Rieles" because they live near some railway tracks and have always lived there. They know that the train used go by there a long time ago according to their ancestors. However, the tracks fell apart and now are in poor condition. Ofcourse no train runs there now but the tracks remain.

Don Felipe ,the group representative says "Ever since I can remember the tracks have been there. So when they asked us what we wanted to name the group we decided to call it "Rieles" (tracks)". He is 47 years old and has been married to Señora María Carmen for the last 26 years. None of their children are dependents now as they are all married and live on their own. 

He is asking for a loan to buy 6 suckling piglets. At home he has 4 female piglets and a stud. He has been breeding livestock for 15 years.

He says that at the moment he has no problem not even his pigs becoming sick. He says this is because he prefers to buy suckling pigs rather than from a farm as the ones from the farm are very sensitive to the cold and are not used to the countryside. The suckling pigs are the complete opposite never getting sick even if left in the cold and they are fine even if taken out to graze in the fields.

Although he has well-constructed corrals at home, he has 6 he means to fill with suckling pigs as he just sold some and has almost no pigs left.
Don Felipe gives his thanks to FRAC, "Thank you for the loan because it helps me keep my piglets healthy and strong."

loans.use: to buy 6 suckling pigs.

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 29 лет. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Он не имеет высшего образования. Хуршед развозит людей по маршруту Кулоб – Душанбе. Этим видом деятельности занимается пять лет. Он берет кредит для приобретения запчастей автомашины.
texts.en: Khurshed lives in the town of Kulob.  He is 29 years old, married and has three children.  He does not have a higher education.  Khurshed transports people along the Kulob - Dushanbe route.  He has been involved in this business for five years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of spare parts for his car.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a thirty-seven-year-old married woman with three school-going children. Her husband, Kahindi, is a mechanic who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She has a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Mariam has operated a retail shop for the past fourteen years. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces the major challenge of competition from other retail operators. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu because of easy accessibility to loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Muộn's Group

texts.en:
Muộn is a 50-year-old female living in the Yen Phong district in Bac Ninh province.  Muộn is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Vọng Nguyệt 1.

Muộn is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To making a living, Muộn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  Muộn has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

Muộn joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Muộn is requesting for the first time a loan from SEDA.   She is a loan of 5,152,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.   Muộn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Thức  is a 31-year-old female who is requesting a 7,840,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising chickens.

2.  Ban is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising pigs and chickens.

3.  Phương Nam is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising pigs.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Muộn  là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province.  Muộn là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Vọng Nguyệt 1 - nhóm 06 (6).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  Muộn thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Muộn kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND.  Muộn đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Muộn đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Thức là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.840.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2.  Ban là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3.  Phương Nam là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva

loans.use: to purchase livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Gilsom

texts.en: Gilsom would like a loan to buy local brew to resell at his bar, which he has operated for 16 years. Gilsom is 34 years old and hails from the Kyenjojo District. Price fluctuations and inflation in the country are his major hardships. Gilsom dreams of building a permanent residential house and educating his children. His business goal is to expand his business into new markets, especially in the city where he can earn more.

loans.use: to buy local brew for resale.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a 61-year-old widow with two adult children. Rosalia is from Santa Cruz, Tangub City.

Rosalia owns and operates a business venture baking and selling a variety of goods including banana cue in the local community. She has been in this business for 30 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rosalia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosalia is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
This is Amelia, 62, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. Her husband is Emmanuel, who is retired.  She and her husband manage their household while operating her business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.                 
            
Amelia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns profit by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling at retail. She also sells honey bee products for additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 17,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Amelia hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: María De Los Santos

texts.es:
La Sra.  María tiene su negocio de venta de frutas como son naranja, limones y naranjas agrias al por mayor y al detalle en el mercado, ella trabaja sola de lunes a sábados desde las cinco de la mañana hasta las dos de la tarde.
Ella es casada y con tres hijos pero ya ninguno depende de ella en la actualidad.
María acude a las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un nuevo préstamo para la compra de mercadería para su negocio, para lograr las ventas de este mes de Diciembre ya que es donde ellos venden más y por salir cosecha de esos productos para estos meses.
texts.en:
María sells fruit like oranges, lemons and sour oranges at wholesale and retail in the market.  She works alone Monday through Saturday from 5 in the morning until 2 in the afternoon.  She’s married and has three children but none of them depend on her at present. 

María calls on Ceprodel offices to request a new loan to buy merchandise for her business for December sales which is when they sell the most because these products are harvested during these months.

loans.use: to buy oranges, sour oranges and lemons.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola cuenta con 22 años de edad, es casada tiene 1 hijo el cual esta cursando 2° de primaria, su esposo se llama José ángel es campesino, Fabiola seguirá estudiando entrara a la prepa de nuevo.

Ella es comerciante vende ropa por catalogo y ropa América ya tiene 5 años que comenzó con el negocio y le va muy bien e invertirá su préstamo en la compra de los pedidos pendientes y un paquete que esta esperando de ropa a doña Fabiola le gustaría poner un local para ir incrementando su negocio ya que dice que le va muy bien.
texts.en:
Fabiola, 22, is married and has a son attending second grade.  Her husband’s name is José Ángel and he’s a farmer.  Fabiola will continue to go to school; she will reenter high school again.

She is a merchant.  She sells clothes via catalogue and also American clothes.  She started the business five years ago and does very well.  She will use her loan to buy her pending orders and a bundle of clothes that she’s waiting for.  Fabiola would like to open a locale to enlarge her business because she says that she does very well.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of clothes.

loans.name: Djanybek

texts.ru: Джаныбек 53-летний фермер, женат, воспитывает пятерых детей.  В 1996 году, в поисках доходов для своей семьи, Джаныбек решился на свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Джаныбека, начатое с суммы в 4,500 сом (KGS) хозяйство,  сегодня приносит около 6,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных  и мясных продуктов. Также он возделывает 4,16 га земли с картофелем и зерновыми культурами.  В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Джаныбек обратился в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от кредита Джаныбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Djanybek is a 53-year-old farmer who is married with five children. In 1996, in a search for income for his family, Djanybek decided to start his own business in farming and field work. Thanks to his tenacity and perseverance, Djanybek took the starting household sum of 4,500 Som (KGS) and today brings in about 6,000 Som (KGS) per month from the sale of meat and dairy products. He also cultivates 4.16 hectares of land with potatoes and cereal grains. 

In order to further increase the number of his livestock, Djanybek applied to the Bai Tushum and Partners company for a loan in the amount of 45,000 Som (KGS) for the purchase of additional heads of livestock. Djanybek plans to use income from the loan to invest further and increase the number of domestic animals.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is a 27-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan and a mother of two children.

Muna is requesting a loan of 400 JD to do home maintenance. Her aspiration is to improve her family's living conditions and finance her children's education expenses.

Due to cultural issues, Muna did not wish to be photographed. The man in the photo is Muna's husband.

loans.use: to do home maintenance.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en: This is 32 year-old Osman.  He is married to a trader, and has 4 children aged 12, 9, 6 years and a 10 months old baby, two are school-going children. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him because he helps in the business. In 2005, Osman established his electronics business.  He began his business because of the rebel war that broke in his country of Sierra Leone. Osman says, "I was in form three (school grade 9 in the U.S) when the rebels attacked us in our village called Sanda twenty miles off from Makeni. Then we fled to Makeni and started working for people for our survival. During that time, I started raising funds until I got a substantial amount to start my business." Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,796,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000 . Osman has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan and now needs a new loan in order to buy tape (6 batteries) - 8 pieces @ Lr125,000, radio - 10 pieces @ Le45,000, radio with memory card - 5 pieces @ Le75,000, tape (4 batteries) - 8 pieces @ Le65,000 and electronic lanterns - 1 carton @ Le1,000,000.  The balance will be used for transport. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 269,000. In the future, Osman plans to open a shop. He felt good about taking out this loan as it helps him to boost his business.  He wants his children to have a good education. The loan will help greatly because he will be able to make a profit out of it.  Increases in the cost of goods affects him greatly because as costs change, he has to change his selling prices which affects his customers' buying pattern.  He offers quality products.  Osman serves at least 20 people per day around the city.  His business is popular because he treats his customers fairly and with respect.  He is assisted by family members. He buys his goods in Conakry twice per month and in Freetown once every week.  He saves some of his profit, some he uses to add to his working capital. He plans to expand if he is given subsequent loans that will enable him to accomplish his dreams.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy electronics for sale

loans.name: Denis Elena

texts.es:
Denis se encuentra casada y junto con su esposo viven en un apartamento ubicado en la cancha deportiva de su municipio; ellos son los encargados del aseo del lugar, por lo que no tienen que pagar algún arriendo por esto. Desde hace un tiempo decidieron generar ingresos extras con el ánimo de poder gozar de una mejor calidad de vida, y fue así como montaron una venta de dulces, snack y gaseosas. Debido a que su negocio fue montado con muy bajo capital, Denis no puede ofrecer gran variedad de productos a sus clientes, sin embargo, aún así ha podido tener muy buenas ventas, es por esto que ahora que su negocio viene creciendo Denis busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de dulces, snack, y gaseosas para surtir su negocio y un refrigerador donde pueda almacenar las gaseosas.
De esta manera su negocio seguirá creciendo y les seguirá permitiendo tener una buena calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas. Además, Denis sueña con algún día poder tener una gran tienda general ubicada en un lugar más estratégico y comercial y así poder tener mayores ingresos para su futuro.

loans.use: Compra de dulces, snack, y gaseosas para surtir su negocio y un refrigerador donde pueda almacenar las gaseosas.

loans.name: Benkadi Kagoua 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe  Benkadi Kagoua 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Kouroubadougou, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec    KADIATOU,  assise avec une écharpe jaune, sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte  acheter des intrants, semence, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour  pour l’exploitation de 0,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 55.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.  
NB/ DJELIKA absente
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi Kagoua 2 group are married women with an average age of 40, with 4 children and all living in traditional families in Kouroubadougou, one of the villages in San, the fourth largest administrative region of Mali. They work with Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to succeed in their agricultural business during the winter period.
They are on their third loan with the institution; previous loans have been fully repaid. The crop grown is peanut - under the responsibility of KADIATOU, seated and wearing a yellow scarf in the photo.
With her loan, she plans to buy inputs, seed, small agricultural equipment and to pay the labour costs for the 0.5 hectare farm. The production will be sold in the village and in San market, following the harvest, to a mixed customer base of both men and women.
She plans to generate an average profit of 55,000 FCFA per harvest. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to assist her husband with the daily expenses.

NB DJELIKA is absent

loans.use: to buy inputs, seed, small agricultural equipment and to pay labour costs.

loans.name: Batkhurel

texts.en:
Borrower Batkhurel is  49 years old married man and lives with his wife and son in outer ger district which lacks basic infrastructure of the city. As usual now its the housing projects season Batkhurel also decided to make some renovation work and housing project at his current old house.

He is requesting a 3.000.000 MNT loan to purchase construction materials in order to finish his housing project. He is a hardworking person who is willing to make better living condition to his family.

loans.use: to make housing project at his current house

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 24 years old from Iringa District, Tanzania. She is a mother of one child. Agnes volunteers at a secondary school, which is near her home in order to impact students’ lives by teaching them life skills. 

She has also employed herself through selling household items such as cups, plates and spoons. The business helps her to provide basic needs to both her mother and her daughter.  She requests a loan from Kiva to improve and increase the scale of her business.

loans.use: to expand her business by adding airtime and cash to support her business.

loans.name: Marthe

texts.fr:
Marthe a 32 ans, elle est mariée. Le couple a trois enfants de 4, 11, et 13 ans et ils sont tous scolarisés dont deux dans des écoles privées.  La famille habite dans une maison que le couple vient de construire. Leur rêve est la réussite des enfants dans leurs études et l’existence de source de revenus suffisants à la retraite. 
Marthe a comme activité la vente des chaussures à l'occasion. Avant, les produits vendus étaient les tissus, mais compte tenu du marché,  elle a changé de produits. L’activité a été hérité de sa sœur. En effet, au début, elle vendait les produits qui ne sont pas écoulées par sa sœur. Petit  à petit, elle s’est mise à son propre compte pour être autonome.

loans.use: acheter des chaussures à l'occasion

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.en:
I’ve had my small business for five years. I make and sell tortillas. I have set clients that pay me daily, weekly or monthly. My business has improved over time, and I am glad to now be able to help my children with their education. I didn’t have a chance to study a career, so I want them to be have the opportunity to become professionals, and improve their quality of life.

Loan Use: Purchase corn flour, lime, wood, and others.

Tengo cinco años de tener mi pequeña empresa de elaboracion y venta de tortillas, mis clientes son fijos ya que algunos me pagan diario, semanal o mensual. Mi negocio ha mejorado con el tiempo y me alegra ya que ahora puedo ayudarles a mis hijos con sus estudios, yo no tuve la oportunidad de estudiar asi que quiero que ellos puedan ser profesionales y que mejoren su nivel de vida.

loans.use: Compra de harina de maiz, cal, leña y otros

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use:
to buy beach clothing and shoes for the beach season

para comprar ropa playera y zapatos deportivos por la temporada

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand and diversify my business.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Business Description

Mr. B. began his business 8 years ago by selling fruits and vegetables. Since then, his store has grown and today he has one of the best grocery stores of the area. Helped by his wife, he sells provisions and first need products in his store.

Use of Loan

He would like to invest his loan in the purchase of more merchandise and to enlarge his store. He would like to buy seasonal products on sale. By buying at wholesale prices, his costs remain low and, therefore, can offer his clients a better price.

Personal Information

He has a six year old daughter who studies in a nearby establishment. His home is made of concrete and his goal is to expand his business each day.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

El Señor B. empezó su negocio hace 8 años con la venta de legumbres y frutas, hoy en día su negocio a crecido y cuenta con una de las despensas mejores del sector, vende víveres y productos de primera necesidad, en su local le ayuda su esposa

Uso del Préstamo

El quiere invertir su préstamo en comprar mas mercadería y ampliar su tienda, quiere comprar productos que por la temporada están en promoción, ya que si compra al por mayor resultan los costos mas bajos y de esta manera el puede vender a sus clientes a precios cómodos

Información Personal

Tiene una hija de seis años y estudia en uno de los establecimientos cercanos, su vivienda es de cemento y su meta es ampliar cada día su negocio

loans.use: Purchase more supplies and to enlarge his store.

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr:
TRANSLATED BY MATT FLANNERY

Mrs A. Edoh is a 55 years old woman and worn out by tiredness. In spite of her old age, it is very voluntary and full with creative idea. Its principal activity is the sales and manufacture of manioc and gari. Manioc is a starch made by leaching and drying the root of the cassava plant; the source of tapioca; a staple food in the tropics. Gari is pickled ginger.

This activity is of great benefit and allows her provide for the needs for the family. She wishes today to increase the business and requests for that a loan of $600 which will be used to her to buy provisions in manioc for the manufacture and the sale of the gari . This will enable her to provide the needs for her five (5) children and the four (4) others whom she provides for.

ORIGINAL FRENCH

Madame A. Edoh est une femme âgée de 55 ans et usée par la fatigue. Malgré son âge avancé, elle est très volontaire et pleine d’idée créatrice. Son activité principale est l’achat des champs de manioc pour fabrication du gari. Cette activité lui procure de grands bénéfices et lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Elle désire aujourd’hui agrandir l’activité et sollicite pour cela un crédit de $600 qui lui servira de fonds de commerce pour s'approvosionner en manioc en vue de la fabrication et la vente du gari. Ceci lui permettra de venir à bout des besoins de ses cinq (5) et des quatre (4) autres à sa charge.

loans.use: Achat en gros du manioc et fabrication du gari

loans.name: Fausia

texts.en:
Fausia F. is 32 years of age, and she is married with three children. They live at Falelauniu, and she is one of the new members of the program. Her husband is a policeman, and she relied on him for everything before she joined the program.

She is is now running her own small business, and this money will really help the husband for the week’s expenses and other family things. She is young and active and her dream is for the business to be successful in the future.

loans.use: To buy seeds for cucumbers, cabbages and tomatoes, as well as tools for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Faasuamalie

texts.en: Faasuamalie P. is a very energetic mother running her own taro plantation business.  She’s fifty eight years old and has eight children.  Her husband is a strong man who works hard supporting her with their business and praising how lucky he is to have married Faasuamalie.  With her requested loan, she plans to do maintenance to their old fale (a traditional Samoan house) that they have been staying at for more than thirty years now.  She sells taros two days a week and earns the equivalent of USD $80-$100 a week.  She has fully paid back her previous loan with no difficulties and is now requesting a new loan.

loans.use: To buy chemicals for her plantation and for home improvements

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en: Nazira B. is from the mid-sized, industrial city Gujranwala, Pakistan. She is a married mother of five children who all attend school. Her husband is a shoe maker. He creates fashionable shoes and supplies shoe sellers in various cities. He has many clients, and he can improve his profits by buying shoe-making supplies in bulk in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. Nazira is requesting a loan of $825 to purchase these supplies in bulk.

loans.use: To purchase shoe-making material in bulk

loans.name: Rukkiah's Group

texts.en:
"I am Rukkiah M. from Arifwala, Pakistan. I am the mother of two: one boy and one girl. My daughter attends a stitching school and my son attends a local school. My husband is a public transport driver and now, he wants to become a partner in one of the wagons. This way our profits will rise sharply. For this reason, we require a loan.

My group members are: Nazira B. who will invest her loan in her son’s mobile phone store; Hajra B. who requires a loan to start a shoe manufacturing business; Zulakhan B. who plans to buy her son a rickshaw; and Shazia B. whose brother wants to buy a partnership in a cycle store. I completely trust all of these women and hence, request you to lend to all of us."

loans.use: To become a partner in one of the local transport wagons

loans.name: Jerónima De Los Ánge

texts.es:
Mrs. Jeronima has been selling vegetables for 10 years. She began with her own savings, selling the Terminal market of León.

Her business selling vegetables began as a street vendor with a small cart selling throughout the market, and then she found her own locale but it was in poor condition. Jeronima is a married woman with 5 children to support, and they are the source of her strength to build a successful business.

She has benefited from working with Ceprodel for 2 years, assisting her with 13 loans that have greatly impacted her vegetable business’s growth and has raised her standard of living and that of her children. She needs a loan from Ceprodel to acquire a large amount of vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La actividad económica de la señora Jeronima es la venta de verduras variadas teniendo su negocio desde hace 10 años que dio inicio con sus propios ahorros en el mercado la Terminal de León.

Su negocio de venta de verduras lo inicia vendiendo ambulante con una pana pequeña por todo el mercado y posteriormente se ubica en un local propio pero en malas condiciones. Es de mucha importancia destacar que ella es una dama casada y con 5 hijos a su cargo por lo que ellos son el motivo de sus grandes esfuerzos en el negocio.

Ha sido beneficiada desde hace dos años por Ceprodel quien le asistió con financiamiento habiéndoles otorgado 13 créditos de los que le han impactado en un mayor crecimiento de su negocio de verduras y además ha mejorado su nivel de vida y el de sus hijos. Su necesidad por la que solicita el crédito a Ceprodel es por la adquisición de mayores volúmenes de verduras.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables

loans.name: Satupaitea Mosula Centre - Group 1

texts.en:
After four weeks of rigorous business training, these six women of Satupaitea Mosula on the island of Savaii, passed their written tests on the SPBD principles (business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee) to ensure their first group loan from SPBD. Over the next year, they will support each other in their individual business development to guarantee on-time payments.

Merenaite F., 30, married, with five children, has over two years of experience growing vegetables. Specifically, she sells cabbages, cucumbers and tomatoes. Her husband is a seasoned farmer. With her loan, she will purchase cucumbers, cabbages, fertilizer, weed killing sprayer and pesticides.

Esi A., 41, married, with five children, has over three years of experience in maintaining a taro plantation. Taro is a staple of the Samoan diet. Her loan will be used to purchase a weed killing sprayer, pesticides, 2 bush knives, a filing and a spade. She hopes to earn a net cash flow of 310 Tala (~120 USD) per week.

Silika L., 29 and married, has worked in tandem with her husband growing cabbage and taro for over two years. A loan will permit her to purchase cabbage seeds, barbed wire, a filing, and a knife, a weed killing sprayer, a rake and fertilizer.

Fetu T., 38, married, with two children, has worked in tandem with her husband, catching and selling fish for over two years. With her loan, she will purchase a fishing boat, a lantern, a spear and fishing boots. Together, they expect to earn a net cash flow of 220 Tala (~88 USD) per week.

Fue M., 34, married, with four children, bakes banana chips sold to the other villagers, public and school children. She will use her loan to purchase pots, oil, bowls and other materials to bake the chips.

Solema I., 28, married, with one child, works with her husband catching selling fish. With her loan, she will purchase a fishing boat, goggles, a cooler and fishing boots.

loans.use: To purchase farming and fishing equipment

loans.name: Delicia

texts.es:
Delicia is a member of the Las Dalinas 2 Communal Bank, which is located in Alana Sisley Mz. H Lt. 2 in the district of Yarina Cocha. She is 54 years old and is the mother of 2 children. Her husband is a teacher. With her first loan of S. 300 from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in a small bodega.

Now Delicia has been able to make her bodega expand. She sells products she formerly didn't sell and is there all day with the aid of her daughter who tends to the house.

With this loan of S. 800, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy one sack of rice, 1/2 a sack of sugar, milk, bread, soap, detergent, shampoo, bananas, carbon, et cetera.

Delicia is a very hard working woman. Since she was very young she dedicated herself to her work in order to feel more independent. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos because she has supported her and treated her well.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Delicia pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Shipibas, ubicado en el Jr. Rio Tapiche ultima cuadra, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 54 años es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es maestro, es así que Delicia con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad Bella ha sabido hacer crecer su bodega, ahora vende otros productos que antes no lo hacia, esta mas surtida y atiende todo el día con la ayuda de su hija ya a la vez se dedica a su hogar.. Con este préstamo de S/. 800, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará, 1 saco de arroz, ½ saco de azúcar, leche, pan, jabón, detergente, champú, lejía, plátano, carbón, etc. Delicia es una mujer muy trabajadora, empeñosa, desde que era muy joven se dedicó a trabajar para sentirse mas independiente, y esta muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por que es un apoyo excelente y el buen trato y apoyo que recibe de su promotora.

loans.use: Purchasing more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Philo would like to buy cereals (maize, rice, millet) to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of beauty products and clothing to restock a small business.

loans.name: Aisha's Sakina Group

texts.en:
Aisha is 36-year-old, single woman with 2 children (ages 9 and 6). She began her career in tailoring in 1992. Each day, she works from 8:00 am to 12:00 pm at her business, and she generally earns a monthly profit of approximately $250 from her sales.

Aisha now seeks a loan to buy more tailoring items for her business. Notably, she will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses relating to clothing sales and vegetable sales.

loans.use: To expand and improve their respective businesses by purchasing additional materials (e.g., more tailoring items, clothing, and vegetables).

loans.name: Marlin

texts.es:
La señora Marlin L. tiene 27 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Carlos Gustavo Villalba de 32 años de edad y tiene 2 hijos q esta en la edad escolar.

La señora se dedica a la venta ambulante de de ropas y artículos varios para el hogar. Se dedica en esta actividad, desde hace 8 años. Empezó trabajando con otra señora que le proveía de las mercaderías, hasta que tuvo un pequeño capital, y pudo comprar las mercaderías al por mayor.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio está saliendo adelante, y con una clientela ya formada que le generan buenos ingresos. Para el futuro piensa abrir una tienda de ropas en su propio local.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías como remeras, pantalones, camisas, camperas, ropas de invierno y algunas de temporada verano.
texts.en:
Ms. Marlin L. is 27 years old, married to Mr. Carlos Gustavo Villalba -who is 32 years old- and has two school age children.

She is a street vendor who sells clothes and household items. She has been involved in this activity for the last 8 years. She started out working with another woman, who would provide her with the merchandise, until she was able to save up a little money and buy wholesale merchandise.

Thanks to her efforts she is getting ahead, and has several clients that allow her to earn a good income. In the future, she plans to open her own store where she will sell clothes.

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as T-shirts, pants, shirts, jackets, winter clothes, and some summer clothes.


Translated from Spanish by Gabriela Urricariet, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (clothes)

loans.name: Kosar Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Kosar Parveen Baji is the wife of I. A. Butt and lives in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places. She has been living in this city for the last 20 years. She received her education until 8th standard. She is the mother of four children: three daughters and one son. Her son is in 14th standard. Her eldest daughter is in 10th standard. The daughter younger than her is in 8th standard. Her younger daughter is in 6th standard. Her husband has a scrap business. Kosar Baji is a seamstress by profession. She sews clothes for her neighbors. She has been in this profession for the last 20 years. She is applying for a loan to buy a sewing machine to expand her clothes sewing business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy a welding machine. Bushra baji wants a loan to buy wood for her furniture making business. Nusrat baji wants a loan to buy old computer bodies to repair and to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan K., 45, is married and lives with two young children in the Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 2001, she has worked together with her husband in a recycling business. Every day, she and her husband walk their bicycle to purchase the items from house to house in the village and then resell them to the big dealer to earn a living. They are able to make US$3 of profit per day.

Chan Khen would like to take out a loan of US$600 to purchase recycling products in a large amount.

loans.use: To purchase recycling products in a large amount.

loans.name: Magreth G.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 47-year-old Magreth M. from Mbeya. She is a widow with 4 children, between the ages of 19 and 25. Magreth has been running a local restaurant business since 2001.

She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by 1 employee and her brother. She is requesting a loan of $425 in order to purchase additional stock. In the future, she plans to open another business. Magreth thanks you for your support!

When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is "restaurant" or "café," you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough made from maize flour), and plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock

loans.name: Moung

texts.en: Moung Y., 45, is married and lives with eight of her ten children and her husband in the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She sells vegetables in the market and makes $3.30 a day, while her husband is a farmer and construction worker building houses. He makes $4.50 a day. This couple also receives support from two of their children who work in garment factories. Two of their children are married and no longer live at home, three are students, and the rest help their parents work. Moung Y. would like to take out a loan of $1000 to rent a cashew nut farm and resell the nuts.

loans.use: To rent cashew nut farm

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
La señora Petrona C. C. ha logrado llevar a cabo su sueño de ser comerciante ya que ella misma ha logrado establecer su propia pulpería en su casa de habitación ubicada en el municipio de Somotillo en Chinandega.

La pulpería de la señora Petrona a ido ganando prestigio poco a poco en su comunidad debido a que ha incrementado sus productos y esto se debe gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel el cual le ha brindado créditos que los ha utilizado en la compra de los productos. Por esta razón es que en estos momentos ella espera en que Ceprodel le brinde el otro crédito para adquirir la mercadería y continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Petrona C. C. has succeeded in fulfilling her dream of being a saleswoman, in which she has established her own local store in the house in which she lives, located in the municipality of Somotillo in Chinandega. Petrona’s store has gained prestige little by little in her community because she has increased her supply stock. She was able to do this thanks to the support of Ceprodel, which has provided loans that she has used to buy products. For this reason Petrona hopes that Ceprodel will supply this other credit so that she may purchase merchandise and continue in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Estrellas De Mururata Group

texts.es:
La asociación “Estrellas de Mururata” forma parte de la familia de Pro-Mujer hace un año, grupo formado por 13 miembros que trabajan con mucha responsabilidad.  .
Distintas son las actividades del grupo, algunas se dedican a venta de golosinas, otras a la venta de productos de limpieza, también son artesanas. Una actividad muy particular es la escultura, Jorge junto a su esposa se dedican al tallado en piedra, estas obras líticas son vendidas solamente a pedido. La asociación Estrellas del Mururata desea incrementar sus ventas para esto, necesitan capital para la compra de materia prima, con la seguridad de generar mayores ingresos, que les permita ahorrar para el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “Estrellas de Mururata” Association, part of the Pro-Mujer family for one year, consists of 13 members who all work responsibly. The group's activities are varied, some sell sweets, others cleaning products, some are artisans. One particular activity is sculpture: Jorge and his wife create stone carvings, sold only by order. The Estrellas del Mururata Association wants to increase their sales, so they need capital to buy raw materials. The security of increased income will allow them to save for the future of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to buy raw materials

loans.name: Loem

texts.en: P.. a 61-year-old a resident of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, makes a living growing corn. She is the widowed mother of two children, one married and one single, both employed. Her single child also helps her in growing corn. To earn more income, P. is requesting a loan of $100 to purchase chickens and piglets to raise and some fertilizer for her crop.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon E. U. is 32 years old and married with a child. Solomon sells wine and drinks and needs a loan of N100000 to purchase more stock as he hopes to expand his business. He says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and wine to sell

loans.name: Malek

texts.en: Malek is a 42 year-old married man with two children living in Adloun in southern Lebanon. He currently works at the butcher shop he opened 16 years ago. Today, Malek wants to borrow $1,000 in order to introduce new meat into his shop to serve all his clientele.

loans.use: introducing new meat into his shop

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate P. is thirty-five years old. She is married and has  four children, two sons and two daughters, in primary and junior high school. Kate lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the eastern region of Ghana. She works to support her husband and family financially, and especially to meet the children’s school needs. Kate’s husband is a farmer who cultivates food and cash crops.


Kate is a trader. She runs a provision store on one of the principal streets in her community. She procures her goods from wholesalers in Oda and other nearby towns. She has been in business for twelve years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk.  Her intention is to expand her business and give her children the best possible education.

loans.use: To procure more groceries

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.fr:
K. Charlotte est née le 28/12/1987 à GBESSOU un village du Département de l'OUEME dont elle est originaire. Charlotte est mariée et mère d'une fille de deux(2)ans. Charlotte vit avec sa famille à Kowegbo un quartier périphérique de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Charlotte vendait des tomates fraîches de façon ambulante. Mais depuis deux(2)ans Charlotte a abandonné cette activité de vente de tomates fraîches au profit de la vente de divers produits alimentaires (tomates en boîtes, bicarbonates, pâtes alimentaires, cubes, etc.). Charlotte vend ses produits à TOKPA grand marché international du BENIN, sous un hangar qu'elle a loué auprès de la Société de Gestion des Marchés. La clientèle de Charlotte s'accroît au jour le jour et Charlotte a besoin de plus de moyens financiers qu'elle n'en a maintenant pour y répondre. C'est pourquoi Charlotte sollicite de la part de ALIDé un crédit pour mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
K. Charlotte was born on December 28, 1987 in Gbessou, a village in Oueme County, where she traces her family roots. She is married and the mother of a 2-year-old girl and lives with her family in Kowegbo, an outlying district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.

Charlotte used to sell fresh tomatoes door-to-door. But two years ago, she abandoned this business and switched to selling various grocery items (canned tomatoes, bicarbonates, pasta, cubes, etc.) She sells her merchandise at TOKPA, the grand international market of Benin, under a shed that she rented from Société de Gestion des Marchés. Her customers grow in number day by day, and she has need of more financing, which she lacks for responding to the demand. This is why she’s requesting a loan from Alidé.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 3 boxes of canned tomatoes, 3 boxes of pasta, a box of cubes, and a box of bicarbonates

loans.name: Reina Esmeralda

texts.es: Reina Esmeralda V. C. de 39 años de edad, reside en Atiquizaya en el departamento de Ahuachapán, vive junto a sus padres y un hijo. Ella posee una venta de carne de cerdo desde hace diez años, tiempo en el que ha recibido muy buenas ganancias gracias a sus ventas, ya que su carne es de primera calidad. Reina desea obtener un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más carne de cerdo. Ella desea seguir aumentando las ganancias de su negocio el cual está ubicado en el mercado municipal del lugar, y solo es a través de dicho préstamo como ella podrá surtirlo con muchas más carnes.
texts.en:
Reina Esmeralda V. C. is 39 years old and lives in Atiquizaya in the department of Ahuachapan. She lives with her parents and her son. For the past 10 years, she has run a business selling pork and has been able to earn a good income through her sales since her pork is high-quality. Reina would like a loan to be able to purchase more pork. She would like to continue increasing her revenues of her business which is located in the town's central market; it is only through a loan that she will be able to supply her store with more meat.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of more pork

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: stockpiling and selling cereals

loans.name: God's Love Group

texts.en: Agnes is married with five children along with two extended family members. She has been engaged in the sale of dry goods such as dry peppers, sugar, garrie, garden eggs, etc. within the Moulton corner, East road community Browerville for about six years now. Her customers are attracted to her business due to the lower prices she offers and this actually encourages them. Her goal is to buy more goods at wholesale to generate more profit.

loans.use: To buy dry goods for resale

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
Gulbahor is married and has three children. She lives in Tursunzade where she sells clothing in the market. She has been in this trade for 14 years. Gulbahor has an active entrepreneurial mind that is always looking for the next big opportunity. Her business is profitable and stable, but she would like to press on and expand it even more. Today, Gulbahor is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni to increase her clothing stock and meet the growing demands of the summer season. She is hoping to open a second vending facility in the future.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new mens' clothing to sell

loans.name: Losivale

texts.en:
Losivale M. is a 42 year-old woman living in the town of Taufusi S.  She is married and has 2 infant-aged children.  To make a living, Losivale owns & operates a business venture in the food production sector operating a bakery business.  Losivale earns approximately 500 WST a month from these activities.

Losivale joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD.   Losivale is now requesting a new loan of 1,300 WST which will be used to purchase more ingredients for her bakery business.  This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by her from SPBD.  Losivale plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients for her bakery business

loans.name: Bukola

texts.en: Bukola is 34 years old and married with a child who is in school. She is a hair stylist and also sells sarongs and clothes. She is requesting for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase sarongs to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe vive en la C.  “3” de la zona  Puerto Mejillones de la ciudad de El Alto

Vive con su esposa y sus hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar, en la casa de sus familiares, como cuidadores. 

El posee un camion con el cual trabaja como distribuidor en una empresa de elaboración de refrescos.
 
El crédito lo destinará para la reparación del motor de su movilidad, ya que  actualmente presenta fallas mecánicas que le impide realizar sus jornadas de trabajo completas. 
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.

loans.use: Costo de mantenimiento y reparación del motor de su camión repartidor de refrescos.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie felt relieved when she found a business partner with CEV. She said that its financing program helped lighten her burden. Tessie is a 54-year-old married woman and has six children. Her 1-hectare rice field is the source of her family’s income. She is in need of additional financial support. She asked to loan Php15,000 from CEV. This loan will truly help Tessie and her family in sustaining their farm.

loans.use: Additional financial support

loans.name: Virgenia

texts.en:
Virgenia D., who lives in the village of Nabantu-an Hills, Escalante City, Negros Occidental, is 46 years old and married to Elpidio D. who works as a dressmaker. The couple is blessed with three children who are between 19 and 23 years old and have their own families. But they are still partially dependent on their parents.

The couple works together to sustain their needs by engaging in a Tailoring business. This business has been a big help to them in raising their children and sending them to school. Their business continued to be their source of livelihood and slowly expanded but at some point, they needed more capital to continue expanding their business. This is why Virgenia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1991. She used the money she borrowed to buy Ready-to-Wear clothes, sandals, slippers and other accessories to sell. From this new venture, she was able to earn more. She used the income to defray the household expenses, paid her loan installments and the rest she plowed back into the business as working capital.

As time went by, she was able to continue using her subsequent loans to expand operations of her RTW business and still continue helping her husband with the tailoring since they shared the same space in the Escalante Public Market. Since they have been in the clothing business for over 20 years, they have gathered loyal and regular customers who also bought the ready-to-wear clothes she had for sale, so the business earns a good income of approximately PHP 15,000 a month. They are able to support their extended family and have enough left over to reinvest back in the business. 

For her previous loan, she borrowed PHP 18,000 and used this as working capital for her Tailoring and Ready to Wear Business. She paid all of her weekly installments on time and fully paid it within the loan term. Now she is borrowing the same amount of PHP 18,000 for her 17th cycle loan and the income from this will be used for house improvements. And they are looking forward to buying an electric sewing machine sometime soon so that they can finish the custom-made clothes faster with less physical effort than the manual sewing machine. They anticipate that having an electric sewing machine will allow them to increase their daily output and they will be able to accept more custom work, hence increasing their income capacity.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for tailoring and RTW

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina M. is a 45-year-old married woman who is blessed with three children between 21 and 25 years old. The family lives in the village of Brgy Miranda Hinigaran Negros Occidental. Georgina dreams of giving a proper education to her three children so that someday they will be gainfully employed, and not have to go through the difficulties she experienced in her life, needing to work hard just to survive. 

These aspirations make Georgina a strong mother to her children and mobilize her to earn for the future and family by helping her husband earn a living for their family. She started with a small general store adjacent to her house, which helped a lot in supplementing their family income, but as her children grew older, their needs also grew, especially in relation to their education. She also wanted to expand her business and offer her customers a wider range of products. This motivated her to join NWTF-Project Dungganon and that was how she started to expand her business. Now she has an electronic reloading station - selling prepaid load to mobile phone users.  Now she earns an average of PHP 10,000 per month.

In her previous loan, she borrowed Php 23,000, which she used as additional capital for her general store and electronic reloading. The said amount was paid within her loan term in full without delays. Now she is borrowing Php 24,000 as additional capital for her general store and to invest in a food vending business.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional capital for her general store and to start a food vending business

loans.name: María Sandra

texts.es: María Sandra D. L. O D. 43 años D. edad, resiD. en Sensuntepeque, departamento D. Cabañas, vive junto a sus tres hijos los cuales se dedican a estudiar. María posee una tienda D. productos perecederos en su casa, negocio el cual ha ido tratando D. mejorarlo e irlo surtiendo a través del tiempo. Es por esto que elL. solicita un préstamo con el cuál pueda comprar más productos para su tienda sobre todo productos los cuales son más solicitados por las personas. María es madre soltera, L. cual desea mejorar su negocio y así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
María Sandra D. L. O is 43 years old and resides in Sensuntepeque, in the Cabañas State. She lives with her three children who are studying in school. María has a store and sells perishables in her home. The business has has been trying to better itself and over time. For this reason, she's asking for a loan with which she can buy more products for her store; above all products that are most popular among her clients. María is a single mother, who wants to improve her business and thereby obtain greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perishable products

loans.name: Ivania Del Socorro

texts.es:
En el departamento de Estelí la señora Ivania C. se ha dedicado por varios años a la actividad de venta de bebidas como gaseosas las que son comercializadas a diario en su establecimiento en el que también ofrece alimentos de todo tipo ofrecidos a sus clientes.

Ella se ha destacado por ser una dama muy trabajadora y tiene el deber de mantener a su pequeño hijo en edad escolar por lo que solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de las bebidas y la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos, también con el crédito solventará algunos gastos leves del hogar para continuar brindándole a su familia y en especial su hijo, las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
In the Department of Esteli, Mrs. Ivania has dedicated various years to selling drinks such as soft drinks. She sells them daily in her establishment and she also offers some foods to her customers. She has stood out as a very hard-working woman and she has an obligation, caring for her small school-age son.

For that reason she is soliciting a loan to buy drinks and primary materials to make the food she sells. Also, with this loan she will cover some household costs in order to continue offering her family and, especially, her son the necessary conditions for development.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY SOFT DRINKS AND INGREDIENTS TO PREPARE FOOD TO SELL

loans.name: Rezyl

texts.en:
Rezyl C. is 23 years old and she owns a hog-raising business. She has 3 children, the eldest of whom is 4 years old. She wants her children to have a bright future, so she's working hard in her business to save for her children's future.

Rezyl has been a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. since June 2008. Now she is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to use as additional capital for her business. She would like to buy more pigs and pig food.

loans.use: To buy pigs and pig food

loans.name: Marvin Geovanny

texts.es:
el señor Marvin Geovanny E. es casado y tiene una niña de 9 años de edad,  vive en su propia casa, tiene un molino donde quiebra maiz y tambien vende sandias, melones y pescado en su carro.
Esta actividad la realiza desde hace unos 13 meses.
 
esta solicitando el credito para comprar un hielera grande del tamaño de la paila del carro para tranportar en su carro los pescados y ahora teniendo esta hielera piensa comprar camaron para vender.
texts.en:
Marvin Geovanny E. is married and has a nine year old daughter. He lives in his own house. He has a mill, and he grinds corn. He also sells watermelon, melons, and fish in his car. He has been doing this for 13 months. He is asking for a loan to buy a very large cooler to transport the fish in his car. When he has the cooler he plans to buy shrimp to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts for his corn grinder and a large cooler

loans.name: Waigumo

texts.en: Waigumo is a 60 year old married woman with two daughters and three sons. She has been running Waigumo Catering Services, which provides catering for social gatherings, for the past 11 years and employs four people. With this 40,000 KES loan, she hopes to buy more serving equipment. She hopes to become a leading provider of catering services for large occasions in the future. She also hopes to start a restaurant serving both local and international clients. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for helping her expand her business by providing her with loans. Waigumo describes herself as aggressive and competitive.

loans.use: To purchase serving equipment

loans.name: Nueva Jerusalen Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. emprendimiento NUEVA JERUSALEN cuenta con una mesa directiva que esta conformada por:

La Presidenta es la Sra. Jenny, cliente antigua, madre soltera con 5 hijos 2 aun dependientes, , trabaja en la compra D. soya por cantidad para luego embolsarla y venderla al por menor  lleva en este oficio 10 años, vive en una casa como cuidante hace 8 años anhela con el esfuerzo D. su trabajo poder comprarse su propio terreno y luego construir su propia vivienda, con el dinero del credito comprara soya por mayor y luego poder enbolsarla por cantidad.

Como Tesorera esta la Sra. Guadalupe cliente antigua, madre soltera con 6 hijos 3 aun dependientes, , trabaja en la compra D. soya por cantidad para luego embolsarla y venderla al por menor  lleva en este oficio 5 años, vive en una casa alquilada hace 6 años anhela con el esfuerzo D. su trabajo poder comprarse su propio terreno y dejarles algún patrimonio a sus hijos, con el dinero del credito comprara soya por mayor y luego poder enbolsarla por cantidad. 

Como Secretaria esta la Sra. Viviana cliente nueva, madre D. una niña conviviente hace 3 años, promotora D. productos cosméticos hace 2 años, vive en una casa alquilada desD. hace dos años atrás, con la ayuda D. esposo pronto compraran un lote D. terreno para construir su propia casa y formar una familia estable con el dinero del credito comprara productos D. belleza que estan en promosion para despues venderlos a un precio normal.

Todas las socias son personas responsables y dinamcas la mayoria mantienen solas el hogar, utilizaran el destino del credito para la compra D. mercaderia y asi poder incrementar su capital D. trabajo.

Todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Board of Directors for the “Nueva Jerusalen” (New Jerusalem) Communal Bank consists of the following members:

Sra. Jenny is the President. She is a long-time client and a single mother of five children, two of whom are dependents. She buys soybeans in bulk, which she later packages and sells at retail. Jenny has been in this business for ten years. She lives in a house for which has been the caretaker for the past eight years. Through her hard work, Jenny hopes to buy land so that she can later build her own home. She will use the money from her loan to buy soybeans in bulk so that she can package them in large quantities.

Sra. Guadalupe is the Treasurer. She is a long-time client and a single mother of six children, three of whom are dependents. She buys soybeans in bulk, which she later packages and sells at retail. Guadalupe has been in this business for five years. She has been living in a rented house for the past six years. Through her hard work, Guadalupe hopes to buy land so that she can leave an inheritance for her children. She will use the money from her loan to buy soybeans in bulk so that she can package them in large quantities.

Sra. Viviana serves as the Secretary. She is a new client who has been in a common law marriage for three years and has a daughter. Viviana has been selling cosmetics for the past two years. She has been living in a rented house for two years. With the help of her husband, she hopes to soon buy land so that they can build a house and establish a stable family. She will use the money from her loan to buy beauty products that are on sale that she can later sell at regular prices.

All of the members are responsible and dynamic people. Most of them support their families alone. This loan will be used to buy merchandise as well as increase their operating capital. They are grateful to Kiva and Emprender for trusting them by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Mrs. C., 29 years old, is a married woman and the mother of a young child who is enrolled in school. Her husband (he is pictured) has a small business where he sells many sets of cooking supply as mobility in and around the provinces of Cambodia.

In addition, C. is an internal staff member working in a garment factory. C. finds that her husband's produce sale trade is a very profitable one and it also provides the family with a good standard of living. Recently her husband has lacked a supply of cash to buy additional products to better meet the needs of his customers, so that is why C. pursues a loan.

loans.use: To buy additional products.

loans.name: Naroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Naroeun C. (pictured above), 37, and her husband, Mr. Ra Ket, 38, live in a small village across Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1996 and just have one young daughter.      

Naroeun has been a silk weaver for 20 years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband has been driving a motor taxi for 10 years. 

Naroeun is requesting her first loan of $350 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Elbia Lidia

texts.es: La Sra., Elbia Lidia ella es maestra de educación, su esposo es comerciante, tiene experiencia en crédito, ella es luchadora da clases por la mañana y después llega a la casa hacer labores en la casa a preparar la comida, ella solito el crédito para construir un anexo en su vivienda ya que su familia se compone de 6 personas, por lo tanto ella tiene capacidad de pago.
texts.en:
Elbia Lidia is a teacher and her husband has a shop. She is very hardworking, teaching in the morning and doing all household chores, including meal preparation, afterwards. Elbia Lidia has had prior loans, and is requesting this one to build an addition to her home, as her household consists of six people. She is sure of her ability to repay it.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build an addition to her home

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en: Jamal is a 40-year-old man who owns a bakery in his hometown of Bint Jbeil in southern Lebanon. A father of three, he opened his bakery in order to improve his family’s income and to be able to provide the best for his family. Jamal bakes mankoucheh, a traditional type of Lebanese bread which is usually topped with zaater -- a thyme-like herb -- and cheese or minced meat. It can be found in the hands of nearly every Lebanese person for either breakfast or lunch. The tasty bread is almost always served warm, and Jamal supplies locals with soft, fresh mankoucheh every day. Jamal has asked Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, for a loan in order to purchase raw materials and soft drinks to sell to his clients. He is grateful for the opportunity provided to him, and he is confident that this loan will enable him to sustain his business and continue to support his family.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of alcoholic beverages

loans.name: Margot Ynes

texts.es: Ines tiene 37 años de edad es soltera vive en la casa de su madre, ella presta servcio como cajera para el chifa Quan Xin ubicado en el distrito de Parcona  en la calle Pachacutec yupanqui, ella viene laborando hace 3 años consecutivamnete en este negocio, ella es una persona joven con muchos sueños y objetivos, uno de ellos es poder tener su casa y negocio propio, con el dinero que solicita invertira en algunos gastos personales.
texts.en:
Ines is 37 years old. She is single and lives in her mother’s house. She works as a cashier at the Quan Xin Chinese restaurant, located in the Parcona district, on Pachacutec Yupanqui street. She has been working for 3 consecutive years at this business. She is a young person with many dreams and goals. One of them is to own a house and her own business. She will use the money she is requesting for some personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For personal expenses

loans.name: Norma Estanislada

texts.es: La Sra. S. es originaria de la comarca Panales No 1 del municipio de El Sauce, se dedica al pequeño comercio como es la venta de medicina natural, el cual lo tiene ubicado en la Terminal de buses donde tiene 18 años de experiencia en el ramo. Solicitó el crédito como capital de trabajo para invertirlo en dicho negocio con el fin de surtirlos en variedad de este tipo de medicina. Actualmente tiene cinco años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde se le han otorgado 6 créditos consecutivos para el negocio lo que le ha cambiado su vida ya que gracias a los ingresos que obtiene de dicho negocio le ha permitido salir adelante y vivir dignamente.
texts.en:
Sra. S. is originally from the town of El Sauce in the region of Panales #1. She has a small business in the bus terminal where she sells natural medicines. Sra. S. has 18 years of experience in this field. She is requesting a loan to use as operating capital so that she can restock her business with a variety of medicines.

Sra. S. has been working with CEPRODEL for five years and has received six consecutive loans for her business. These loans have changed her life since the revenues from her business have allowed her to move forward and live with dignity.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase anti-parasitic medicines, weight loss remedies, ointments, natural herbs, salves, etc.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna C. is from the village of West Poblacion, Kalilangan Bukidnon. She is 43 years old. Elna is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Elna runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elna has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 16,000 PHP a month for these activities.
