In 2008, Elna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elna is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Elna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Tiessiri  4 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Tiessiri  4 est constitué de 10 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans, 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à Tiendo, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide,  le petit mil, le maïs et le gombo. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne et les précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, MAMOU B. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,3  hectare de maïs  et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Fana après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25.000FCFA environs en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
The Tiessiri 4 group is made up of ten married women with an average age of 47 and an average of four children. They mostly live in polygamous families in Tiendo, a village in the prefecture of Dioila, Koulikoro region (Mali's Second Administrative District). They work with Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their activity as the rainy season begins. They grow peanuts, millet, corn and okra. This will be their third seasonal loan. Their previous loans have been fully repaid. With this new loan, Mamou B. will buy fertilizer before its price goes up. She will also buy small tools and will pay for hired labor to work about 1.3 hectares of corn and peanuts. The harvest will be sold in Dioila and Fana to both men and women. The group members hope for an average profit of CFA 25,000 at the end of the season.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hire labor and buy fertilizer and small tools

loans.name: Rolanda

texts.en:
Rolanda C. is a 42-year-old widow who supports her family by operating three business ventures: computer games, a general store and a videoke business. She lives in Prk.Sunset, Brgy. Macapso, Vallehermoso, Negros Oriental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1997 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 3,000.00. 

Rolanda is now borrowing PHP Php 13,000.00 for computer games. This will be her 18th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 17,000.00, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Rolanda aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou S. est une femme de 51 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WALIDANE depuis le 08 novembre 2006. Elle a 07 fois de suite reçu de crédit qu’elle a toujours remboursé sans difficulté.

Elle développe une activité de vente de poisson frais et d’huile de palme. Elle fait aussi de l’embouche ovine.

Son prêt lui permettra d’acheter 15 moutons de l’huile de palme et du poisson frais en quantité plus importante que d’habitude afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices

Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de la famille surtout pour la nourriture et la santé
texts.en:
Fatou S. is 51 years old, married and the mother of 6 children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Walidane since November 2006. She has received 7 consecutive loans, and has had no problems in repaying them. She is developing a business selling fresh fish and palm oil. She also fattens sheep. This loan will allow her to buy 15 sheep, palm oil band fresh fish in larger quantities than normal so that she can increase her profit. Her goal is to participate in family responsibilities, especially health and nutrition.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 15 sheep, palm oil and fresh fish

loans.name: Adelita

texts.en: Adelita M. is a married woman who lives in Purok Apitong, Barangay Tabugon, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She operates two business ventures: food vending and rice farming. Her husband, Abelino M., who is 60 years old, works as a farmer and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are from 25 to 33 years old. Adelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she wished for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 13,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 4,000 PHP, uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her 9th loan, Adelita is borrowing 16,000 PHP which she intends to use to buy utensils and supplies for her food stall and fertilizer for her farm. She plans to use her profits to save for future expansion of her agricultural business. Adelita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: To buy utensils and supplies for her food stall and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela P. is 36 years old, married and has nine school-aged children. She is from the village of Barangay 4 in Talakag municipality, a part of the province of Bukidnon on the Mindanao islands. Estela runs a sari-sari (variety) shop from which she sells both food and daily use products to the local community. Estela has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Estela joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. Estela is requesting a loan, her first, of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe A. is from the town of Banga. She is 64 years old and widowed. To make a living, Fe owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for fattening and sale. Fe also runs an eatery where she cooks the food herself.
Fe joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Fe is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase piglets and feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en:
Elnur N.  owns a small store where he sells car parts. His business is located close to a car maintenance shop. This gives him an opportunity to have many repeat customers and a stable business. 

Elnur has been in this business for a year. During this time, he has developed a good business network that supplies him with the parts his customers order. Elnur would like to borrow 1000 AZN to purchase spare parts in bulk. He dreams that one day he will be able to build one more shop.

loans.use: purchase spare parts

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 26 years old and married with two children; the first one is 4 years old and the younger one is 2 years old. Jean Bosco is a businessman and his wife does not work, so that's why Jean Bosco has to work hard in order to provide all that is necessary for his family. Jean Bosco has an experience of five years and he employs one person as a helper. The hours of his daily activities are from 6 in the morning to 9 in the evening every day.

Jean Bosco is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his business through purchasing more products such as cosmetics products, powdered milk, cooking oil, and so on.

loans.use: Purchasing additional products for his store

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna, a member of Muso group in Faulu Kenya, joined the group as a business lady who sells green maize. She also does mixed farming to boost her income.  Married with four children, she works hard in order to provide for her family and hopes eventually to move her enterprise to permanent premises instead of renting.  Anna has requested a loan of 20,000 Kes to buy sacks of maize.

loans.use: To buy sacks of maize

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita B. is from the village of Tapican in Liloy, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 41 years old. Lolita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a specialized retail store where she sells daily-use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Lolita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 14800 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Lolita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Las Gaviotas I Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama LAS GAVIOTAS ya que para las integrantes del grupo la “gaviota” representa un ave que inspira tranquilidad,asi como unión entre las aves del grupo, honestidad e inteligencia. Así como las gaviotas muestran unión también en el grupo Las Gaviotas se nota la confianza entre sí. El grupo se encuentra en el Estado de Hidalgo. Está conformado por ocho integrantes cada una con un negocio ya establecido.La señora Mariela es la presidenta del grupo. Ella tiene 30 años de edad, estudió la carrera técnica en Comercio, es casada y tiene dos dependientes económicos, se considera una mujer emprendedora y con ganas de superarse. La señora se dedica a la venta de ropa. Aunque la señora Mariela lleva sólo un año con esta actividad, uno mismo puede observar la habilidad que tiene para la labor de ventas, pues con su carisma y responsabilidad logra llevar con éxito su actividad. Aparte de la venta de ropa se dedica a las actividades del hogar. Pide su crédito para invertir en su negocio y así obtener mayores ingresos y sobre todo de aprovechar su habilidad para dicha actividad  mostrando siempre ser una mujer emprendedora con camino al éxito y apoyar a su esposo para dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Las Gaviotas' (Gulls) since, for the group's members, gulls are birds that inspire calm as well as unity amongst the birds in the group, honesty and intelligence.  In the same way as gulls show unity, the Gaviotas group also shows trust between its members.  The group is located in the State of Hidalgo.  It has eight members, each one of whom has her own established business.

Mariela is the group's president.  She is 30 years old and studied a technical degree in commerce.  She is married and has two economic dependants.  She considers herself to be an enterprising woman with a desire to improve herself and her business is selling clothes.  Although Mariela has only been in this business for a year, you can clearly see the skill that she has for making sales.  With her charisma and responsibility, she manages to be successful in her business.  As well as selling clothes, she also takes care of her household chores.  She is requesting a loan to invest in her business so that she can make better profits and, above all, take advantage of her skill for this activity, always showing herself to be an enterprising woman on the road to success.  This way she can support her husband in providing their children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy winter clothes

loans.name: Manuel Elias

texts.es:
Manuel Elias A. R. tiene 50 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos , vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C SOLIDARIOS CHIMA CHICA se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos familiares, siembra maíz y en pocas cantidades las papas y el fréjol.

Manuel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato,  Quito y  San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas . Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar propiedades para que los hijos sigan sembrando.

Le gusta comprar ganado vacuno para criar y festejar la navidad y el carnaval.
texts.en:
Manuel Elias A. R. is 50 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and children in San Miguel canton, in Bolívar province.  He has three children.

The members of the Solidarios Chima Chica community bank are located 30 minutes from our San Miguel office, in San Miguel canton.  The members of this group work in farming.  This is their source of family income.  They grown corn and also, in small quantities, potatoes and beans.

Manuel grows corn and potatoes.  He buys his products in Ambato, Quito and San Miguel and sells them in San Miguel market on Thursdays.  He is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies.  The support of this loan will help him to cover his needs financially.  Manuel faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases, illnesses and changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy property so that children can continue to grow crops.  He likes to buy cattle to raise and he likes to celebrate Christmas and Carnaval.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies

loans.name: John Ole

texts.en:
John, 24 years old of age has practiced livestock farming in Naivasha town for the last two years.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy five cows which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

In future, John hopes to practice large scale zero grazing and become a leading supplier of animals products in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy five cows which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Amahoro Group

texts.en: Josiane owns a foodstuffs business. She is married to a farmer and they have two children who are between two and five years old. None of her children attend school yet because they are still young. Josiane is the leader of a borrowing group called Amahoro in Kinyarwanda, which means “The Peace” in English. Josiane sells foodstuffs such as beans and sorghum. She has had this business for two years. She will use the loan to add more foodstuffs to sell. With the profits, she will build a house as well as buy cattle to raise. She would like to have 500,000 RWF as a loan amount in the future.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Angel Andres

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Virgen De Monserrate. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

Don Ángel es socio  fundador del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Tiene 45 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tiene  tres hijos, el mayor este año termina el colegio y los otros están en colegio. Su esposa es ama de casa.

Se dedica a la compra y  venta de pescado, el se desplaza en su carro todos los días con la ayuda de otra persona a la cual le paga un sueldo semanal, ellos desde la madrugada van a las playas de Salango y Crucita a comprar el pescado para llevarlo a entregar a Santo Domingo, Chone, Portoviejo y otras ciudades. El entrega a comerciantes al por mayor en esas ciudades.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado para llevarlas a vender a esas ciudades. Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y que su negocio mejore dia a dia.
texts.en: In the city of Charapoto, the Communal Bank Virgen de Monserrate meets every fifteen days.  This locality is known for its traditional culture and also for being within minutes of two of the best beaches of the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.  Don Angel is a founding member of this communal bank and likes it because of the low interest rates in comparison to other credit institutions.  He is 45 years old, married, and has three children.  The eldest finishes school this year and the other are still in school.  His wife is a housewife.  He works in the purchase and sale of fish.  He goes every day, with the help of another person who he pays a weekly salary, to Salango and Crucita Beach at day break to purchase fish that he then delivers to Santo Domingo, Chone, Portoviejo, and other cities.  He sells them to wholesale buyers in these cities.  This credit is to be able to purchase more fish to take to these cities.  His dream is to continue working so that his business can improve daily.

loans.use: Purchase fish.

loans.name: Mrs. Chhorvorn Saom Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people make up this village bank loan in Ta Muong village, Takeo province. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their families'  standard of living. They have selected Mrs. Chhorvorn S. to be their village bank president. 

Mrs. Chhorvorn S. and her husband, Mr. Sambath Moav, are farmers who own a small piece of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family. He is also a construction worker. They are only able to earn a small income even though they try to work hard. Mrs. Chhorvorn S., therefore, would like to request a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. She is the mother of two children who are too small to work or study.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Maria Ursula

texts.es:
Maria Ursula tiene 39 años de edad y tiene una hija menor de edad escolar. Vive en casa propia en la zona rural del distrito de Tucume en Lambayeque, Peru. No cuenta con servicios de luz y agua en su domicilio. Su comunidad es pequeña con aproximadamente 100 familias. 

Se dedica al servicio de costura y también a la crianza de aves de corral como gallinas y pavos. Cría los animales menores hasta que han alcanzado un buen tamaño y peso y luego los vende en el mercado local. Realiza estas actividades desde hace seis años en su domicilio. Aprendió las actividades de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Cuenta con una clientela ya establecida en la zona.

Maria Ursula desea atender a los constantes pedidos que la campaña escolar demanda. Por ello, ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar una maquina industrial de coser. También invertirá una parte de su préstamo en la compra de alimento balanceado para el engorde de sus aves. Con estas actividades, espera generar mayores ingresos. Maria Ursula tiene muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su comunidad. Es honesta y trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es lograr que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Ursula is 39 years old and has a young daughter that is in school.  She lives in a house she owns in the rural district of Tucume in Lambayeque, Peru.  She doesn't have power or water services at her home.  Her community is small with approximately 100 families.   

She works providing tailoring services as well as raising birds in the pen such as chickens and turkeys.  When the birds have reached a good size and weight she sells them in the local market.  She has raised birds at home for six years, she learned to do it from her parents and has become an expert.  She has a regular customer base in the area. 

Maria Ursula wishes to fulfill the constant orders that school season brings.  For this, she has requested Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 1,500 new soles ($550) to buy an industrial sewing machine.  She will also invest part of her loan in buying feed for the birds.  With these activities she hopes to generate higher income.  Maria Ursula has very good personal and professional references in her community.  She is honest and hardworking.  Her biggest dream is to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy an industrial sewing machine as well as feed for her birds

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es: Maricela R. Ortiz cuenta con un negocio de abarrotes desde hace 1 año, llamado Miscelánea “La Estrellita” donde ofrece abarrotes, refrescos, botas y mas. Este negocio lo instalo pensando en el bienestar de la familia y atender los quehaceres del hogar. Maricela de esta manera apoya a su esposa con los gastos por lo que necesita el apoyo para comprar mas mercancía y así obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Maricela R. Ortiz has had a grocery store, called “Miscelánea La Estrellita,” for the past year where she stocks groceries, beverages, snacks and others.  She started the business thinking of her family’s wellbeing and being able to take care of household chores.  Maricela helps her husband meet expenses this way and this is why she needs help to buy more merchandise and thus earn higher income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buying and selling of bamboo business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now, and also earns additional income from her sari-sari store. 

Myrna requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy bamboo to sell. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase some bamboo to resell

loans.name: Nou

texts.en: Nou C., 52, is married and resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She is a farmer and has raised chickens since 2000, earning an income about 1 USD per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income about 5 USD per day. They have 3 children who work. They earn 9.5 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend 75 USD on food, 5 USD on utility expenses, 15 USD in fees and 80 USD on the other necessary expenses. C. is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to open a motor repair station and purchase the equipment. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to open a motor repair station

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena es una cliente de 52 años de edad, madre de dos hijas a su cargo. Magdalena y sus niñas viven en la casa de sus padres en  un pueblo joven (comunidad de personas de condición pobre, cuyas casas están en desarrollo) llamado San Martín, en Chiclayo. Magdalena vive allí desde su nacimiento y este lugar ha ido progresando gracias a la inversión pública del Estado.

Magdalena se dedica a la venta de golosinas y diversos productos comestibles. Esta labor la realiza desde hace 10 años, en un kiosco ubicado en el exterior del Hospital Naylamp en Chiclayo. Lugar donde trabaja diariamente desde las 6 de la mañana. 

Magdalena desea invertir en compra de abarrotes, golosinas y gaseosas, agua entre otros y solicita un préstamo a Edpyme aLternativa de 1000 nuevos soles que será destinado a tener mayor stock en sus productos, para venta directa sin tener que esperar pedidos.

Magdalena tiene buenas referencias en la zona, por su trabajo y carisma.

Magdalena es un cliente recurrente de  Edpyme Alternativa, realiza sus pagos de manera puntual.  Este préstamo le ayudará a incrementar su mercadería y obtener mayores ingresos para  mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 52 years old and she has 2 daughters in her care. Magdalena and her girls live in her parents' house in a new village (a community of poor people whose homes are being constructed) called San Martin, in Chiclayo. Magdalena has lived there since her birth and this community has been developing thanks to investments by the State.

Magdalena sells sweets and various food products. She has managed her business for the past 10 years from a kiosk located near the Naylamp hospital in Chiclayo. She works every day, starting at 6 a.m.

Magdalena wants to invest in the purchase of grocery items, sweets, soft drinks, water, and other products. And for this reason she requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles. The funds will be destined to acquire a larger inventory of products to proceed with direct sales, without having to wait for orders. 

Magdalena has good references in the region for her work and for her charisma.

Magdalena is a recurring client of Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) and she makes payments in a timely manner. This loan will help her increase her merchandise and to obtain a greater income in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, soft drinks, and groceries for her business.

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila is 40 years old and has given birth to three children. Her eldest son has a job while the others are studying, attending a local school. Her husband is a "loader" by trade and uses his horse cart to deliver goods to designated places. 

Jamila is a housewife, staying at home and doing her household responsibilities. She is very active and performs her tasks very well. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to buy a new cart because his current cart has become old and needs a replacement. By purchasing a new cart, he will be able to provide better services to his clients and earn more profits. 

Jamila hopes that the loan will be beneficial for her husband and improve the living standard of her family as a result. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Jamila.

loans.use: To buy a new cart for transport business.

loans.name: Jokker Endem Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Joker Endam a été créé le 17 Mai 2011 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Il compte 25 femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles font toutes le petit commerce.


Madame Aminata (assise un peu à gauche du groupe et levant la main) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 20 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant.


Elle vend de l’arachide en détail. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus d’une année.


Son crédit va lui permettre d’acheter de l’arachide pour la revente.


Avec les bénéfices elle compte appuyer son mari dans les charges domestiques.
texts.en:
The Joker Endam group was created on May 17, 2011, at the same time as their "Banc villageois" was inaugurated. It comprises 25 women, who all live in the same village. They are all retailers.

Mrs. Aminata, who is sitting towards the left of the group with her hand raised, is the group's leader. She is 20 years old, married, and a mother of one.

She retails ground nuts. She has been in this business for over a year.

Her loan will allow her to purchase ground nuts to resell.

With the profit, she intends to assist her husband with domestic expenditures.

loans.use: to purchase ground nuts for resale.

loans.name: Jose Homero

texts.es:
Jose Homero tiene 24 años, es soltewro vive con los padres, no tiene hijos vive en el Recinto Agua Clara Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C VIRGEN DEL HUAYCO, esta conformada por 14 socios y se encuentra en el Recinto Loma de Guacalgoto a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y frejol y algunos a la comercialización ya sea de harinas o de animales.

Jose  se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz y frejol. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos para los cultivos, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. No ha enfrentado desafios importantes. Su sueño es estudiar y tener un titulo universitario.

Le gusta ser una persona alegre y colaboradora y hacer un poco de deporte.
texts.en:
Jose Homero is 24 years old.  He is single and lives with his parents in Agua Clara, in Chillanes canton.  He does not have any children.

The Virgen del Huayco community bank has 14 members and is located in Loma de Guacalgoto, 20 minutes from our Chillanes office.  The members of this community bank work in agriculture, growing corn and beans.  Some sell flour or animals.

José is a farmer who grows corn and beans.  He makes his purchases in Chillanes and San Pablo and makes his sales in the Sunday market in Chillanes.

This loan will help José to buy supplies for his crops.  The loan has supported him in increasing his crop production.  He hasn't faced any serious challenges.  His dream is to study and gain a university degree.

José enjoys being a cheerful and cooperative person and he enjoys taking part in sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his crops

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de una consultoría sobre ingeniería, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar en su trabajo. La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar la licitación de su empresa que presta servicios.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
She is a member of the communal bank "Patron San Sebastian". It is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

She is 38 years old, married common-law, and she has 2 children. She alternates her daily activities with her engineering consulting company. She works from 8am to 7pm and it is through this work that she is able to provide for her children. She wants to improve her work. She requests a loan to cover the tender fees incurred by the business' services.

She is happy for the loan and she is committed to making the loan payments.

loans.use: to cover the tender fees incurred by the business' services.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario es una madre de familia de 27 años de edad. Ella vive en el distrito Las Arenas en Piura, esta es una comunidad rural en vías de desarrollo. Rosario vive junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos, 3 de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar.

Rosario se dedica a la compra y venta de animales, aves de corral y cerdos. Además, ella produce y comercializa harina, chicha de jora (la jora es un maíz que se encuentra en la zona norte del Perú) y pequeños platos de comida, en su propio domicilio o haciendo entregas en la ciudad de Piura. Cuenta con 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y tiene clientela fija. 	

Rosario solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar el alimento balanceado que sus aves y cerdos requieren, para llegar a un peso y tamaño adecuado. Otra parte del crédito será invertida en la compra de insumos para los alimentos que Rosario produce. 

Rosario es una mujer trabajadora que goza de buenas referencias, por el  empeño que pone al realizar sus actividades.
texts.en:
Rosario is a mother who is 27 years old. She lives in the Las Arenas district in Piura. This is a developing, rural community. Rosario lives with her husband and four children, three of whom are of school age.

Rosario is dedicated to buying and selling animals, poultry and pigs. Additionally, she produces and sells flour,"chicha de jora" (jora is a maize found in the northern area of Peru) and small dishes in her own house or going into the city of Piura. She has five years of experience with the business and has a fixed customer list.

Rosario is requesting from Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 1000 new "soles" to buy feed that her birds and pigs need so they can reach an adequate weight and size. Another part of the loan will be invested in the purchase of ingredients for the dishes that Rosario produces.

Rosario is a hard-working woman who enjoys good references for the commitment that she makes to her work.

loans.use: to buy feed and ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie is 28 years old, married and has three young children. She is a residence of Jimenez, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines.

While cars are only one part of living, they must be cared for. Two years ago Gerlie started selling spare auto parts and tires and earns a monthly total of 3,000 PHP.

Earlier this year, Gerlie became a GDMPC member. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy spare auto parts and tires to replace old ones.

Gerlie hopes to sustain her family’s livelihood and plans for other business ventures to generate a better life for them.

loans.use: to buy spare auto parts and tires to replace old ones.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
Socorro is a widowed mother of one child. Socorro is 60 years old and lives in Zamora Aloran, Misamis Occidental.
She vends food such as different kinds of viand, snacks like puto, soman, hotcake, etc. to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,200 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan  of PHP 5,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her food vending business.
Socorro has been a member of PMPC for a year.  In the future, Soccoro hopes to have a food stall.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for food vending

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos: de 26 años de edad y tiene un hijo,el se dedica a la crianza de animales y a la elavoracion de pan desde hace dos años, nos cuenta que gracias a Dios le a ido bien en su negocio y sus ventas han aumentado ahora el esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas animales para la crianza y cuando ya estan grandes venderlos para recuperar sus ganacias, y tambien esta solicitando este credito para la compra de arina para la elavoracion de pan el sueño de el es agrandar mas sus negocios tamto de animales como de panadero,y darle un futuro de mas oportunidades a su hijo.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 26 years old and has one child. He has been raising animals and making bread for two years. He says that thanks to God he has done well in his business and his sales have increased.

Now he is requesting a loan to buy more animals to raise. When the animals are grown, he sells them in order to recover his investment. He is also requesting this loan to buy flour for making bread.

His dream is to expand his businesses, both raising animals and his bakery, so that he can provide his child more opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to buy animals to sell and flour for making bread.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Valentina; tiene 40 años de edad,  la socia es conviviente; la socia tiene 3 hijos ; La socia es comerciante minorista, la socia en el mes de Julio, la socia realiza banderas de la patria y las vende en la calle de forma independientes en la av. Principal y vende bien todas las dos primeras semanas, en la época navideña ella realiza manualidades como adornos navideños y muchos motivos para la época, y en cualquier otra época del año la socia realiza servicio ambulatorio en las esquinas de las calles principales llamadas a celulares a nivel nacional, ella tiene 4 celulares los cuales están cargados y ella con su distintivo verde fosforescente se para o tiene una banca de plástico y las personas se acercan a solicitar servicio de llamadas a celulares y teléfonos fijos, la socia cobra el minuto 0.50 centavos de sol. La socia en esta ocasión solicita el préstamo para invertir en la recarga de sus 4 celulares.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the San Rafael Communal Bank, which is located in the Huanchac District of Cusco Province, in the Cusco Region.

Valentina is 40 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children.  She is a retailer.  In July, she makes national flags and sells them independently on the Avenida Principal.  She always makes good sales in the first two weeks.  During Christmas time, she makes handicrafts such as Christmas decorations and many seasonal motifs.  During the rest of the year she offers nationwide calling cell phone services on the corners of main intersections.  She has four prepaid cell phones and, dressed in her distinctive neon green,  she stands, or sometimes brings a plastic bench, and people come to her to make cell phone calls to other cell phones or to land lines.  She charges 50 cents per minute.  At the moment, she is requesting a loan to pay for minutes for her four cell phones.  

She is thankful for any help she receives and also promises to be disciplined in making her payments.

loans.use: to pay for minutes on her four cell phones

loans.name: Ma De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La señora Ma de los Ángeles  es una mujer muy emprendedora que a pesar de la situación económica que esta en el país, cuenta con su negocio de venta de ropa usada de buena calidad que ofrece a sus amistades y vecinos aun bajo precio. Ma de los Ángeles es una señora grande de edad, la cual no la detiene seguir trabajando en lo que le gusta y ser dependiente de si misma.
 El negocio ha permanecido 5 años por la atención que ofrece y amabilidad al atender a sus clientes, esta es parte de su fuente de ingresos a parte la que su esposo gana como agricultor. Para que el negocio siga generando ingresos necesita comprar ropa de temporada.
texts.en:
Despite the financial situation that has impacted her country, Sra. Ma de los Ángeles is an enterprising woman who has a business selling used clothes of good quality to her friends and neighbors at a low price. Even though she is an older woman, Ma de los Ángeles continues to work because she enjoys what she does and has people who are depending on her.

She has been in business for five years, managing her inventory and serving her customers with friendliness. This business provides part of her income since her husband works as a farmer. She wants her business to continue generating income, so she needs to buy seasonal clothing.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia is a 39-year-old married woman with five children, two of whom are in school. She has a business selling beer in the town of Kator in South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.
Zakia requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more beer for sale. She will use the extra income to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more beer for sale.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis Alfredo tiene 24 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene una hija, vive con la esposa y con la hija de dos años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC Cevallos, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan del Pueblo viejo Perteneciente a Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas  a la siembra de cacao.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao las compras y ventas las realizan en San Juan. Solicita el crédito para poder dar mantenimiento al cultivo de cacao para poder aspirar a venderlo a un precio más conveniente.

El Crédito será de mucha ayuda para suplir necesidades económicas y mantener en buenas condiciones el cacao. Los desafíos  a los que se  enfrenta a diario son  la competencia, las plagas y las enfermedades que puedan dañar  al cultivo.

El sueño de Luis  es poder comprarse una casa para poder vivir con la familia, en los tiempos libres le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Luis Alfredo is 24, lives in a common-law relationship and has a daughter.  He lives with his wife and his two year-old daughter in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province. He’s a member of the “Cevallos” communal bank that’s located in Recinto San Francisco that is part of San Juan del Pueblo Viejo Parish in Ventanas. They grow cacao. 

Luis grows cacao, and carries out his sales and purchases in San Juan. He is applying for the loan to maintain his cacao crop, so that he can hope to sell it at a better price.

The loan will be a big help to him in meeting his financial needs, and maintaining his cacao crop in good condition. The challenges he faces daily are competition, pests and crop diseases. Luis' dream is to be able to buy a house for himself and his family. In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: To maintain his cacao crop.

loans.name: Erkaiym's Group

texts.en:
Erkaiym is the leader of this group. She is 43 and married to a mechanic, whose monthly salary is 6,000 KGS. Together with her husband she has raised two children, the older son is a farmer and the daughter studies at school; she is going to graduate this year. Two years ago the family started to breed livestock in order to resell it after fattening. With money received from the loan, Erkaiym wants to purchase two livestock animals for breeding, fattening and further resale. In the future with the profits gained from this activity, she plans to finish the house construction.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Joveline

texts.en:
Joveline is an entrepreneur from Talibon, Bohol. She has been running a sari-sari (variety) store business for 11 years. Joveline sells items like biscuits, coffee, and sugar to the people in her community. Joveline works hard to improve her business.

Joveline has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as rice and canned goods. Joveline hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy items such as rice and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe, age 47, earns a living by raising pigs for sale. Fe has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities. Fe and her husband live in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. They have two adult children. 
  
Fe is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. In 2010, Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr. Marcos; el tiene 44 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; el socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de taller de mecanica,el arregla diferentes carros y tambien hace mantenimientos,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de taller de mecanica .El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para los carros y tambien comprar autopartes al por mayor.



El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sr. Marcos is 44 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. He continues to manage his auto repair business. He fixes different cars and also performs maintenance. Marcos works alone from 8am to 6pm. Through his business, he is able to help his children move forward. Marcos wants to expand and improve his auto repair shop, so he is requesting a loan to buy auto parts and purchase them wholesale.

He is pleased with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts in bulk.

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es: Vidal de 46 años, esta casado con saturnina de 38 años, fruto de este amor tienen 3 hermosos hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicado en el distrito de Pichari. Vidal es un hombre con muchas ganas de salir adelante, él es un agricultor dedicado al cultivo de café en su parcela ubicada en su comunidad. Él cuenta que todo esto lo aprendió de sus padres, cuando era pequeño siempre lo llevaban al campo donde le gustó el trabajo que hasta la actualidad continua con ese legado. Generalmente trabaja juntamente con su querida esposa que es quien esta pendiente de los trabajos que se realiza en la chacra, pero en épocas de cosecha siempre requieren de ayuda, por lo que contrata a peones para que le puedan apoyar a recolectar los frutos de café para luego despulparlo y llevarlo al secadero, y finalmente ser comercializado. Vidal desea en un futuro comprarse una casa en la ciudad para poder abrir ahí un negocio. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles comprará sacos de abono orgánico para sus plantaciones de café.
texts.en:
Vidal is 46 years old.  He’s married to 38 year old Saturnina and they have three lovely children.  They live together in their own home, located in the Pichari district.  Vidal is a man with a great desire to get ahead.  He raises coffee on a parcel of land in his community and says that he learned this from his parents.  They would always take him to the fields when he was a boy and he liked the work and continues this legacy.

He generally works with his dear wife who watches over the work he does in the fields, but during harvest season he needs more help and hires field hands to collect the coffee, remove the pulp, take it to the drying area, and sell it.

Vidal would like to buy himself a house in town so that he can open a business there.  This will be his first loan through MFP and he is committed to making his payments on time.  He will use the 1,500 PEN ($575) to buy sacs of fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 37-year-old businesswoman. She is married to Samuel and they are blessed with three children. 
Jane has been running a retail shop for the past three years. She makes a monthly income of 20,000 KES, which she uses to support her family. She is applying for her fourth loan with Kiva partner KADET after repaying her previous loan successfully. Jane will use this loan to buy stocks of sugar and rice for her shop. With the anticipated profit from her business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and open a wholesale shop, which will help her improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy stocks of sugar and rice for her shop.

loans.name: Sandra Marlene

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo Provincia de Manabi, se reúne el Banco Comunal Nuevos Horizontes este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
Aquí conocimos a la señora Sandra, tiene 35 años  de edad, es madre soltera de  una niña de  6 años de edad que estudian en escuela. Ella es Lic. En  Ciencias de la Educación.  Esta desde el inicio en  el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la oportunidad de pertenecer a este grupo y así poder recibir  los beneficios del banco.

Trabaja como maestra en una escuela privada en la localidad y también se dedica a la venta de productos Lebel (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella realiza sus ventas en los momentos que está desocupada de sus labores de maestra y también les vende a sus compañeras y madres de familia, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Tiene dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería.
 
Sus sueños son tener un bazar y un nombramiento del Estado en una escuela o colegio.
texts.en:
The Nuevos Horizontes (New Horizons) communal bank meets in the 24 de Mayo canton in the Manabi Province.  This place is known for its beautiful scenery and for its hard working people who devote themselves to farming and raising animals.

This is where we meet Sandra, age 35.  She is the single mother of a six year old daughter who goes to school.  She has a Bachelor’s Degree in Education.  She has been a member of the communal bank ever since it started.  She likes it because of the opportunity to belong to this group.  That way she is able to receive the benefits of the bank.

She works as a teacher in a private school in the area.  She also sells Lebel products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories).  She makes her sales during the time when she is not busy with her work as a teacher.  She also sells to her colleagues and mothers of her students.  She leaves her products on credit, and she collects every eight days.  She has been doing this business activity for two years, and it is going very well for her.

She will use the loan to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, and jewelry.

Her dreams are to have a variety store and an appointment to a state school.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, and jewelry.

loans.name: Benkadi Kagoua 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe  Benkadi Kagoua 6 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Kouroubadougou, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec    AMI GOUBA, debout au milieu  en complet rouge, sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte  acheter des intrants, semence, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour  pour l’exploitation de 0,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 80.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi Kagoua 6 group are married women with an average age of 40, on average 5 children, and who all live in traditional family settings in Kouroubadougou, one of the villages in San, the 4th administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 3rd loan with the institution. The previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Ami Goua, standing in the middle of the picture and wearing the red outfit, farms groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small agricultural equipment, and to pay the labour costs for the cultivation of half a hectare of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in her village and at the San market, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 80 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to support her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small equipment, and to pay labour costs.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina operates a mini grocery shop at Abura. She is married and has 2 children.  Her husband is a farmer. She uses her income to support her husband in educating, feeding, and clothing her children. Her loan will be used to buy variety of groceries to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a bigger shop.

loans.use: variety of grocery like soap, canned fish and other items to sell

loans.name: Watende

texts.en: Watende is a 30 year old entrepreneur who is married with two children. Together, they live in Rufiji District, Tanzania. To give back to her community, Watende is a Camfed Learner Guide who teaches life skills to students in her nearby secondary school. She is requesting a Kiva loan to start a Money Transfer business. She will use mobile money services such as Tigo-Pesa, M-Pesa and Airtel Money to carry out this business. She will use the obtained profit from the loan to provide for household expenses, buy credit for her business, and remain with cash to run the business.

loans.use: to start a business of Money Transfer (Transaction)

loans.name: Boucotte Yamatogne Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de neuf femmes qui exercent le commerce. Elles sont liées solidairement et prennent des prêts qu'elles remboursent à temps. Madame khardiata qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est veuve, âgée de 75 ans et mère de quatre enfants dont trois filles. Elle s'active depuis plus de dix ans dans la vente de tissus et de parfums. Elle va acheter avec le prêt sollicité dix rouleaux de douze mètre de tissus, un carton d'allume-feu et cent flacons de parfums. Elle est la seule à vendre ses produits dans sa localité. les bénéfices vont servir à aider à la prise en charge de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group is composed of nine businesswomen. They are mutually liable and the loans they take are repaid on time. Khardiata, on the right in the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative.
She is a 75 year old widow and the mother of four children, three of whom are girls.
For over ten years she has sold fabrics and perfumes. With this loan she is seeking, she will buy ten 12 metre rolls of cloth, a box of firelighters and one hundred perfume bottles.
She is the only person selling these products locally. The profits will be used to cover the children's living expenses.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, perfumes and firelighters.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock.

loans.name: Romanus

texts.en:
Romanus is married and has five children; four attend school. He also takes care of three orphaned children of his brother. He is educated to level 8 and he started his clothing business in 2000 and has been managing the business since then. The business has been able to generate income for the family’s needs. He hopes to increase his income by expanding his business.

Given the loan he intends to expand his business by buying cloths in bulk and targeting other markets where he has not been able to reach yet.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: No

texts.en: No is 38 years old and her husband, Nam, is 44. Their daughter is 17. She has stopped going to school in order to work. They have 1000 square meters of land for cultivation. No also sells cylindrical sticky rice cakes door-to-door. Their income is $10 per person per month. No is requesting a loan of $75 to purchase the materials for making more rice cakes. This will increase her sales and her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase the materials for making sticky rice cakes

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando is a married father of four, and only the youngest, 17, lives at home. His spouse is a housewife. To make ends meet, Fernando has provided carpentry service for the past 17 years. Fortunately, after working at a shop for a number of years, he was able to come up with enough to open his own business. His experience working with wood and his joy for his work have helped make high-quality products.

To keep growing his business, Fernando is requesting a loan of $375 to purchase needed supplies for his shop. He plans to repay the loan within three months. With your help, you can improve this family's quality of life. They are very grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Fernando es casado y tiene 4 hijos, solo el más pequeño, de 17 años de edad, vive con él. Su esposa se dedica al hogar, para conseguir lo necesario para su familia Fernando ofrece sus servicios de carpintería desde hace 17 años, afortunadamente después de trabajar en un taller durante varios años, logró reunir lo suficiente para abrir su propio negocio, la experiencia que tiene en el manejo de la madera y el gusto que tiene por esta labor lo han llevado a realizar productos de muy buena calidad.

Para hacer crecer su negocio, ahora necesita de un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que utilizará en la compra de los materiales que requiere en su taller, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Con tu ayuda podrás mejorar la vida de esta familia, decídete a cooperar, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr:
Mrs. Eya A., 40 years old, is married and the mother of eight (8) children and is supporting five (5) other persons. All the household resposinbilities lie on her because her husband is often absent and totally neglects his role as a father. Her principal activity is the sale of vegetables and food products. In spite of her efforts, Mrs. Eya A.’s activities are not profitable because her household expenses are quite heavy. She is fighting so that her children can get out of the vicious circle of poverty. In order to expand the size of her business and increase her sales figures, Mrs. Eya A. is requesting a loan of $1000 that she will use as working capital.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 40 ans, Madame A. Eya est mariée est mère de huit (8) enfants et a à sa charge cinq (5) autres personnes. Toute la charge de la famille se repose sur elle car le mari est souvent absent et néglige totalement son rôle de père de famille. Son activité principale est la vente des légumes et des produits vivriers. Malgré ses efforts, Madame A. Eya n’arrive pas à fructifier ses activités car les charges du ménage sont assez lourdes. Elle se bat pour que tous ses enfants puissent réussir et sortir de ce cercle vicieux de la pauvreté. Afin d’augmenter la taille de son activité et accroître son chiffre d’affaire, Madame A. Eya sollicite un apport financier de $1000 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce.

loans.use: Purchase and resale of food products and vegetables

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
"I need to enlarge the size of my home since the space is small and we are a family of six. I would like to have two more rooms. I seek $1200 to make my home a bit more spacious. "

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

“Necesito ampliar un poco mi vivienda ya que es muy reducido el espacio que tenemos y somos 6 de familia, me gustaría hacer dos cuartos más ” Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para ampliar un poco mi vivienda.

loans.use: enlarge my home

loans.name: Maualalo

texts.en: Maualalo is a fifty two year old mother of five children from the village of Tufulele. Three of her children are now living in New Zealand and the other two are still in Samoa. She and her husband earn income from selling the produce from their vegetable garden. Maualalo's husband worked hard in order to upgrade their business. He sells their vegetables every weekend at the food market. The business has become successful and they are no longer worried that they will not have enough money to accommodate their needs. Maualalo and her husband are requesting this loan through SPBD to expand their business.

loans.use: To buy new vegetable seeds and fertilizer for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Maesaroh

texts.en: Maesaroh is a 27-year-old woman. She raises goats at her house. She has to care for and feed them every day. She can sell them after six months, earning about US$ 20 per 6 months. Her husband, S., has no fixed income. She is requesting a loan of US$ 125 to expand her little livestock business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of her livestock business

loans.name: Abida's Group

texts.en:
"I am Abida P. from a small city: Arifwala, Pakistan. My husband needs to buy a rickshaw for which we are requesting a loan. Currently, he rents someone’s rickshaw to drive. I have two boys: one is two years old and other four months. I plan to buy a cow with the additional profits, which we expect to get through the purchase of our own rickshaw.

My group members who are in need of loans are: Khursheed B. who wants a loan to buy a donkey cart; Shumaila B. who wants to expand their grocery store; Zareena B. who requires a loan for their lumberyard; and Majeeda B. who intends a loan to buy sheep for their livestock trading. Ume-Kalsoom B. will use the loan to buy stock for their grocery store."

loans.use: Buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Kieu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Kiều Thị Sơn, 27 years old, lives with her husband and a 6 years old S. in Sóc Sơn. She joins the TYM Fund in 2001 when her S. was 8 months old. The funds of her first loan was invested in wedding parties such as china, utensils and decorative items for her rental business. Though the income was hefty in wedding seaS., off seaS. had different story. In 2006, she converts her rental business to a refreshment distributor which serves fruits and refreshment to general population and also other businesses as well. This business gives a more stable monthly income of 300USD. She is applying a loan of 1200USD to stock more goods.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Kiều Thị Sơn, 27 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 1 con trai 6 tuổi tại Sóc Sơn. Chị Sơn bắt đầu tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2001, sau khi sinh con được 8 tháng. Số vốn vay lần đầu được chị Sơn đầu tư mua phông bạt, bát đĩa cho thuê đám cưới. Mỗi lần cho thuê mang lại cho chị lợi nhuận vài chục USD. Thu nhập bình quân cũng khá nhưng vào những tháng không phải trong mùa cưới thường không có việc. Năm 2006 chị Sơn chuyển sang buôn bán bánh kẹo, hoa quả, nước giải khát phục vụ nhu cầu tiêu dùng của người dân trong địa phương và bán buôn cho các cửa hàng trong huyện. Do đã hoạt động kinh doanh phục vụ đám cưới từ thời gian trước nên cửa hàng của chị được rất nhiều người biết đến. Thu nhập bình quân của cửa hàng đạt 300USD/tháng. Với khả năng phát triển của cửa hàng nên vòng vốn này chị Sơn tiếp tục xin vay 1200USD mua bánh kẹo, rượu bia.

loans.use: Buy confectionary, wine, beer

loans.name: Jesil

texts.es:
Señora Carol is popular and loved in her neighborhood. Her tireless, fighting spirit allowed her to open a business from her house. No one imagined it would later become the busiest store in her area, all thanks to her strength, dedication and good customer service.

Carol succeded in providing all the necessities for her family, most importantly the education of her little children. Now with more peace in her life she has great aspirations and hopes for the future. One of these is to expand the variety and quantity of her store’s stock. For this goal, she turns to you for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Carol es muy popular y querida en su barrio, su incansable espíritu luchador la hizo emprender un negocio al interior de su vivienda, jamás se imaginó que con el transcurso del tiempo se convertiría en una de las más concurridas bodeguitas de su zona, gracias a su esfuerzo, dedicación y sobre todo buen trato a sus clientes, logró suplir satisfactoriamente las necesidades de su hogar, sobre todo la educación de sus pequeños niños.Actualmente con la tranquilidad ya dada tiene grandes aspiraciones en mente e ilusiones en la vida , una de ellas es la de ampliar y aumentar la variedad y stock de su mercadería, con ese propósito recurre a ti persona para solicitarte un préstamo.

loans.use: Invest in a greater quantity of goods for her store

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Jenny is a hardworking person and for this reason she is dedicated to more than one activity. She raises animals and manages a small store in her own home. Along with her husband she has worked for seven years and they are sure that success will come with time and depends on the efforts of each one of them to achieve it. They want to improve the conditions of breeding their animals and increase the quantity of products of their small store.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Jenny es una persona muy trabajadora y por esa razón se dedica a más de una actividad. Cría animales y administra una pequeña tienda en su propio domicilio. En compañía de su esposo lleva siete años de labor y están seguros que el progreso es se dará con el tiempo y depende del esfuerzo de cada uno de ellos para alcanzarlo. Desean mejorar las condiciones de crianza de sus animalitos e incrementar la cantidad de productos de su pequeña tienda.

loans.use: Increase in capital to upgrade her two activities

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! Pictured above is 32 year-old Oliver C.. She is married and has four children ages between 1 and 13. In 2003, Oliver established her crop wholesaling business. Oliver has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice in bulk.

loans.name: Chhen

texts.en: Chhen P., age 53, has a business arranging the wedding ceremonies in the village. She knows local singers and has all the equipment and supplies needed to celebrate, such as tables and chairs. Her business has been operating for five years and on average she makes around $5 per day of profit. Her husband of 25 years works as a teacher in the village and makes $2 per day. This couple has nine children, six of whom are married and no longer live at home; the rest are employed and sometimes help their parents with work. To allow Mrs. Chhen’s business to handle larger parties or wedding ceremonies, she is requesting a loan to help her purchase more tables and chairs.

loans.use: To purchase more tables, chairs, plates and etc...

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.en:
Hafiza is 30-year-old woman living in Stanić Rijeci, a small community outside the town of Doboj. She is married and has one 4-year-old son. Her husband works full-time as a baker, while she has a job as a cook in a local restaurant. Like many Bosnian families, they practice subsistence farming, growing crops to feed their family and their livestock.

Hafiza is taking this, her first loan, in the amount of 1200 KM (US$ 975) to help renovate part of their home in order to create storage space for corn. Right now they do not have enough space to hold all their corn over the winter, so Hafiza plans to buy some supplies to complete the renovation, and also buy some tools to help with the harvesting process. She hopes that the good weather will continue and that she will have plenty of food for the winter months.

Hafiza also plans to buy some chickens, and will use this corn to feed them through the winter as well.

loans.use: To buy tools for farming and to renovate crop storage space

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Mr. Francisco Perez is originally from the town of Condega in a region called Pueblo Nuevo. He is married with two children. He is dedicated to agriculture through the production of basic grains as well as the cultivation of vegetables, which is his principal economic activity.

Because this gentleman does not have sufficient capital to attend to his system of production, he approached Ceprodel to obtain financing for agriculture.

To date he has obtained seven loans over a period of five years, which have generated a positive impact on production and earnings, improving his quality of life and production.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Francisco P. es originario del municipio de Condega en una comarca llamada Pueblo Nuevo, es casado y con dos hijos. Se dedica a la agricultura por medio de la producción de granos básicos así como al cultivo de las hortalizas, ya que este es la principal actividad económica.

Debido a que este caballero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para asistir su sistema de producción, acudió a Ceprodel para obtener un financiamiento para su agricultura.

Hasta la fecha ha obtenido financiamiento por siete créditos en un periodo de 5 años el cual le ha generado un impacto positivo en las producciones y sus ingresos mejorando así su nivel de vida y producción.

loans.use: Agricultural Supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add selling fruit and vegetables to her present business

loans.name: Jema

texts.en:
Jema, age 49, has owned a small shop, or kiosk, in Zanzibar for 10 years. She sells a variety of small household items and snacks.

She is currently able to earn a profit of approximately $40 each month. She is hopeful that as a result of her first loan from BRAC Tanzania, she will be able to increase her profit.

For 10 years she has stocked her shop with only her minimal monthly profits, so access to this larger lump sum will help her to boost the inventory in her shop beyond what she has otherwise been capable of.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her small shop.

loans.name: Channa

texts.en:
Mrs. Channa C. is a villager in Kraing Boteay Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a small plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. 

Her husband, Mr. Pom Ngan, is a cow breeder who raises cows to sell. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it, so his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy two more cows for breeding. 

Mrs. Channa C. is 33 and does not have any children. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy two more cows for breeding.

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Un S., 40, is married and resides with her husband and six of their children in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers who grow bananas and beans. The couple also obtained a mill, with which they provide grinding service to the people in the village for additional profit. On average, they earn a combined income of around $14 a day. Two of their children work in garment factories and three are students.  Un S. is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a horse and a cart to help her transport bananas and beans from her home to the market.

loans.use: To purchase horse and a cart to transport farm produce.

loans.name: Ehui

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants, Mme Ehui T. est née en 1977 à Davié dans la préfecture de ZIO au Sud du Togo. Elle est revendeuse de la farine de manioc ou « gari », un produit alimentaire de base des populations de sa localité. Elle est pratiquement la seule revendeuse de sa zone mais ses moyens financiers étant limités, elle n’arrive pas à satisfaire pleinement ses clients. Elle demande donc un crédit pour constituer en gros des stocks de farines afin de les revendre en détail à ses clients. C’est une activité très génératrice de revenus qui lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
A married mother of five (05) children, Mrs. Ehui T. was born in 1977 in Davié in the prefecture of Zio in southern Togo. She is a retailer of manioc flour ('gari'), a basic food product for the population in her area. She is virtually the only seller in her locality, but since her financial means are limited, she is unable to fully satisfy her customers. She is thus asking for a loan to build up her stocks of flour in bulk in order to re-sell them at retail to her customers. This is a business that generates a lot of income, which will allow her to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell manioc flour

loans.name: Sae

texts.en: Sae S. is a grocer and owns a small grocery store in Tra Beak village in Takeo province, Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. Seas Chin, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. His field has infertile soil affecting the growth of his crops.  In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Sae S. requests a loan to purchase fertilizer to support the rice plantation to make the crops more productive. She is 53 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory and the other is attending a local school. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to support the field to make crops more productive.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija has been a cloth (khanga: traditional Tanzanian fabric) seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for 1 year. She belongs to Stahili Salama Group (Group code 2053).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 125. Every day she works at her business from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more "khanga" for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Khadija is 20 years old and married.

loans.use: To buy more cloth (khanga) for her business

loans.name: Bayiyana Regina Group

texts.en:
Bayiyana R. is a 56-year-old widow with seven children. She has a one-room house. Though she doesn’t have electricity she has access to piped water. She also looks after three children who lost their parents. She has three meals a day and her greatest expense is tuition for her children.

Bayiyana R. sells charcoal in the market from a store she rents. She works seven days a week.

She has done this business for 15 years now, though prior to this she was selling roasted chicken. The main challenge she faces while doing this business is that she pays high rent for the place she works. The rainy season also affects her business so much because most of the village roads where she collects her charcoal from are spoiled by the rains so transporting becomes difficult.

She has been with Kiva's partner MCDT for six years now and the reason why she chose MCDT was because she wanted to access loans to improve in her business.
