She has worked with her group for six years and she will use this loan to increase her stock. She also wants to see all her children finish their education

loans.use: Increase her stock

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 43 years old and married with a child. He makes lady’s hair nets of various shapes and sizes. The demand for his hair nets is high. He hopes for the loan to purchase more materials like wool, thread, etc to make more hair nets to sell. He hopes to expand this business and thanks all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to make ladies hair net

loans.name: Mil Flores Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha:   Angela María L. J., Josefa Paulina B. y 
María Teresa
texts.en: Photograph from Left to Right: Angela María L. J., Josefa Paulina B. and María Teresa

loans.use: To purchase more products to offer to customers, including basic needs such as grains, detergents, meats, sweets/snacks, etc.

loans.name: Trương's Group

texts.en:
T. Trương Thị (20203050031) is a 56-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. T. is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by DINARI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách 06 (6).

T. is married and has three adult children. T. raises cattle for sale and has been engaged in this business for over eight years.

T. joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 5,152,000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. The loan will be her first loan from DINARI. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Trương Thị L. (20203050032) is a 45-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 IDR loan to support her livestock-raising business.

2. Trương Thị T. (20203050033) is a 40-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 IDR loan to support her livestock-raising business.

3. Nguyễn Thị P. (20203050034) is a 50-year-old female who is requesting a 3,808,000 IDR loan to support her livestock-raising business.

4. Nguyễn Thị T. (20203050035) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 IDR loan to support her livestock-raising business.

5. Nguyễn Thị N. (20203050036) is a 25-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 IDR loan to support her service-based business.


About DINARI:
The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


*****************************************************

T. Trương Thị (20203050031) là 56 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở T. phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các T. viên. Mặc dù mỗi T. viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá N., nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các T. viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ô Cách 06 (6).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm. 0 T. đã tham gia DINARI để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. 0 Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 IDR.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ DINARI.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. Trương Thị L. (20203050032) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2. Trương Thị T. (20203050033) là 40 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3. Nguyễn Thị P. (20203050034) là 50 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.808.000 IDR. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

4. Nguyễn Thị T. (20203050035) là 34 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

5. Nguyễn Thị N. (20203050036) là 25 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.

Về DINARI:
Nhiệm vụ của DINARI là cố gắng giữ giàn một môi trường cho phép người nghèo và tạo cơ hội phát triển kinh tế xã hội cho những chủ doanh nghiệp nhỏ.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Luy

texts.en: Luy M. is 44 and lives in a rural area of Phnom Penh City, in Cambodia. She is a good homemaker who cares for the children and cooks delicious food for her family. The entire family’s expense are covered by her husband who works selling natural medicines. He buys his medicines at the cheapest price from the people who live around the forest located far from his house. The couple has three children: two are married and one is single. Luy M. is a very responsible mother who wants her single child to attain a suitable job but she is unable to make that possible because she has no capital. Therefore, she has decided to ask for a loan for capital to purchase a motorcycle for her child to begin running a taxi service.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing maize

loans.name: Piotr

texts.en:
Mr. G. buys goods from the wholesale market in Falesti.  Commercial surplus is in addition of 30 - 40%, depending on the type of merchandise sold. He sells flour, sugar, cereals, oil and pasta.
For the preservation of goods, the customer has a deposit. Mr. G. decided to buy a minibus for transporting goods, in order to minimize transportation costs. Advantages to the proposed business and lending are: application to permanent food; business is managed by the owner. 
The loan is required for procuring minibus to transport goods.

Microinvest issues him a loan and wishes him success.

loans.use: To procure minibus to transport goods

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 30-year-old single man. He lives in Ramallah, Palestine. For a living, Ahmad sells coffee and tea. Ahmad works tirelessly from 8:00 in the morning until 10:00 at night.

Ahmad is requesting a loan of US $1500 to expand his business by increasing his working capital. He and his family are very grateful for the support that you give to allow him to continue his business and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: Expand his business and increase his working capital

loans.name: Palepa Makesi

texts.en:
Palepa F.'s main source of income comes from making and selling pork products in her community. She is a 34-year-old woman living in the town of Sinamoga. She is married and has two babies. Palepa has been in this business for over three years and earns approximately 450 WST a month.

In 2008, Palepa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Palepa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 500 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

Palepa is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This will be her second loan from SPBD. Palepa plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. (0)

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Eleazar Bruno

texts.es:
El señor Eleazar Bruno es padre de familia y tiene dos hijos que actual mentes están estudiando. 
Solicita un préstamo para poder comprar los uniformes y los útiles escolares a sus niños ya que, empiezan el ciclo escolar y no cuanta con el dinero para surtir los útiles y comprar los uniformes.
El trabaja en un taller de mecánica en el departamento de ventas de piezas de autos, este es el ingreso que tiene para su familia y con el cual una parte será para pagar el préstamo.
texts.en:
Sr. Eleazar Bruno is a family man who has two children who are currently studying. He is requesting a loan so that he can buy uniforms and school supplies for his children. The school year is starting and he does not have the money to pay for these items.

Sr. Eleazar sells auto parts at a mechanics shop. His income enables him to support his family and part of it will be used to repay this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase uniforms & school supplies

loans.name: Lleny

texts.es:
La señora Lleny, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Picota”, Distrito D. Picota, Provincia D. Picota, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 40 años y es madre D. 03 hijos, 01 que aun esta bajo su poder y estudia. 

Ante la necesidad D. aportar al ingreso económico del hogar, motivada por ella misma, emprendió su pequeño negocio D. venta D. abarrotes, se inicio con S/. 500.00, ubicada en su misma casa. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, donD. sus principales clientes son los vecinos D. su barrio.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas,  insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas  y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá, en la compra D. insumos, para preparar sus comidas.

Hoy se siente muy feliz D. la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lleny is part of the “Picota” Community Bank, in the District of Picota, Picota Province, and San Martin State. She is a forty year old married woman and the mother of three children, one of which is still under her care and is a student.

Faced with the need to contribute financially to the household income, and being self motivated, she started a small business selling groceries. She began with S/ 500.00 while located in her own home. At the present time she continues with the same business and her main customers are the people from her neighborhood.

With this loan of S/.2,000.00 she will buy more goods to stock her business such as rice and sugar by the kilogram, eggs in cartons, personal hygiene products, housecleaning products, soft drinks in packages, candy and other products to keep her customers happy. Part of the money will also be invested in buying supplies to prepare her meals.

Nowadays, she feels very happy to work and for the service she provides and she thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for supporting people who like her, want to work and get ahead. She hopes they continue doing so and help many families and entrepreneurial women.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will purchase groceries to augment her stock.

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en: 33-year-old Cecilia L. owns a hectare of rice field. She is married to Rey L. and they have 5 children, with 16 years old as the oldest. Her harvest experience varies from good to not so good. But she is thankful nonetheless especially if the price of rice is high during harvest time. Cecilia is in need of additional financial support. She requested to loan Php15, 000, which she will use to finance her farm. This loan will help Cecilia in her farming business.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
La señora Olga es socia del Banco Comunal “8 de Septiembre” del distrito de Acora, Provincia de el Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 50 años de edad, de estado civil separada, tiene 04  hijos, vive en el Sector Pilluyo, estudio educación secundaria incompleta (3er grado).

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela R. hace varios años, es una de las socias fundadoras, inicio su préstamo con la suma de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado ovino.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino, ganado vacuno y algunos cerdos.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones y los ahorros

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado vacuno, ovino y porcino.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca has been married to her husband Rogelio for 36 years. They are blessed with four children. Having their own rice field, Rebecca is very grateful she does not have to till other people’s land like other farmers do. Her farm still needs additional inputs, but she does not let herself worry anymore because she has been a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. for a year now. She requested to borrow 12,000 Philippine pesos. This loan will be used to fund her farm. In due time, Rebecca will have an abundant harvest.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Amigas Inseparables Group

texts.es:
El Banco de emprendimiento AMIGAS INSEPARABLES se encuentra en su 2do ciclo. Sra. Loida; Ella es presidenta del grupo,  se dedica a la venta de carteras de cuero, su mercaderia la compra en la ciudad de Santa Cruz y cuando tiene muchos pedidos, viaja hasta la ciudad de Oruro.El crédito solicitado es para invertir en su negocio comprara una variedad de carteras para las fietsas de fin de año, su deseo de la señora es ampliar su negocio.Ella manifiesta estar agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
Sra. Marisol es la tesorera del grupo; es separada de su esposo, tiene dos hijos con los cuales vive; se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva trabaja como ambulante, no tiene puesto fijo el crédito solicitado lo invirtió comprando mercadería. Manifiesta estar agradecida por el crédito otorgado.
Sr. Juan, es el secretario del grupo el se dedica al servicio del trasporte, tiene un taxi, con el cual mantiene a su familia, esposa y tres hijos, aun en edad escolar.La cliente esta agradecida por al apoyo brindado por la institución.
texts.en:
The AMIGAS INSEPARABLES enterprising bank is in its second cycle. Loida is the group leader and sells leather wallets. She buys her materials in the city of Santa Cruz and, when she has a lot of orders, travels to the city of Oruro. The requested financing is to buy a variety of wallets for end-of-year festivities; she wishes to expand her business. She is grateful to the institution for the help rendered. Marisol is the group treasurer. She is separated from her husband and has two children that live with her. She is a traveling salesperson of new clothing; she does not have a fixed place of business. The requested funds were used to buy merchandise. She states that she is grateful for the credit extended to her. Juan is the group secretary and supports his family, made up of his wife and three school-age children, with his earnings as a taxi driver. He is grateful for the help he has gotten from the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Francis

texts.es:
Francis J. M. es una joven señora de 21 años de edad la cual vive con su esposo en  una comunidad llamada Hernández localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa con grandes paisajes, presenta una gran humedad y además se encuentra sobre la carretera muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, tubérculos y  naranja.

Desde hace aproximadamente  seis meses que Francis se dedica a la cría de cerdo para engorde. Ella vende sus productos a los vecinos de la comunidad, quienes se muestran muy satisfechos por la calidad de estos. Comenta que desde que inició el proyecto se ha sentido muy feliz puesto que su negocio día con día crece.

Actualmente Francis está solicitando un microcrédito de ¢ 670,000 (seiscientos setenta mil colones)  para la compra de más cerdos para engorde, así como compra de alimento y otros insumos necesarios para este fin y compra de materiales para mejorar el local donde están los animales y si es posible. Con esta inversión espera que su microempresa se fortalezca y crezca más, para poder atraer a más clientes y ofrecerles mejores productos. Todo esto ayudará a mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. 

Francis es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Francis J. M. is a young 21 year old woman who lives with her husband in Hernández, a community located in Los Chiles, in the province of Alajuela. This area stands out for being a mountainous area with great landscapes and a lot of humidity. It’s situated near the highway located near the northern border of the country. The primary economic activities are ranching and farming of primarily basic grains, tubers and oranges.

For the last six months, Francis has been raising pigs. She sells her products to community neighbors who seem to be very satisfied with the quality of the products. She mentions that since she started this project she has felt very happy since her business is growing every day.

Francis is requesting a loan of ¢ 670,000 colones to buy more pigs as well as to buy food and other supplies needed for this project as well as to buy materials to improve the animals’ shelter if possible. With this investment, she hopes her micro business will get stronger and grow more, attract more clients and offer them better products. All of this will help her quality of life and the quality of life of her family.

Francis is a member of “por un Desarrollo” Community Credit Enterprise, one of EDESA’s 100 member organizations in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan and she hopes to grow more at both a personal and an economic level. She also stresses that she is thankful for this organization and the way it facilitates loans so she can dedicate more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: David Guadalupe

texts.es: El Joven David Guadalupe T. cuanta con 19 años de edad soltero reside en el lugar conocido como caserío Tzan Nimasac, Municipio y departamento de Totonicapán  Guatemala C.A. en la actualidad está prestando su servicios como albañil desde hace ya cinco años por la necesidad y los bajos ingresos que está obteniendo no son suficientes para adquirir más herramientas por lo que se acerco a las oficinas de la Asociación ASDIR para adquirir un préstamo para la compra de una herramienta para mejorar su trabajo, obteniendo así mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
David Guadalupe T. is a single young man who is 19 years of age and lives in the village known as Tzan Nimasac, which is part of the town and department of Totonicapán, Guatemala, Central America. He currently offers his services as a bricklayer and has been doing this type of work for five years. His income is not sufficient to purchase more tools necessary to perform his job. For this reason, he went to the offices of Asociación ASDIR to obtain a loan so that he can purchase these tools to improve his work, increase his income, and provide his family with a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools for performing masonry work

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene L. is from the village of Clarin Settlement. She is 31 years old. Irene is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Irene owns & operates a "sari-sari" store/general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Irene has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Irene joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irene has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Irene is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Irene from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica del departamento de León, el señor Mario Alberto G. se ha dedicado desde hace seis años a su actividad de venta de productos varios atendiendo su propia pulpería que siempre está buscando la manera de surtirla para abastecer a sus clientes que le visitan.
Se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y por velar por el sustento de su hogar ya que es padre soltero y con un hijo al que debe de mantener. El crédito que está solicitando lo invertirá directamente en la compra de los productos para la pulpería entre los que se encuentran granos básicos, aceite, jabón, ace, cloro y papen higiénico. Con dicho crédito logra suplir sus estantes para satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the town of Telica and department of León, Sr. Mario Alberto G. has been selling various products from his own store for the past six years. He is always looking for ways to provide for the customers who visit him.

Mario is known as a hard worker who supports his household. He is a single father with one dependent child. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy products for his store such as basic grains, oil, soap, bleach, and toilet paper. He hopes to restock his shelves so that he can satisfy his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama P. est âgée de 74 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de TOULY depuis 3 ans et demi. Son crédit lui permet de mener un commerce de fruits de saison, grâce à cette activité elle participe au bien-être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mariama P. is 74 years old, married and has five children. She has been a member of the village bank in TOULY for three and a half years. Her loan will allow her to run a seasonal fruits business, and thanks to this business she can contribute to the well-being of her family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintain her commercial activity

loans.name: Moises

texts.es:
El Sr. Moisés vive en la localidad Santa Rita municipio de El Torno, su actividad principal es el servicio de transporte de personas con su mototaxi, tiene como segunda actividad la venta de ganado los fines de semana, lo cual le ayuda para poder mantener su familia, su esposa con la cual tienen 2 hijos solo se dedica a los labores del hogar, no tienen domicilio propio por lo que vive en la casa de su hermano, como portero, ya que a viajado al exterior. Uno de sus deseos es de tener una casa propia y tambien ver a sus hijos profesionales. Con el dinero del credito comprara otra motocicleta ya que la que tiene esta con algunas fallas y lo que el desea es brindar mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Esta agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sr. Moisés lives in the Santa Rita neighborhood in the town of El Tomo. He provides passenger transport services in his motorcycle taxi. He also has a side business selling livestock on the weekends, which helps him support his wife and two children. They do not own a home so they live at his brother’s house and his wife takes care of the domestic work. When he was a soccer goalkeeper, he had the chance to travel outside of the country. Among his wishes are to have his own house and see his children become professionals.

With the money he is requesting, Moisés will purchase another motorcycle since the one he currently has experienced numerous mechanical failures. He hopes to provide better service to his customers.

Moisés is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for trusting him by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Celeste

texts.pt:
Celeste Chitchango nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 37 anos de idade casada e mãe de 2 filhos de 18 e 15 anos de idade todos vão a escola. Fez somente 9 ª classe, não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos progenitores. Vive na casa própria com o seu esposo que é motorista de profissão e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu do bairro onde vivia com os seus pais para o bairro de Jardim junto ao seu marido. Tem um negocio proprio há mais de 2 anos, não possui nenhum empregado, trabalha sem horário fixo, fazendo cerca de 12 horas de trabalho por dia. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.500.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum através de Xitique semanal (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um vizinho que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (areia, cimento, pedra, tijoleiras e outros) para melhorar as condições de Habitação na sua família.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar ainda mais na sua actividade comercial.
texts.en:
Celeste Chitchango was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in the south of Mozambique. She is 37 years old, married, and is the mother of 2 children who are 18 and 15 years old. Both children attend school. Celeste only studied through 9th grade, and didn't continue because of her parents' lack of financial resources. She lives in her own home with her husband, who works as a driver, and she isn't responsible for supporting anyone else financially. She left the neighborhood where she lived with her parents to go to the Jardim neighborhood with her husband. She has owned her own business for more that 2 years and doesn't have any other employees. She doesn't work on a fixed schedule but works around 12 hours a day. She earns approximately 5500.00 meticales each month, and uses this money to pay for household expenses. She also saves some money each week through Xitique (a traditional system of rotating savings). Celeste has never taken out a loan with another bank. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through a neighbor who also works with the institution. This is her 1st loan, for the amount of 20,000.00 Meticales. She plans to use this money to buy construction materials (sand, cement, stones, bricks and other items) in order to improve her family's living conditions. Her earlier loans were for 13,000.00 Meticales e 18,000.00 Meticales, and both were used for the same purpose. She promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future she would like to apply for more loans to put towards her business activities.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, stone, and other items)

loans.name: Perpetua

texts.en: Perpetua E. joined ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap Inc.), a Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 2005. Since then, she has grown to love the organization. ASHI helped her in the start-up of a business, supporting her husband with their daily expenditures. She and her husband have been direct selling Avon products for more than five years and also embarked in buying and selling dried fish in the local community. She now proposes that her eighth loan, amounting to 45,000.00 Philippine pesos, be used to continue her businesses with the support of her husband. She will purchase inventory of supplies like cologne, body lotion, lipstick, sandals, shoes, perfumes, jackets and other stock. The remaining loan funds will be used for her dried-fish business for additional income. Expanding Perpetua’s business will be the source of income to finance the needs of her family and to have a comfortable house to live in. She also hopes to expand her business and if possible, have a branch in other provinces, particularly in her hometown in order to provide employment to her relatives. She is very thankful to all members of ASHI for educating her, especially in dealing with other people and the ability to accept new challenges in her life and in achieving her dreams to improve their way of life. Perpetua is also grateful to the ASHI-Kiva partnership for supporting people like her who want to move away from poverty and get ahead. She hopes that they continue this way for a long time and help many poor families. The couple has a strong belief not to be affected by poverty; instead they are inspired to work hard for their five children. About ASHI As a micro-finance institution that uses the Grameen methodology, Ahon sa Hirap (ASHI), being the first practitioner in the field, saw how poor women and mothers work hard to earn money for the cash flow of their families and to provide their children with a better life. The micro-credit ASHI is extending to these women is delivered directly to their villages and on the doorstep of their houses. When the loan is handed over to them, it is giving them hope that someday they will rise above poverty. (“Rise above poverty” is a direct English translation of “Ahon sa Hirap.”)

loans.use: To purchase inventory of cologne, body lotion, lipstick, sandals, shoes, perfumes, jackets, etc., and to support her dried fish business

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula tiene 32 años de edad, es separada y vive junto a sus dos hijos en el caserío Santa Isabel, una zona rural  del distrito de Mórrope, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica al comercio de aves de corral y de cerdos desde hace doce años, ella cría aves de corral y las ofrece en venta a los comerciantes que usualmente visitan la zona. Adicionalmente compra cerdos para criarlos y vender su carne por kilos luego de sacrificarlos. El negocio es de mucha importancia para su familia ya que les brinda los recursos que necesitan para salir adelante, además gracias a el sus vecinos se agencian de carne para su consumo, la cual no les es muy accesible dado que la zona en donde vive se ubica lejos del mercado más cercano.

Paula desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de aves de corral y cerdos medianos con su respectivo alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio, como  no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer luchadora que ha sabido salir adelante a pesar de su condición de madre soltera. Sus vecinos y conocidos la estiman mucho y la consideran una mujer responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Paula is 32 years old, separated from her spouse, and lives with her two children in the village of Santa Isabel, a rural district in the District of Mórrope, Lambayeque Province. This community is located 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Paula has been selling poultry and pigs for twelve years. She sells the poultry to traders who usually visit the area. In addition, she buys pigs to raise and then sells the meat by the kilo after butchering them. This business is of great importance to her family because it provides the necessary resources for them to move forward. Her neighbors request meat from her to consume because it is not readily available since the area where they live is located far away from the nearest market.

Paula wants to expand her business by buying poultry, medium-sized pigs, and balanced animal feed. Since she does not have enough capital to do this, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1200 PEN. Paula is a woman who has fought to get ahead despite her status as a single mother. Her neighbors and acquaintances respect her greatly and consider her to be a responsible and trustworthy woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase poultry, pigs, and animal feed to expand her business

loans.name: Koitat

texts.en:
Koitat N. is 39 years old and married to Kibiyoto N.. He is a father of three children, all of whom are currently attending school. Koitat is a farmer and he has been in the farming business for the last six years.

He learned about Kiva Field Partner 'KADET' from other members in his home area who had already registered as KADET clients. Koitat is now on his second loan cycle with the organization and with this loan he plans to plant twenty acres of wheat, which has been doing very well in his area. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to lease more land for farming to increase his wheat production. The area has favorable climate conditions for wheat farming, thus making him think of these operations as a sole specialty.

His future dream is to buy a bigger piece of land whereby he can expand his wheat farming for commercial purposes and be the leading farmer in his area.

loans.use: To prepare land for wheat planting.

loans.name: Maria Parado De Bellido Ii Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Maria P. B. II inicia su ciclo 1 con 13 socias. Las socias son D. la Distrito D. Paras, Provincia D.  Cangallo, se ubica a 3 horas D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Las actividades principales D. la comunidad son la agricultura, ganadería y el comercio.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. animales menores, abarrotes en general, comida, productos veterinarios y panadería.
Como es el caso D. la Señora Norma que es presidenta del Banco Comunal y es socia hace 1 año y medio, Norma es casada y tiene 3 hijos, Norma tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, ropa, calzados, verduras, frutas, su negocio lo inicio en casa alquilada con pocos productos, actualmente tiene local propio y granD., actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su esposo, su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, verduras, frutas. Los sueños D. Norma son que sus hijos sean profesionales, comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 500soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles haciendo un total D. 14,200 soles.
texts.en:
The Maria P. B. village bank is starting its first cycle with 13 members, all from the Paras district in the Cangallo provine, 3 hours from the city of Ayacucho, Peru. Most members of the community work in agriculture, livestock, or sales. The group members work in various types of businesses like selling small animals, groceries, food, veterinary products, or bread. Normal is the president of the village bank and has been a member for a year and a half. She is married with 3 children. She runs a small store in her home where she sells groceries, clothes, shoes, vegetables, and fruit. She started her business in a rented home with very few products; now she has her own locale which is much larger and her husband helps her with the business. Her loan will be used to buy sugar, vegetables, and fruit. Norma dreams of helping her children to have careers and to someday buy a car to transport her products. The group members need different loan amounts like $175, $210, and $350 for a total of $5000.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, vegetables and fruit

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar B. is from the village of San Jose. He is 39 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Oscar owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Oscar has been engaged in his business for over eight years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP whenever he sells his harvested rice.
In 2006, Oscar joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Oscar is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be his eighth from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: La Unidad Group

texts.es:
El grupo “LA UNIDAD” decidieron ponerle el nombre de LA UNIDAD debido a que es un crédito familiar y todos los integrantes se dedican al negocio. La representante es la señora María Jesús Pérez L., el negocio de este grupo es el la elaboración de artesanías ellos realizan flores, abanicos, petates, canastos, forros para botellas, sombreros, bolsas de mano, tiene 2 hijos, que estudian la preparatoria y sus hijas mayores le ayudan en esta actividad ya que es un trabajo tedioso. Doña Janet no esta casada y su actividad dentro del negocio es elaborar las flores para adornar los productos que realizan, doña Severina es viuda ya no tiene hijos que dependan de ella más sin embargo, ella se encarga de hacer la costura tanto de forros como de los sombreros que elaboran, doña María Jesús se encarga de realizar el pintado y secado de las hojas de maíz, del pantano, del guano y de hacer el cortado de cañita para elaborar los petates, doña María Elena es la encargada de realizar las compras de joloche (hojas de maíz), del pantano, del guano, de listones y demás materia prima que necesitan para realizar sus productos. Este grupo vende sus productos a los artesanos que se ubican en la ciudad de Villahermosa, así como en eventos que realiza el gobierno estatal o municipal. 

Doña María Jesús, su madre y sus hijas, utilizan su crédito para la compra de materia prima tales como pegamentos, listones, guano, pantano, cañitas, pinturas, alambres, telas para forros, hilos, hileras, agujas y demás accesorios que necesiten para adornar los productos que realizan, Este grupo sueña con tener a largo plazo un local amplio en la ciudad de Villahermosa y bien ubicado para que sus productos tengan una demanda y que su negocio sea autosostenible. Son mujeres  muy trabajadoras  y responsables es un grupo familiar por lo que su lema es “la unión hace la fuerza” de ahí se deriva su nombre.  

Están agradecidas con el apoyo que le brinda la Fundación y KIVA ya que el crédito otorgado les ha servido de mucho para salir adelante en sus actividades, y de seguir trabajando con este crédito ven cada vez mas cerca la realización de su sueño.
texts.en:
The group "LA UNIDAD" (The Unity) decided to give themselves the name LA UNIDAD because this is a family loan, and all of the members work in the business. The representative is Sra. María Jesús Pérez L.. This group's business is the making of crafts, such as flowers, fans, knapsacks, baskets, coverings for bottles, hats, and handbags. She has two children, who study in the preparatory school, and her older daughters help her in her work, since it is a tedious job.

Janet is not married, and her activity within the business is to make the flowers that decorate the products that they make. Severina is a widow and doesn't have any children that depend on her anymore. She is in charge of the sewing of the coverings as well as the hats that they make. María Jesús is in charge of the painting and drying of the corn leaves, marsh leaves, palm leaves, and to cut the sticks to make the knapsacks. María Elena is in charge of buying the joloche (corn leaves), marsh leaves, palm leaves, ribbons, and other raw materials that they need to make their products. This group sells their products to the artisans that are located in the city of Villahermosa, as well as in events that the state or municipal government put on.

María Jesús, her mother, and her daughters, will use the loan for the purchase of raw materials such as glue, ribbon, palm leaves, marsh leaves, kabob sticks, paint, wire, fabric for coverings, thread, string, needles and the rest of the accessories that they need to decorate the products that they make. This group has a long term dream to have a spacious and well-located place in the city of Villahermosa where their products have demand and where their business can be self-sustainable. They are very hard-working and responsible women. It is a family group, and therefore their motto is: "There is strength in numbers", and it is from there that they derive their name.

They are grateful for the support offered by the Foundation and KIVA, since the loan granted has served them a lot to get ahead in their activities, and by continuing to work with this loan, every time they see themselves closer to realizing their dream.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sticks, paints, glue, wire, thread, palm leaves, and silicon

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina L. is from the town of Santa Josefa. She is 32 years old. Josefina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Josefina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Josefina has been engaged in her business for over 20 years. Just like any other mother, her dream is to see all of her children finish college.

Josefina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Josefina from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies & equipment.

loans.name: Gnonoussi

texts.fr: cette femme malgré ses 50 ans est une femme très dynamique exerce toujours son métier de couture, elle a 3 personnes à sa charge et c'est cette activité qui lui permet de subvenir à leurs besoins. elle a reçu des commandes de ses clients mais ne peut les satisfaire à cause de  du manque de certains matériaux de travail, elle souhaite s'approvisionner c'est pour cette raison qu'elle sollicite de WAGES un prêt pour l'achat de fermetures, grippures, fils et autres.
texts.en:
Despite her age, this very dynamic 50-year old woman still carries on her dressmaking trade. She has three dependants, and this activity allows her to provide for their needs. Unable to fill the orders placed by her customers due to a shortage of supplies, she requested a loan from WAGES to purchase sewing notions including fasteners, guipure, thread and more.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric and sewing notions

loans.name: Gesila

texts.en:
Gesila C. is a married woman who lives in Barangay Arbor, Boljoon, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store business. Her 52 year old husband, Romolo C., works as a taxi driver to earn his living. They have 4 children, 11 to 20 years old. 

Gesila joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 9 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gesila has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, thus, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 10th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000 which she intends to use expand her general store so that she can continue to save up for the family's future and to improve their way of life. Gesila C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina nación en la ciudad de Cachimayo y tiene 23 años. Actualmente, Luz Marina vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con su esposo y su hijo (Hamlet de dos años). La ciudad de Cachinayo se encuentra ubicada a 25 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.   

Luz Marina se dedica a brindar servicios de llamadas a teléfonos móviles de forma ambulatoria. Hace 8 meses que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. La pueden encontrar en la calle Teqte cerca al centro comercial Nazarenth de la ciudad del Cusco, desde las 9 de la mañanas hasta 8 de la noche. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Luz Marina que espera recibir S/. 1000 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar minutos de llamadas para recargar los teléfonos móviles. El sueño de la socia es comprarse una casa y un carro.  

El banco comunal “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” tiene tres años y medio de funcionamiento, Luz Marina pertenece desde hace tres años al banco comunal y le va muy bien. Los socios de este lugar son devotos del Taytacha Ccoyllority (El señor de la Nieve Brillante) y por esa razón le pusieron el nombre al banco comunal.
texts.en:
Luz Marina, 23, was born in the city of Cachimayo. She currently lives in Cusco with her husband and son, Hamlet, 2. Cachinayo is located 25 minutes from Cusco. Luz Marina sells cell phone services. She has been in this line of work for 8 months and does well. One can find her on Teqte Street near Cusco’s Nazarenth Shopping Center from 9am until 8pm. Luz Marina expects to get 1000 new soles in her next loan that she’d like to use to buy pre-paid cell phone calling cards. Her dream is to purchase a home and a car. The “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” (Lord of Ccoyllority Cachimayo) communal bank has been in operation for three and a half years and Luz Marina has been a member for three years and does well. The members of this communal bank are devoted to Taytacha Ccoyllority (Lord of the Shining Snow) and for this reason named their communal bank thus.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pre-paid cell phone cards.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is married with a 10-year-old son, Sergyi. She is a market vendor selling men’s footwear and clothing in her home town of Khoost. The merchandise Mariya offers for sale in her kiosk is of good quality and at an affordable price. Mariya has been in business for two years. Presently, her net profit amounts to 1,350 Grivnyas a month. 

Mariya is requesting a 6,500 Grivnya loan to increase the selection of assorted clothing and footwear she offers for sale in her kiosk. She can be characterized as a consistent client and borrower. Her good standing with other market vendors and customers add to her positive reputation as a prospective entrepreneur.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 46-year-old married man and father of 4 children whom 3 are still attending the school. After being laid off by his previous employer, he decided to open a small cafeteria in his town. He is satisfied with the decision to start his own business, because with its income, he is able to continue paying for his childrens' education. His cafeteria is known as a comfortable place by the clients who visit him to have a good time. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renew his business tools. 
In the coming years, he is planning to expand his cafeteria to attract more customers.

loans.use: to renew his business tools

loans.name: Dariimaa

texts.en:
Dariimaa G. is a 48-year-old single mother who lives with her two children in Darhan, a city in Mongolia. She and her two children live together in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her youngest daughter currently attends a local primary school. Her husband passed away six years ago. 

Dariimaa operates a vegetable trading business in a stall at the local market with the help of her son. She used to work as a technologist for the Floor Factory. She has been engaging in this trade for ten years and has gained significant experience. Her business earnings are the only source of her family's income. Dariimaa has been planning to expand her business in order to improve her family's quality of life. In the future she hopes to have her own field where she can plant and grow vegetables. She will use her future earnings to pay her daughter's tuition fees and to buy a new house for her son. She is a hardworking and very energetic person who dedicates her life to her children. She says, 'My dream is to raise my children to be well-educated people, so that they can live a decent life. My children will help to expand my business in the future.' She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of vegetables at wholesale price in order to sell them during the forthcoming winter.

loans.use: To purchase large amount of vegetables for resale

loans.name: Ma. Melanie

texts.en: Ma. Melanie E. is a 44-year old married woman who supports her family by operating 1 business venture: Farming business. She lives in Lower Calasa, Brgy. Caradio-an, Himamaylan, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her farming business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 7,500.  Ma. Melanie is now borrowing PHP 22,000 so that she  can fund the operations of her rice fields. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Ma. Melanie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.  About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund ricefield operations

loans.name: Song's Group

texts.en:
The four people pictured in the photograph are low-income people who are jointly requesting a loan. They are all living in Siem Reap Province. One of these people, Mrs. Song S., age 27, has been selected by the other group members to be the leader. Song S. currently owns a small shop. She sells some plates to the wholesaler and also sells in the market. She typically makes around $3 of profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable life. She has been married for many years to Savuth, 33, a ferryboat operator, and they have two children. Mrs. Song S. wants to add more capital to expand her business, but her account does not contain enough money to make it possible. That is why Mrs. Song S. would like to request a loan to purchase more plates to sell.   

There are three other members in this group who have requested loans. They are using the loans for the following activities:
Mrs. K. is applying for a loan to buy grocery items to sell.
Mrs. C. is asking for a loan to repair her broken motorbike.
Mrs. S. is applying for a loan to repair her broken boat.

loans.use: To purchase more plates to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph, age 36, offers printing, photocopying, typing, and binding services. He and his wife have two children, both of whom attend school. Joseph has requested a loan of Kes. 30,000 in order to buy stationery and a printer. Joseph also earns extra income from employment. He describes himself as open-minded and aggressive in his business, and he hopes to have the best printshop possible with the fastest machines in town. In five years' time, Joseph plans to be a stationery supplier.

loans.use: To buy stationery and a printer for his business

loans.name: Maria Venus

texts.en:
Maria Venus C. is from the town of Talibon. She is 37 years old. Maria Venus is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Maria Venus operates a family member's business making "suman" (glutinous rice dessert) to sell. 

Maria Venus joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Venus is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Maria Venus from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Yngrid Fiorella

texts.es:
Yngrid es una madre de familia de 21 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el caserío La Coruña del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona ubicada en la región Piura y ubicada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir para niños, ella cuenta con un stock fijo el cual comercializa entre sus clientes por pedidos. Trabaja tanto al contado como al crédito. Adicionalmente vende cerveza en so domicilio los fines de semana. Estas actividades le permiten sentirse activa y ayudar a su esposo a solventar la economía de su familia.

Yngrid desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes durante la temporada navideña, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Yngrid is a 21 year-old mother who lives with her husband and son in the village of La Coruña, in the agricultural district of Tambogrande which is located in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Yngrid sells children's clothes.  She has a fixed stock which she sells to her customers through an order system.  She sells her products both for cash and on credit.  She also sells beer in her home on weekends.  These business activities allow her to feel active and help her husband with their family's finances.

Yngrid would like to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise so she can satisfy her customer demand during the Christmas season.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa that will allow her to achieve her goal.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing more merchandise

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alejandrina; ella tiene 49 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de lavado de carros, ella lava diferentes tipos de carros, ella trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de lavado de carros. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para lavar los carros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the José Carlos Mariategui community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Alejandrina is 49 years old, married and has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business washing cars.  She washes different kinds of cars and works from 6.00am to 7.00pm.  Through this small business, she manages to get her children ahead.

Alejandrina would like to expand her car washing business.  She is requesting a loan to buy materials for washing cars.  She is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy materials for washing cars

loans.name: Risa Ole

texts.en:
Risa has practiced livestock farming in Naivasha town for the last five years.  When not herding, he is at the market center selling maasai traditional clothes.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan which he plans to buy 20 sheeps which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

In future, Risa hopes to be a large supplier of animal products in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy 20 sheep which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Ruth Mercedes

texts.es: Ruth tiene 36 años, Su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general, hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo menores de edad, Ruth ha demostrado ser una persona muy trabajadora. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza un financiamiento pues son de mucha ayuda para sacar adelante su negocio y así proporcionarles a sus clientes lo que ellos le solicitan. El crédito que solicito es para la compra de calzado, ropa en general, cosméticos y otros productos.
texts.en:
Ruth is 36 years old and has been selling general merchandise for more than six years. She has three young children. Ruth has proven that she is a hard worker. This is not the first time she has received funding since it has been a great help in moving her business forward and providing her customers with what they request.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy shoes, general clothing, cosmetics, and other products.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy merchandise

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LA ÑUSTA III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Raúl; el tiene 45 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de productos secos como  maíz para luego revenderlo a sus clientes que tiene en el mismo Calca a veces el socio viaja por todo el valle sagrado ofreciendo sus productos pero tiene más clientes en Calca, el socio a la vez trabaja como maestro de construcción en las diferentes obras que se realizan y  requieren sus servicios de esta forma el socio saca  a su familia adelante siendo estas sus dos únicas actividades que realiza por el momento. 

El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar más productos secos para su negocio.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Sr. Raúl belongs to the Communal Bank “La Ñusta III”, which is located in the District and Province of Calca, Department of Cusco.

He is 45 years old, in a common law marriage, and has four children. Raúl divides his time between his daily activities and his business of buying dry goods such as corn for later resale to his customers in Calca. He travels all over the Sacred Valley to offer his products, but most of his customers are in Calca. Raúl also works as a master builder on different construction jobs that need to be completed and require his services. He engages in these two business activities at the moment so that his family can get ahead. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy more dried products for his business.

Raúl is happy with the loan and promises to complete all of his payments.

loans.use: Purchase dried goods

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en:
Bolormaa, 47, is married and lives with her husband and two children in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. They have a decent standard of living. Her husband is an experienced artist who started a painting and art business in 1990. He is popular in his area for his art work. Their older daughter works as a designer and their younger daughter attends college.

Bolormaa began manufacturing and selling handcrafted souvenirs in 1991. She started her business with a working capital of 300,000 MNT and now it exceeds 3,800,000 MNT. Her business operations have become more stable compared to previous years. Bolormaa is planning to introduce and export her products to external markets. She is a hardworking and polite person who says, " Never give up. Try hard and you will definitely achieve something at the end." Bolormaa is requesting a loan of 1,800,000 MNT to purchase materials for her handcraft and souvenir production business.

loans.use: to purchase materials

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 35 years old and has three children, ages 16, 9, and 7. She is a member of the communal bank "Totorilla" and has been with FINCA Peru on and off for many years where she has felt extremely supported. She has learned a lot about saving money and how to wisely invest money. 

Miriam and her partner run a small outdoor event center where they sell typical Peruvian dishes, such as guinea pig, chicharron (pork slowly cooked in pork fat) and puca picante (potatoes covered in a spicy beet-peanut sauce). She is asking for a loan of 3,000 PEN to purchase more tables, chairs, pots and silverware for this business. 

Miriam also has a seafood restaurant, La Caleta de Pescador, that she runs with her partner.

loans.use: Purchase of tables, chairs, pots, silverware for event center

loans.name: Together As One Iii Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Together As One III” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each of them. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

John N. is the leader of this group. The 38 year old is married to a housewife and they have 6 children. John has been a businessman for 17 years now; he sells bicycle spare-parts such as chains, tires, inner-tubes, hubs, etc. With his share of this loan, he will buy the above mentioned items in large quantity to add to his current ones.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, such as chains, tires, inner-tubes, hubs, etc., in large quantity

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy wheat and rice for selling

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of twelve members led by Mrs Chea, a married woman born in 1971 who was selected to be the village bank president by the others members.

Chea and her husband are seamstresses in the garment factories, able to earn some money to help support their family. Chea is now requesting a loan to fix up their house. This couple has a child who stays at home.

loans.use: to fix up her house.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La señora Ana Mercedes S. es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 51 años quien hace seis años inicio una pequeña venta la cual ha ido creciendo poco a poco.
El crédito que está solicitando es crédito, mujer tengo derecho este prestamos se otorga a las mejores clientas para uso personal como examen médicos, compra de lentes etc. 
S. con desea realizarse un cambio de looks para el día de las madres.
texts.en:
Ana Mercedes S. is a hardworking and enterprising 51-year old woman who started her small store 6 years ago, one which she has developed incrementally.

She requests a loan. It is granted to the best clients for their personal use, including medical exams, prescription eye-glasses, etc.

Mrs. S. wants to update her look for mother's day.

loans.use: to have a make-over.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a married woman with three children, two boys and a girl, all of whom attend school. They live in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Monica's greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
Monica has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household food goods such as rice, beans, sugar, wheat flour and maize flour. Her potential customers are neighbors and passers-by. Her main business challenge is theft and seasonality. Monica dreams of becoming self-reliant in the future.
With her loan of 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase sacks of beans, rice and maize flour. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, because of favorable loan procedures and its good reputation.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, rice and maize flour.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy flower seeds and manure.

loans.name: El Progreso Del Vallecito Group

texts.es:
“El Progreso del Vallecito “es una Nueva Alcancía Comunal que está conformada por 07 mujeres animadas con el Programa Prosperidad.
Esther fue elegida presidenta gracias a sus compañeras que depositaron su confianza en ella. La Sra.: Esther tiene 35 años de edad  es conviviente con 2 hijos que dependen de ella y de conyugue, ella nos manifiesta que   se dedica a la venta de comida en un mercado de su comunidad donde lleva 6 meses laborando, su negocio comenzó con la idea de mejorar sus ingresos en beneficio de su familia, también cuenta con  una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio. Esther es una mujer trabajadora que gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido educar a sus 02  hijos y de lograr tener el servicio de luz propia en su domicilio  ya que en su zona no cuentan con ese servicio. El deseo de Esther es construir su casa y de contar con los servicios básicos como es el agua y desagüe. Con el préstamo que solito ella piensa surtir su pequeña bodega con productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, etc.  La Alcancía Comunal “El Progreso del Vallecito” están  agradecidas por la  confianza puesta en ellas y en sus negocios y están comprometidos a trabajar bien con el programa Prosperidad. En la foto vemos  a las señoras el día del desembolso felices en su comunidad acompañadas de sus hijos disfrutando de un pequeño compartir.
texts.en:
“El Progreso del Vallecito“ is a new community bank that has seven members who are all enthusiastic about the 'Prosperidad' (Prosperity) program.  Esther was elected president as her fellow bank members put their trust in her.

Esther is 35 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children who are dependent on her and her partner.  She tells us that she sells food in a market in her community.  She has been doing this for six months.  She started her business with the idea of improving her income for the benefit of her family.  Esther also has a small grocery store in her home.  She is a hard-working woman who, thanks to her efforts, has been able to educate her two children and has managed to install her own electricity service in her home as her region doesn't have this service.  Esther's wish is to build her home and have basic services such as water and sewerage.  She is planning to use the loan that she has requested to stock her small grocery store with essential household products such as rice, sugar, milk, noodles etc.  The members of the 'El Progreso del Vallecito' community bank are grateful for the trust that has been placed in them and in their businesses and they pledge to work well within the 'Prosperidad' program.

In the photo we can see the ladies on the day they received their loans, happy in their community and, accompanied by their children, enjoying a little get together.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and noodles

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is married and has two children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Abena went to a vocational school. She has been a hairdresser at Abura for four years. She assists her husband to provide the basic needs of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more hair creams, lotions, etc. to use on her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy an additional hairdryer.

loans.use: to buy more hair creams, lotions, etc. to use on her customers.

loans.name: Oscar Jaime

texts.es:
Oscar en un diciembre viaja a Medellín a visitar a su hermana y ella le pide que le ayude en su negocio que queda en centro como vendedor, para el fue una excelente experiencia y decide quedarse en Medellín y montar su propio negocio.

El desde hace 8 años el tiene un puesto de venta de cacharro que le permite sostener a su hijo y darle todo lo que necesita para su estudio y sus necesidades personales.

El quiere tener un mayor surtido para su negocios para que se pueda ver mas bonito y además así le puede ofrecer mas variedad de productos para sus clientes.
texts.en:
One December, Oscar traveled to Medellín to visit his sister.  She asked him to help her with her business, located in the center of town, as a merchant.  For him, it was an excellent experience and he decided to stay in Medellín to start his own business.

For 8 years, he has had a stand selling gadgets that has allowed him to support his son and provide him with everything he requires for his education and personal needs.

He wants to have a larger supply for his business, so it will look nicer and also allow him to offer a greater variety of products to his customers.

loans.use: purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Pon

texts.en: It is a big responsibility of parents to be the head of the family. Mrs. Pon never takes time to visit or talk free with someone else. She always takes care of the living standards of her family. Nowadays she is a farmer. When she takes time from this business, Mrs.Pon sells cakes around her village. She earns about $2 per day. Talking to her husband, he is an excellent person who always take care of her and all their children. Mrs. Pon wishes to loan perhaps $250 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers and a pumping machine.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and a pumping machine.

loans.name: Socoro

texts.en:
Socoro is 49 years old, married, and has six children. She works hard to provide for her family. Socoro runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Socoro has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 13 years. Socoro hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Nicasio Edgar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR PASION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Nicasio Edgar; el tiene 49 años de edad y es casado y tiene 4 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como docente del nivel secundario y también se dedica al negocio de librería y negocio de agricultura, el socio tiene terrenos de cultivo donde siembra maíz y luego lo vende al por mayor en las diferentes ferias que existe en la provincia de Urubamba y el negocio de librería lo realiza su esposa y así juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de librería y negocio de agricultura. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas como para sembrar maíz y también comprar mercadería como lápices, cuadernos, lapiceros y tarjadores al por mayor. 
                                            
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sr. Nicasio Edgar is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor Pasion” which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

He is 49 years old, married, and has four children. Nicasio divides his time between his daily activities and his job as a high school teacher. In addition, he owns a bookstore and engages in farming. Nicasio has farmland on which he grows corn that he later sells in bulk at different fairs throughout Urubamba Province. His wife manages the bookstore and together they strive to succeed on behalf of their children. Nicasio wants to expand and improve his bookstore, as well as his farming business. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds for planting corn and also merchandise such as pencils, notebooks, pens, and bookmarks in bulk.

Nicasio Edgar is happy with the loan and promised to complete his payments.

loans.use: to buy pencils, notebooks, pens, and bookmarks in bulk, as well as seeds for planting corn.

loans.name: Blanca Ines

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 52 años vive con su esposo y su hijo que tiene 18 años, viven en Ibarra; Blanca se comnsidera como una persona honrada, trabajadora y emprendedora.

Trabaja sola tejiendo sacos para la venta, es el segundo crédito que solicita a Fodemi el mismo que lo utilizará para la comnpra de lana para tejer los sacos, lo cuál le ayudaría para incrementar su producción y de la misma manera incrementar sus ingresos.

Su sueño es que su negocio crezca economicamente.
texts.en:
Blanca is 52 years old.  She lives with her husband and her 18 year-old son in Ibarra.  Blanca considers to herself to be an honest, hardworking, and enterprising person.

She works alone sewing bags to sell.  This is the second loan she is asking for from FODEMI.  She will use it to buy wool to sew her bags, which will help her increase her production and, thus, increase her income.

Her dream is to have her business grow economically.

loans.use: to buy wool to sew bags

loans.name: But

texts.en: Mrs. But is a young mother of two children. She is an honest and goal-oriented woman. She supports her children on her own and has a hard time satisfying all of the needs of her children, and always needs support. She decided to deal with these difficulties by getting involved in selling soft drinks, hard drinks, food products and grocery goods. To upgrade her living, Mrs. But wishes to apply for a loan from HKL and Kiva. She will use this loan to purchase more goods to sell. She thanks everyone in advance for the support her business. The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Jallety

texts.en:
Jallety is 51 years old, married, and a mother of two children.  She owns a rental house in Kilifi. Jallety has been in this business for the past 15 years and it’s been a success. 

She has been a KADET client and this marks her fourth borrowing to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to renovate one unit of the rental house. 

The anticipated profits will be invested back into her business and used to repay the loan. Her dream is to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to renovate one unit of her rental house

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN RUMIYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.
