Aurelia; ella tiene 62 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo D. periodismo, ella trabaja en forma independiente, la socia también es cesante D. educación, por medio D. estos trabajos la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere refaccionar y arreglar su casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales D. construcción como cemento y ladrillos.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Aurelia, 62, belongs to the “Hatunrumiyoc” communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  She’s married and has two children.


She alternates her daily chores with journalism; she works independently.  She’s also a retired teacher.  Through these jobs she’s able to support her children.  She’d like to do some home improvements and is asking for a loan to buy building materials and supplies like cement and bricks.  She is happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement and bricks.

loans.name: Alexandre

texts.en: Alexandre is 33-years-old with 2 children ages 1 and 8. The oldest child is currently in school. His wife works with him in his business of selling wood and wood handicrafts. He has been running this business for 2 years and would like the loan to buy more wood. He will use the profits to renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy more woods for sale.

loans.name: Golden Girls Group

texts.en: This is 40-year-old Silibaziso from Harare. She is single and has one child who attends school. Silibaziso runs an agriculture business selling chickens. The business has been in operation for one year. She says the main challenge she faces is insufficient capital to run her business. Silibaziso has requested a loan of $300 to buy chicks and stock feeds. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living. In the future, Silibaziso plans to open a takeaway business.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Ma. Glenda

texts.en:
Ma. Glenda is 39 years old, married with four children. Her oldest child is age 20.  Ma. Glenda's husband is a fisherman.

Ma. Glenda is engaged in fishing and seaweed farming.  She helps to sell their catch at the market.  She works hard to support her family. 

She requested a loan to purchase seaweed seedlings, fishing nets and to pay school fees. 

Ma. Glenda hopes to improve her family's living conditions and sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings, fishing nets and to pay school fees.

loans.name: Luaao

texts.en:
Luaao is a married mother, she is 66 years old, and has 12 children.

Luaao owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has three years of experience in this business. Luaao needs a loan of WST $1900.00 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2009, Luaao joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Luaao's third loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Oscar Andrés

texts.es:
El Sr. Oscar es un persona emprendedora quien tiene su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado, es casado y con una hija en edad escolar.
El ha trabajado ocho prestamos, el acude nuevamente a las oficinas de ceprodel para la compra de mercadería para su negocio. 
A gradece a ceprodel por los prestamos brindados ya que ahora su negocio cuenta con mayor inventario para competir con la competencia.
texts.en:
Señor Oscar is hardworking person. He has a business selling fruit and vegetables in the marketplace. He’s married with a school-aged daughter. 

He has repaid eight loans. He came to the CEPRODEL offices in order to purchase merchandise for his business. 

He appreciates CEPRODEL for the loans they have provided him because now his business has a larger inventory which helps it deal with the competition.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: German

texts.es:
Germán de 36 años de edad, esta casado con Ofelia de 34 años, fruto de esta unión tienen a 4 hijos con los que viven feliz en su casa propia ubicado en el centro poblado de Chuvivana del distrito ecológico de Sivia. German, es un agricultor dedicado a sus cultivos  de café. Él cuenta que se inicio en esta labor, por no contar con suficiente economía para los estudios, vio que sus padres ya no podían invertir més en él, pues los ingresos de sus padres eran tan precarias y además tenia 4 hermanos menores a quienes asistir. Pero él no se quedo con las manos cruzadas, así que decidio trabajar por su cuenta, pasado el año reciénn vio los frutos de su cultivo. Generalmente el trabajo lo realiza juntamente con su adorada esposa, a pesar de ello siempre requiere de personal quienes le puedan facilitar el cultivo de sus productos, mas que nada en las temporadas de cosecha.
German está feliz junto a su familia porque gracias al apoyo de MFP, sus cultivos se mantienen adecuadamente. Este será su segundo credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete una vez más en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. German está contento con el trabajo de su banco comunal porque lo realiza de manera transparente.
Con los 2,500 nuevos soles contratará peones para que le ayuden a limpiar y fertilizar su cultivo de café.
texts.en:
Germán, age 36, is married to Ofelia, age 34. They have four children and live together happily in their own home in the populated center of Chuvivana, in the ecological Sivia district. German is a coffee farmer. He tells us that he started this work because he did not have enough money for his studies. He say that his parents could not invest any more money in him, because his father's income was so unstable and there were four younger siblings in the family to support. German did not let this stop him. He decided to go to work and has seen the fruit of his labour. He normally works with his beloved wife, but they still need to hire labourers, especially for the harvest.
German and his family are happy because, thanks to MFP's support, their crops are consistently in good condition. This will be his second loan with MFP, and he once again promises to repay his quotas punctually. German is happy with the transparency of his communal bank.
With these 2,500 nuevos soles, he will hire labourers to help him to clear and fertilize his land.

loans.use: to hire labourers.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Mrs. Suon, 66, a mother of three children, generates her income by cultivating rice crops from Baray district. She typically earns an average of $2.50 per day and tries to support her family. Her husband also assists her in farming. These days Suon is very busy with her work in the field, which includes harvesting and threshing her rice. Her rice fields are a bit far away from home, so it is difficult to transport her finished rice home without a trailer. Thus, Suon would like to ask for her first loan to purchase a trailer to better the way she is working. She hopes that our lenders will support her family towards and success in her career.

loans.use: to purchase a trailer.

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es: José Francisco de cincuenta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida su hijo y su madre, él se dedica a la venta de sorbete artesanal, tiene varios años de trabajar en el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia valiosa que le permite elaborar el mejor sorbete de la zona, comercia en los alrededores de un centro deportivo muy concentrado de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que vende es de calidad, a buen precio pero sobre todo con el mejor servicio siempre es muy amable con los clientes; José Francisco es un hombre visionario con muchas ganas de salir adelante y cumplir todas sus metas, sabe que con su esfuerzo, dedicación y constancia logrará el éxito, cada día aumenta más su clientela y no quiere decepcionarlos por eso aumentara la producción pero necesita de capital para invertir en materia prima por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar tamarindo, coco, azúcar, conos, etc. José Francisco tiene buen record crediticio y capacidad de pago tiene la certeza que podrá cancelar el financiamiento en el periodo establecido y a la vez llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.

loans.use: tamarindo, coco, azúcar, conos

loans.name: Priska

texts.en: Prisca is a 23-year-old entrepreneur living in Iringa District, Tanzania. Prisca is a Camfed Learner Guide who volunteers to teach life skills to secondary students. She is requesting a Kiva loan to start a grocery business where she will sell cooking oil, sugar, kerosene, salt and flour. She will use her profits from the loan to expand her business and pay for household expenses.

loans.use: to start a grocery business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 48 years old. She is married with 2 children, aged 24 and 27 years. They are both married. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past 2 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more goats for reselling. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more goats for reselling.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Six years ago, Maria Elena decided to use the first room of her house for a business and installed shelves. She used her savings and a lot of effort to invest in merchandise to open a general store. She made this decision because she is married and has 9 children. Her husband works as a worker and his salary is not enough to cover their family expenses.

Maria Elena feels that all of her efforts in her business have helped her to find her business vocation and personal realization. All her families work in the store helping her in different types of labors and all of them have benefited the business.

Maria Elena is requesting a loan of US$ 925 to purchase merchandise because she is sure that if there was more merchandise that her clients could see, they would buy more.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Hace 6 años María Elena, decidió utilizar la primera habitación de su casa, para acondicionarla con estantería y con sus ahorros y un gran esfuerzo invirtió en mercancías para poner una tienda de abarrotes. Tomo esta decisión pues esta casada y tiene 9 hijos su esposo se desempeña como obrero y su sueldo no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos familiares. Siente que a través de su trabajo y tenacidad ha encontrado su vocación comercial y su realización personal. Toda su familia participa, en la tienda la apoyan en la atención a clientes, acomodo de mercancías, surtido de pedidos, pues les comenta que todos obtienen beneficios con el negocio. Esta interesada en obtener un préstamo por la cantidad de $925 a 6 meses pues asegura que mientras más mercancía ven los clientes, más compran.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more household goods for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Abdugafur

texts.en: A. Abdugafur is a teacher with a lot of experience in his profession. He worked at a university for over 20 years. He is a very talented and clever man. He has a big family: his wife, 6 children, and 11 grandchildren. Today, Abdugafur has his own business. He has a wide assortment of books such as science, mystery, romance, educational books and dictionaries. He bought books from suppliers in Russia, Chehoslavakiya, and Kirgizistan. He has constant clients, and often they order books from Abdugafur and he is always ready meet their needs. Abdugafur loves his business and is satisfied doing it. In the future he would like to buy a new assortment of books from Russia and that’s why he is requesting $700.

loans.use: Purchase of books

loans.name: Drame

texts.en: Dramé M. is a dynamic 40 year old tradesman. He lives in Port-Bouët, a very populated suburb in the south of Abidjan District. M. owns a well managed store and sells fresh milk, sweets, candies, juices, soaps, sugar, etc. M. is married and has 4 children. He wants to expand his activities and diversify his product range by selling rice. He will use the loan to purchase goods in bulk from the largest wholesaler in order to get lower prices and improve his profit margin. He joined the AE&I Microcredit Program in 2005 when he heard about the organisation from one of his friends. M. has performed very well since then and is honest and well organized.

loans.use: Dramé Mamadou will use the loan to expand his product range

loans.name: Ni Made Tinggalasih

texts.id:
As a wife of a specialty worker. forced Ni Made Tinggalasih to help her husband to increase family income. Husband's income is not certain, made her work harder in her pig raising business. The profit from pig farming has added the family income. Besides selling pig feedstock, pig waste is also used as organic fertilizer, so that all plants in her field could grow and produce as she had hoped. The high cost of pig feed is difficult for Ms. Made to raise her animals. Seasonal Field's results, and uncertain husband's income, made her apply for funds and training from Dinari. The expected funds would be used for pig's feed and prepare for 2 mother pigs. Profit from 1 mother pig could reach Rp2,000,000 (about US$220)/6 months. With such profits, Ms. Made likes to increase her pig's population by another mother pig, so that it could add to family's income. Profit from pig farming is used to pay for daily expenses, and children's food expenses for their future.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Sebagai istri dari suami yang berprofesi sebagai seorang tukang, mengharuskan Ni Made Tinggalasih untuk dapat membantu suami dalam menambah pendapatan keluarga. Penghasilan suami yang tidak menentu, membuat ia harus lebih tekun dalam mengelola ternak babi yang ia miliki. Keuntungan yang didapat dari beternak babi dirasakan dapat menambah pendapatan keluarga. Selain dari menjual bibit babi, limbah berupa kotoran ternak dimanfaatkan sebagai pupuk organik sehingga semua tanaman yang ada di kebunnya bisa tumbuh dan berproduksi sesuai degan harapannya. Tingginya harga pakan membuat Made kesulitan dalam memelihara ternaknya. Hasil kebun yang musiman dan pendapatan suami yang tidak menentu membuat ia mengajukan permohonan dana dan pelatihan kepada DINARI. Dana yang diperoleh akan dimanfaatkan untuk biaya pakan sekaligus mempersiapkan 2 ekor induk. Keuntungan usaha yang ia peroleh dari 1 ekor induk bisa mencapai Rp. 2.000.000.- / 6 bulan. Dengan keuntungan itu membuat Made ingin menambah populasi ternak babinya berupa 1 ekor induk lagi , sehingga nantinya dapat mampu menambah pendapatan keluarga. Keuntungan usaha ternak babi Made manfaatkan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidup sehari-hari dan biaya sekolah anaknya demi masa depan.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock and feed

Membeli pakan dan bibit babi

loans.name: Proeung

texts.en: Mrs. Proeung N., 52, is a market-vendor selling scallop and octopus, earning around $7.3/day in revenue. She is married and has six children. Her husband helps her sell at the market every morning and one of her children is self-employed as a motor-taxi driver, earning $2.40/day in revenue; a number of her other children are married and some are unemployed. Mrs. Proeung N. hopes to use this loan to expand her inventory and the remainder of the loan is to buy a motorcycle to assist in the transportation of her products.

loans.use: To expand her inventory of seafood to sell as well as to purchase a motorcycle to transport her products

loans.name: Folly

texts.fr: Né en 1989 à Lomé, Monsieur A. Folly est élève et fait l’élevage et la vente du porc pour se supporter dans ses études. Il a commencé cette activité depuis bientôt 5 ans mais faute de moyens il n’arrive pas à bien développer son élevage et n’en profite pas assez. Il sollicite un financement de $1000 qui lui servira à acquérir d’autres races de porcs sur les marchés intérieurs. Ceci va lui permettre d’avancer dans ses études et subvenir à ses besoins.

loans.use: Achat de nouvelles races de porcs

loans.name: Mutundwe 2B(Ii) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Dorothy is 49 years old, married and has 12 children. Her husband has a business selling clothing. Dorothy has a retail shop. She wants to use the extra business profits to cater to her family's needs and improve their standard of living.

Eva sells charcoal and wants to use the loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal.

Harriet makes and sells snacks.

Teo wants to buy more sewing machines to expand her tailoring business.

Sylvia sells used clothing and wants to use the loan to increase her stock.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: to invest in their businesses

loans.name: Nueva Santa Catarina Group

texts.en:
In a modest room lit only by the sun, a woman sweeps the dirt floor and sets out multi-colored plastic chairs in preparation for the ‘desembolsa’, the meeting for the community bank Nueva Santa Catarina where its 11 members will have their requested loans approved. The women gather excitedly, talking rapidly in their native language K´iche´, while their children play in the folds of their dresses, giggling timidly. These women are strong and have endured much, yet more than exhaustion they emit hope and joy. As a community bank, they are proud to have been together eight years, their bank was the first of the now four banks in their small community.

Located about an hour and a half from the region’s capital, Sololá, the 11 women dedicate themselves to the beautiful and intricate art of weaving huipiles, native Mayan blouses. A single huipil can take up to one month to make, and after an investment of about 200 Quetzales (about $25), they can sell it for about 500 Quetzales (about $60). Currently, the women sell their huipiles in the nearby town of Nahuala, and they are well known in their community so customers also come directly to their home to make purchases.

Of the 11 women, almost half can read and write, which is a very large percentage for the area. They are smart in business, and are looking for new ways to expand. They’ve recognized the large number of sales that tourism brings in, and are hoping to implement an export business or connect with a nearby community where tourism is more prevalent than in their town and open a market there. As a group they are asking for a loan of 33,500 Quetzales, about $4400, $400 per person, which they will invest in various colored threads to weave their huipiles. A few of the women are also planning on using part of their loan to hire extra help so they can increase the rate of production and make more sales.

loans.use: To purchase thread for weaving and hire extra help

loans.name: Salelologa Foua Centre - Group 1

texts.en:
After four weeks of rigorous business training, these eight women of Salelologa Foua on the island of Savaii passed their written tests on the SPBD principles (business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee) to ensure their first group loan from SPBD. Over the next year, they will support each other in their individual business development to guarantee on-time payments.

The loans will be used for the following purposes:

Iuliana L., 44, married, with five children will buy Elei clothing (traditional Samoan fabric printing): materials, paints, x-ray papers, elei board and brushes.

Juliana S., 29, married, with one child will buy fishing equipment: fishing net, spear, torch, goggles and fishing bait.

Miliama L., 43, married, with three children, will buy fishing and sewing materials: a pair of fishing boots, a spear, goggles, a torch and a sewing machine.

Sapi U., 37, married, with three children, will buy ingredient to bake and sell pancakes: flour, soda powder, fryer, oil, fork and an oven.

The following women are involved in plantations (taro, tuamu, bananas, etc) and request a loan to purchase the below items:

Pea T., 50, married, with 10 children will buy weed killing sprayer, pesticides and 2 shovels.

Lagi E., 68, married, with six children will buy weed killing sprayer, pesticides, a shovel, 2 bush knives, 2 knife filings, and 2 bags of fertilizer.

Pai Luamanu V., 43, married, with four children will buy weed killing sprayer, pesticides, 2 knives, 2 knife filings, 2 bags of fertilizer and additional chemicals.

Faleupolu P., 42, married, with five children will buy weed killing sprayer, pesticides, a shovel, 2 bush knives, a knife filing, and a wheel barrow.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and materials for various businesses

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Ms Guadalupe R. has worked for more than 20 years as a stock farmer in the municipality of Condega in the city of Estelí. She is a married mother of two school-aged children. Both children have been recognized as very good students and because of this Ms Guadalupe is very proud of them.

Her crops and livestock demand great attention. This demand has reversed her economic situation, and thus she seeks a loan from Ceprodel to obtain credit that will allow her to acquire products to assist her with her crops, like fertilizers and other products that will improve her harvest yield. Also, it is important to purchase livestock, like calves, in order to maintain her raising of these animals.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

La dama Guadalupe R. se dedica desde hace veinte largos años al negocio agropecuario en el municipio de Condega en la ciudad de Estelí. Es madre casada y con dos hijos en edad escolara el cual se han destacado por ser muy buenos estudiantes y por ello la señora Guadalupe se siente muy orgullosa de ellos.

El negocio requiere de mucha asistencia en los cultivos y en el ganado, esto requiere por su puesto inversión económica en el negocio, para ello muy sabiamente busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito que le permita la adquisición de los productos para la asistencia de los cultivos como fertilizantes y otros que cuiden del buen desarrollo de la cosecha. Además le es de necesidad la compra de ganado como lo son los terneros para llevar a cabo su crianza y así lograr mantener su familia en perfectas condiciones.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and livestock

loans.name: Pendo

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 29 year-old Pendo M.. She is married, and has three children ages 2, 7, and 9. In 2000, Pendo established her seamstress business. Pendo requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock of traditional African cloth in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of traditional African cloth in bulk.

loans.name: Tereko

texts.fr:
Ms. Tereko D. is 43 years old, the mother of five children (3 boys and 2 girls), and lives in a polygamous family with her husband, her co-spouse, and their children, in Médine, one of the districts of the city of Sikasso. She is specialized in making and selling an edible local powder called 'djafarana'. This red powder is used to make sauces and is made of millet, the seed of the djafarana plant, and shea nut butter. The seeds of millet and djafarana are pounded, made into powder, and mixed with shea nut butter to produce the said powder itself. She learned this business about 15 years ago with a citizen of the Cote d'Ivoire.

She is on her first loan with Soro Yiriwaso. She gets her supply of djafarana and millet seeds and shea butter in the towns near Sikasso. With this loan, she intends to buy five sacks of millet, five sacks of djafarana, and six packages of shea butter. Very experienced in making and selling djafarana, Ms. Tereko is recognized and appreciated in the city of Sikasso. Her business turnover is very high, and she realizes a monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA with 75,000 francs CFA of capital. With this loan, she envisions realizing a profit of 35,000 francs CFA each month.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Tereko D. est agée de 43 ans, mère de 5 enfants (3 garçons et 2 filles) et vit dans une famille polygamme avec son époux, sa coépouse et leurs enfants à Médine, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso. Elle est spécialisée dans la fabrique et la vente d’une poudre alimentaire locale appelée “Djafarana”. Cette poudre de couleur rouge est utilisée dans la préparation des sauces alimentaires. Elle est faite à base de mil, de la graine de la plante de “Djafarana” et du beure de karité. Les graines de mil et de “Djafarana” sont pilées, transformées en pouydre, mélanger avec le beurre de karité pour donner par la suite la poudre proprement dite. Elle a appris cette activité il y a environ 15 ans avec une ressortissante de la Cote d’Ivoire.

Elle est à son premier pret avec Soro Yiriwaso. Elle s’approvisionne en graines de “Djafarana” de mil et de beure de karité dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso. Avec ce pret, elle compte acheter 5 sacs de mil, 5 sacs de “Djafarana” et 6 colis de beurre de karité. Très expérimenté dans la fabrique et vente de “Djafarana”, Madame Tereko est reconnue et appréciée dans la ville de Sikasso. La rotation de son activité est très élévée et elle réalise un bénéfice mensuel de 25 000 FCFA avec un fonds propre de 75 000 FCFA. Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice de 35 000 FCFA par mois.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Laiifa

texts.en:
Laiifa owns her own shop in Zanzibar. She hopes to expand her business to increase her profit. This is her second loan for her business through BRAC Tanzania. The first one was paid off successfully and helped her as she grew her business.

Laiifa is 25 years old. She is married and has two children ages 7 and 6.

loans.use: To buy more goods to expand her business.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Señor Francisco T., cuenta con 35 años de edad, tiene dos hijos. Desde muy temprana edad el Señor Francisco se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, ya que siendo muy joven empezó a trabajar en una panadería, donde aprendió uno de sus oficios, lo cual lo ayudó bastante.

Viajó a la Argentina en el año 1992 en donde pudo conseguir un pequeño capital, para regresar a su país de origen y realizar la venta ambulante de masitas y facturas dulces que el mismo preparaba. Hoy día la venta de sus dulces es una de sus fuentes de ingreso, el prepara de madrugada sus facturas para que a tempranas horas de la mañana el pueda salir a venderlas por los barrios recorriendo con su bicicleta casa por casa todas las tardes y los domingos en los partidos de fútbol.

La otra actividad que realiza a la par es la jardinería. El realiza trabajos de jardinería a domicilio, esta actividad ha ido incrementándose y hoy ya le genera mayores ingresos que la de la panadería.

El crédito solicitado es para la compra de un cortacésped para su actividad de jardinería, que le está siendo falta para realizar de manera más eficiente este trabajo.

Gracias a su espíritu emprendedor ha podido adquirir un terreno en donde ya ha empezado el proyecto de construcción de su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco T. is 35 years old and has two children. From a young age Francisco has described himself as being hard-working and enterprising, as when he was young he began to work in a bakery, where he learned a trade that helped him quite a bit. He traveled to Argentina in 1992 where he was able to save a bit of money to return to his country and become a traveling vendor of pastries and sweet rolls that he himself made. Today the sales of his sweets is one of his sources of income, he prepares his rolls in the early morning hours and then he can leave and sell them in the neighborhood, traveling by bicycle house to house in the afternoons and on Sundays at soccer games. The other job he does is gardening. He gardens at private homes, an activity that has been growing and today this generates more income than his baked goods. The loan he is seeking is to buy a lawn mower for his gardening service, this is an item he needs in order to be more efficient with his work. Thanks to his enterprising spirit he has been able to acquire a plot of land where he has begun building his own home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a lawn mower

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Primer prestamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=33573&_tpos=9&_tpg=2

Ana Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño. Ana Maria es casada, tiene 28 años y 2 hijas, Ana Maria vende maderas en un local alquilado ubicado en el Jr. Rioja, este local es amplio y esta compartido por otras personas que tienen el mismo negocio, Ana Maria vende palos, carrizos, esteras, maderas variadas dependiendo de la demanda, todos sus productos los adquiere de los productores que le traen a su negocio, además que su esposo también viaja a comprar directamente las maderas. Ana Maria también alquila motosierras por hora para lo cual cuenta con un personal que realiza este servicio.

Ana Maria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tablones y palos. Los sueños de Ana Maria son tener una casa bonita, brindar una mejor educación a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y descansar en su vejez.
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=33573&_tpos=9&_tpg=2

Ana Maria is a member of the Banco Comunal Retoño community bank.

Ana Maria is married, is 28 year of age and has 2 daughters. Ana Maria sells wood from a rented store local situation in Jr. Rioja. Her store is of a good size but it is shared with other people that run a similar business. Ana Maria sells wooden staffs, bamboo sticks, mats, and various woods all depending on the demand. All of her products she acquires from her two producers that tend to her business. Additionally, her husband also travels to purchase the woods direct from producers. Ana Mari also rents out power saws by the hour, but she depends on her staff to run this service.

Ana Mari requires a loan amounting to 2000 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of planks of wood and wooden staffs. Ana Maria's dreams are to have a beautiful home and to provide her children with a better education so that they may grow into professionals. She also wishes to retire in her golden years.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ana Maria requires a loan of 2000 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of planks of wood and wooden staffs.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Srey C. is 32 years old and she lives in Roleapea, Kampong Chhnang Province.  She is married with three children, all of whom live at home and are in school. Her husband, Mr. Uch Chroch, is a construction worker, earning about $1.67 per day. Srey sells groceries in her area, earning approximately $10 per day. To expand her business, Srey needs a loan of $1,200 to purchase grocery inventory to sell, as well as purchasing rice to stock for resale when prices are high.  Srey and her husband are in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase grocery inventory and rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Ouy

texts.en: Ouy C., 44, is married and lives with her two children in the Kampong Cham province. She works in a grocery store, making around US$4 each day. Her husband is a taxi driver who makes about US$5 each day. Food prices have soared in the past year, as inflation has gotten out of control in Cambodia. Unfavorable climate conditions have also played a factor in making the price of rice very high. Ouy C. is asking for a loan of US$500 to add to her grocery’s inventory.

loans.use: To add her grocery’s inventory.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa M. is a 40-year-old entrepreneur. She is married and the mother of two children who are currently in school. She sells onions, tomatoes, and peppers, etc. on the top of a table in the local market of Babiani where she lives. She says that through this business, she has endeavored to support her two kids as they finish senior high school. She requests this loan to enable her to buy an increased stock of tomatoes, onions, peppers, etc. to grow her business and to scale up the business. She hopes to increase her savings to support the children’s education to give them a future and hope. Her picture was taken when she was going to the market.

Yaa is convinced that when the loan is given to her she will be better able to expand her business growth.

loans.use: to buy an increased stock of onions, tomatoes, and peppers, etc.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru: Шухрат парень 34 лет , женат имеет 3 детей нигде не работает . а занимается только откормом и продажей скота.Он с молодости занимается с отцом, поэтому хорошо разбирается в этом бизнесе.Его друзья посоветовали в кредит увеличит его оборот.На сегодняшний день у него 30 баранов и 20 коз.Он сам их пасёт на пастбищах,что и запечатлено на фотографии.
texts.en:
Shuhrat is 34 years old, married and has three children. His sole job is raising and selling livestock. From a young age he worked with his father, so he is very knowledgeable about this business. His friends advised him to take out a loan to increase his turnover. Today he has 30 sheep and 20 goats, and in the photograph, he is shown shepherding them to pasture.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle

loans.name: Olaide

texts.en:
Olaide operates a restaurant business and she also sells drinks; she learnt the business in 2 years. Olaide has been in her business for the past 20 years. For the past 4 years, her business has experienced a new turn because of the loans she has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance during this period.

Olaide is 44 years old and she has 5 children. Olaide is requesting the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook for sale. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana F. D. C., pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Unidas” D. la Comunidad D. Carancas, distrito D. Desaguadero, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno; D. 82 años D. edad, tiene 9 hijos, D. estado civil casada,  no posee estudios. 
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 08 años e inició su negocio D. engorD. D. ganado vacuno con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, que invirtió en la compra D. alimento balanceado y en la comercialización D. ganado en las ferias locales del distrito D. Desaguadero. 
Actualmente la señora Juana requiere un préstamo D. S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, para poder adquirir ganado vacuno, engordarlo y comercializarlo en las ferias, para poder ayudar a sus nietos, por quien ella vela eventualmente. Asimismo ella tiene el compromiso firme D. cumplir con sus pagos, y agradece a la institución por el apoyo brindado hasta la fecha.
texts.en:
Juana F. D. C. belongs to the “Mujeres Unidas” (“Women United”) cooperative bank, located in the Carancas community in Puno. She is 82 years old and married, has nine children, and no formal education. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for 8 years, having started her livestock raising business with the first loan she received of 300.00 Peruvian soles. She invested in the purchase of balanced feed for her animals, and in selling her livestock at the local markets of the Desaguadero district. Currently, Juana needs a loan of 2,000.00 soles to buy livestock to fatten and sell at the markets so she can help her grandchildren. Concurrently, she is firmly committed to make her payments and is grateful to the institution for the support it has provided to date.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy livestock to raise and then sell.

loans.name: Luy's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan group that is made up of four people, all residents of Siem Reap Province. Mrs. Luy T., 40, has been selected to be leader by the members. T. and her husband make a living selling fresh fish in the market. They normally earn an income of US$ 4 each day to feed the family. The couple has given birth to one young child who is enrolled in the local school.

T. now has many regular customers buying her fish, so her business is running very well with much income. To make the business more successful and to earn extra income, T. is looking for a loan in order to increase her capital, by buying more fish to sell.

The other three borrowers are:

S., 54, who sells fruit in the market and requests a loan to increase the quantity of fruit she has for sale;

Y., 44, a local fruit seller, who is asking for a loan to repair his old house; he was not available for photographing, so his wife is shown in the picture instead;

S., 26, who sells a little fruit out of her home and is applying for a loan to enlarge her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Las Aguilas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal las ÁGUILAS  es un grupo nuevo que se ha formado con socias que ya han trabajado en crecer y saben que es un banco comunal, D. manera que son personas con ganas D. trabajar y ayudar al crecimiento D. sus patrimonios en sus hogares. El crédito que han obtenido es para invertirlo en sus negocios y obtener mayores ventas y ganancias, los componentes del banco comunal se dedican a la venta D. comida, venta D. pan, y otros a la venta D. cosméticos.
texts.en:
Las Aguilas community bank is a new group that has formed with members that have worked, grown, and know what a community bank is. They are people with the desire to work and help towards the growth of their personal net worth. The loan is to invest in their businesses and increase sales and earnings. The members of the community bank sell food, bread and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Abdurashid

texts.en:
M. Abdurashid is 59 years old. Together with his wife, they have three children.

For 25 years Abdurashid has been selling flowers. His trading place is located in the central market of the city and he works from the early morning till late at night. Once every two weeks, he travels to Uzbekistan, the neighboring country, to purchase flowers.

During the years of his career, Abdurashid became an expert in his business, knowing even how to save the flowers during a severe winter. The business is successful, generating a stable income for the family.

Today Abdurashid requests $1400. The loan will be spent on purchasing flowers to sell. Abdurashid thanks all for supporting him and promises to be precise in loan repayment. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit:  www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy various sorts of flowers to sell

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle C. is from the town of Katipunan. She is 35 years old, married, and has three school-aged children.

Annabelle operates a fishing business, primarily harvesting and selling wild-caught fish in the local community. Annabelle has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Annabelle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Annabelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell.

Annabelle is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her 7th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Cette jeune femme est célibataire, elle travaille dure pour subvenir à ses propres charges pour cela elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de céréales. Les céréales qu’elle vend sont le maïs et l’haricot, le maïs est très utilisé dans la cuisine togolaise surtout pour préparer la  pâte. Elle fait face à une rupture de stock, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son deuxième crédit pour acheter 10sacs de maïs, 7 sacs d’haricot et divers céréales.
texts.en:
This young woman is single and she works hard to support herself. In order to do that, she sells cereals. The cereals she sells are maize and dried beans. Maize is much used in Togolese cuisine, especially to make porridge. She is presently dealing with a shortage of inventory, so she wishes to replenish her stock and is asking WAGES for her second loan to buy 10 sacks of maize, 7 sacks of dried beans, and various other cereals.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of charcoal and cereals

loans.name: Comlan

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est marié et père de 02 enfants, il vit dans le quartier d’adamavo, il exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des produits  congelés, il a commencé ce commerce l’année dernière, le congélateur qu’il utilise pour refroidir ses produits est en panne ce qui a considérablement ralenti son activité et réduit son chiffre d’affaire,il sollicite par conséquent de WAGES un crédit pour acheter un nouveau congélateur.
texts.en:
Comlan A. is married and the father of two children. He lives in the Adamavo neighborhood of Lomé, Togo. His principal revenue-generating activity is the sale of frozen foods. He started this business last year. However, the freezer that he uses to freeze his products is broken, which has considerably slowed down his activity and reduced his sales. Consequently, he is seeking a credit from WAGES to buy a new freezer.

Translated from French by Andrew Whiteman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a freezer

loans.name: Majengo Group

texts.en:
Rita is a member of the Majengo borrower group in Kiboriloni, Kilimanjaro. She is a 38-year-old married mother of two children. Her children are ages 15 and 19.
 
Rita started her own clothing business six years ago to sell things like vitenge and kanga (fabrics). The kanga is a piece of printed cotton fabric, often with a border along all four sides. It is printed using the silkscreen method with its pattern in frames. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with wax print, printed using rotary printing machines. Kitenge is a communicating textile - the various colors, patterns, writings and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people. Rita works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 200,000 Tanzania Shillings (about $152).

This is Rita’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more vitenge and kanga. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Rita hopes to buy even more vitenge and kanga. 

Benadeta, another member of the borrower group, has requested 150,000 Tsh in order to support her own charcoal business.

loans.use: To buy more vitenge and kanga

loans.name: Mariyam

texts.en:
Mariyam is a member of the Tuwesawa borrower group. She is a 45-year-old woman, is married, and is the mother of six children aged 25, 20, 18, 16, 14 and 8 years.

Two years ago, Mariyam started her own business selling charcoal. She works ten hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 20,000 Tsh.

This is Mariyam’s second loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 500,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal to sell. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Mariyam hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Biter Oscar

texts.es:
el sr. Biter Oscar V. tiene 36 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de papas y yuca, tiene   cuatro años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, vende de lunes a sabado en el mercado las Americas de la ciudad de comayaguela, compra en el mayoreo los quintales de papas y yuca, va muy temprano para poder obtener una verduras de buena calidad, el saco de papa lo compra a $ 20,00 y lo vende a $ 30,00, y el de yuca compra $ 30,00 y lo lo vende a $ 35,00 obtiene utilidades mensuales de $ 360,00.
El vive con su esposa y su hija de tres años, el solicita el credito para comprar verduras papas y yuca asi mismo quiere comprar productos de abarroteria como ser maiz, frijoles, huevos, arroz, café, ya que tiene una pulperia, la cual se la administra su esposa.
Quiere tener una variedad de productos para ofrecer mas a sus clientes, es un señor muy risueño, querido por sus clientes.
el desde niño se dedica a esta actividad, su meta a corto plazo surtir ambos negocios y asi tener mejores utilidades.
texts.en:
Biter Oscar V. is 36 years old, and he has been selling potatoes and yucca for four years. He sells his products Monday through Saturday in the Americas market in the city of Comayaguela. He purchases wholesale potatoes and yucca. He goes very early so that he can get good quality vegetables. He buys a sack of potatoes at $20,00 and sells it at $30,00. He buys yucca at $30,00 and he sells it at $35,00, from which he earns $360,00 in monthly profits.

He lives with his wife and his 3-year old daughter. He is asking for this loan to purchase vegetables, potatoes, and yucca, as well as grocery items such as corn, beans, eggs, rice, and coffee since he has a store that his wife manages.

He wants to have a variety of products to offer more to his clients. He is a very cheerful man and is loved by his clients.

Since he was a child, he has been engaging in this type of business. His short-term goal is to stock both businesses to have better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of potatoes and yucca

loans.name: Erik Enmanuel

texts.es: El joven Erick Enmanuel Hernández F., tiene la edad de 24 años, habita en el barrio  la Francia N0 2, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen un hijo de un año de edad, los planes hacia su familia es terminar de construir su vivienda, desde hace 10 años se dedica a la actividad agrícola, debido  ya que sus padres han subsistido de las siembras,   las dificultades que se le dan son las plagas que debido a la falta de insecticida que no aplica en su debido momento que por falta de ingresos. Don Erick inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de sus padres, los planes futuros hacia su cultivo es diversificarlo. Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos y poder aplicar al cultivo y obtener una buena producción y vender a mejor precio en el mercado. Da las gracias a la institución por el financiamiento ya que hace posible seguir mejorando sus cultivos el cual es su fuente de trabajo y subsistencia de su familia.
texts.en:
Erick Enmanuel H. F. is a young man who is 24 years old, lives in the neighborhood of Francia No. 2 located in the municipality of Ticuantepe, with his wife who works and helps him with the household expenses. They have a son who is one year old. His plans for his family are to finish building their home. For 10 years he has been working in agriculture due to his parents living through difficulties with pests because they cannot apply pesticides in time due to lack of income. Erick began this activity with the support of his parents and his plans for the future are to diversify his crops. With the loan he will buy fertilizer and other inputs and be able to apply them to the crops and get good production and sell at a better price in the market. He thanks the institution for the funding because it enables him to further improve his crops which is his source of employment and livelihood for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide to apply to crops to increase yield.

loans.name: Preciosa

texts.en:
Preciosa V.' main source of income comes from buying and selling scrap materials in her community. She is 55 years old, widowed and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin. Preciosa has been in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2,000 pesos a month.

In 2009, Preciosa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Preciosa is requesting a loan of 4,000 pesos which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Dalmesio

texts.es:
El socio Dalmesio; es natural de la ciudad del Cusco y ella pertenece al banco comunal, Chaska ñahui, ubicado en la ciudad del Cusco

Nuestro socio tiene 43 años de edad es casado y tiene 2 hijos, nuestro socio trabaja en un hotel de tres estrellas, muy reconocido en el medio y el está encargado del área de recepción, el socio solicita el préstamo para poder efectuar una compra personal de un mueble, el socio pagará está deuda con su sueldo mensual que le genera el hotel.

Nuestro socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.

loans.use: uso personal

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en: Emelyn, 44, is a rice farmer for her livelihood. She is a married woman from Agusan Del Sur. She patiently tends her farm to ensure a quality harvest. She likes farming because it provides food for her family and other families who buy from her as well. Her rice field needs funding; that is why she applied to CEVI and is now requesting a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos. She will buy the necessary farm inputs she needs out of this loan. Receiving this loan will be truly worthwhile to Emelyn as she reaches her goals in life.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Karol

texts.es: La señora Karol, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Activas”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 27 años y es madre de 01 hijo.Karol, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron buenos resultados, hoy en día vende accesorios de computadoras.Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700.00, comprará accesorios como: redes, cables,   usb, mouse inalámbricos, impresoras y pc’s, en diferentes marcas, asimismo otra vitrina para exhibir  sus productos.Karol, es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Karol belongs to the "Mujeres Activas" Communal Bank in the District and Province of Bellavista in the San Martín area. She lives with her partner, is 27-years-old and is the mother of one child. Karol is a woman who has been able to overcome many difficulties in her life. Her desire to carry on has produced good results. Today, she sells computer accessories. With this loan of S/ 1,700.00, she will buy accessories such as mains, cables, USB cords, wireless mice, printers and PCs of different brands as well as another display case to showcase her products. Karol is an example to follow for many woman who start a business and with perseverance achieve their dreams. She is very thankful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her and other women start their own businesses and grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy computer accessories.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La señora Flora es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” del distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia de El Collao de la Región Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, es casada, tiene 03 hijos, los tres viven con ella porque son menores de edad. Estudió hasta tercero de secundaria, se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa usada como: casacas de cuero. Flora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 04 años.

Nos cuenta, que el primer préstamo que solicitó fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, en ese tiempo tenia una tienda de abarrotes e invirtió el dinero comprando productos para la tienda.  Ahora se dedica a la venta de ropa de segundo uso.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00  (Nuevos Soles, comprará mas fardos de casacas de cuero, los cuales venderá en Juliaca y Cuzco.
Su sueño para el futuro es abrir un restaurante pues sabe cocinar, y ver a sus hijos profesionales con trabajos seguros.
 
Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los préstamos ,porque sus intereses son bajos y también sus socias son amigables.
texts.en:
Flora is a member of the Las Brisas del Río Blanco Communal Bank in the Pilcuyo district, El Collao province, Puno region. She is 39, married, and has three children. The three children live with her because they are still minors. She attended school until the third year of high school. She buys and sells used clothes like leather jackets. Flora has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for four years. She tells us that the first loan she requested was for 300 PEN. At the time she had a grocery store, and she used the money to buy products for the store. Now she sells used clothes. She will use this loan for 3,000 PEN to buy more bundles of leather jackets, which she will sell in Juliaca and Cuzco. Her dream for the future is to open a restaurant; she knows how to cook. She also dreams of seeing her children become professionals with secure jobs. What she likes best about her communal bank are the loans because the interest is low. Also, the members are very friendly.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy leather jackets

loans.name: Yuly Marisol

texts.es:
La señora MARISOL, pertenece al Banco Comunal “NUEVA LUZ DEL MAÑANA” de la Asociación Arariwa de la Provincia del Cusco, Departamento del Cusco. Es madre soltera, tiene 35 años y es madre y padre para sus dos hijas. Claudia tiene 17 años y estudia en la universidad Católica de Santa Maria del departamento de Arequipa y Maria José estudia en el jardín y al próximo año estudiara en el colegio Santa Ana del Cusco. 
 
Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de producto sanitarios con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su inicio que empezó hace 4 años atrás hasta la fecha ha ido ganando mas clientes. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a comprar a su tienda y les atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia a pesar de las adversidades. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio comprando mas juegos de baños 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. En la foto la socia esta acompañada de su sobrina y de su hija menor.
texts.en:
Señora Marisol is a member of the communal bank "Nueva Luz del Mañana," which is part of the Arariwa Association located in Cusco province, in the provincial department of Cusco. She is a single mother who is 35 years old; she serves as mother and father to her two children. Claudia is 17 years old and studies in the Católica de Santa Maria university in the provincial department of Arequipa. Maria José is in kindergarten and next year will study at the Santa Ana del Cusco school. Marisol's character and desire to accomplish her dreams motivated her to start her own business selling sanitary products, the proceeds of which would contribute to the family's income. Over the 4 years since she started the business she has been gaining customers. Now she has regular customers who come to purchase from her store daily, and she attends to them with characteristic charisma. She has already had the store for some years now and it has gone very well thanks to all of the effort she puts into her work. She is a hardworking and enterprising mother who strives to advance her family in spite of adversity. She needs a loan to increase her working capital that she will use to buy more bathroom sets (sets of decorative items to use in a bathroom - for example, matching toilet cover, bath mat, etc.) She is very grateful for the opportunity provided through these means, and as such promises to make her payments on time. In the photo, she is accompanied by her niece and her younger daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy bathroom sets (sets of decorative items to use in a bathroom - for example, matching toilet cover, bath mat, etc.)

loans.name: Frida

texts.es:
Frida, de 40 años, es una madre muy amorosa y tierna con sus 4 hijos; Alex de 19, Yovana de 17, Claudia de 15 y Libertad de 3 años. Vive en su casa propia, con ellos, y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.

Para Frida el tejido artesanal es un pasa tiempo más que una actividad económica. Durante su vida trabajó en diversos oficios, pero con el tiempo se dio cuenta que los tejidos le daban los ingresos económicos que necesitaba. Fe así que decidió dedicarse a ello por entero, pues este negocio le es muy rentable debido a que la mayoría de sus clientes prefieren comprarle a ella por los novedosos modelos que tiene.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que al mismo tiempo que cuida su negocio puede realizar sus tareas domesticas, ahorrándole tiempo para hacer otras actividades, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse en la madrugada para acabar los pedidos que le solicitan. 
Con el tiempo, espera tener su propio puesto donde pueda vender sus tejidos ella misma, ya que actualmente sólo distribuye a otros comerciantes.

Este es el sexto préstamo de Frida con MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone al grupo. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para producir más tejidos artesanales.
texts.en:
Frida is 40 years old. She is a loving and tender-hearted mother who lives in her own home with her four children: Alex (age 19), Yovana (age 17), Claudia (age 15), and Libertad (age 3). What she wants most is to improve her quality of life.

Frida passes the time making woven handicrafts as a means of earning an income. During her life she has worked in various trades, but eventually realized that weaving provided the income she needed. Frida decided to pursue this activity full-time since it is very profitable. The majority of her customers buy from her because she offers unique novelty items.

What she likes most about her work is that she can run her business and take care of her household chores at the same time. This frees up time for her to pursue other activities. Frida has been in this business for six years and believes the hardest part is getting up at dawn to finish the orders her customers have requested. She hopes to have her own store in the future where she can sell her handicrafts. At the moment, she sells her products to other traders.

This is her sixth loan with MFP. She expects to make her payments on time so as to not cause problems for the other members of her Communal Bank. Frida is highly respected because she able to keep the group organized. With her loan of 2500 soles, she plans to buy more wool for making her hand woven articles.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa tiene 54 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia.
DesD. hace 10 años tiene una tienda D. comestibles, y con este negocio logró mejorar sus actividades agrícolas y ganaderas. Luisa trabaja todos los días en la atención D. su bodega, con la ayuda D. sus hijos. Cada semana se abastece D. mercadería para tener su tienda surtida D. los productos D. mayor demanda.
Con el paso D. los años, este negocio le ha permitido crecer en su economía, por lo que piensa a futuro seguir desarrollando esta actividad hasta tener una tienda más granD. y mejor implementada. 

Este es su crédito número 12 con MFP, ella tiene varios años D. experiencia en el trabajo solidario como parte D. un banco comunal, el cual considera que ha hecho parte D. su vida. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. mercadería para su tienda, además D. sacos D. abono para sembrar pastizales, principal alimento D. sus animales.
texts.en:
Luisa is 54 years old and lives with her 3 children in her own house. For 10 years she has had a grocery store and with this business she managed to improve her agricultural and cattle activities. Luisa works everyday tending her store with the help of her children. Every week she stocks up with new merchandise to keep her store supplied with the high demand products. After many years, this business has allowed her to grow her income, and in the future she plans to continue this activity until she has a bigger and better developed store. This is loan number 12 with MFP; she has many years of experience of solidarity work as party of a community bank which she considers now a part her life. The money that she is requesting now will be invested in buying merchandise for her store, plus sacks of fertilizer to plant pasture fields for her animals.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Maria Fidelina

texts.es: Doña Maria Fidelina,  tiene 55 años de edad, madre de tres hijos, junto a su esposo quien la apoyado en su larga vida para salir a delante, el trabaja como supervisor de la Alcaldía de Managua, en la colecta de basura y su negocio de Maria es la venta de productos Omnilife y  lotería la cual vende ambulante frente a la lotería una carretera bien concurrida ya que hay mucho trafico y movimiento de personas por que están los bancos enfrente lo cual le permite vender sus productos a si como sus clientes permanente que usan omnilife para una mejor salud. Con este préstamo comprara  lotería y omnilife que son caros para seguir aumentado su inventario en venta como la captación de nuevos clientes. Sus planes es poder hacer mejoras a su casa aunque es de bloque falta ponerle el piso, pintarla, y por falta de dinero no ha hecho las mejoras ya que sus créditos que es la única manera de poder mejorar su vivienda lo ha invertido solo en su negocio para no descapitalizarse y mantener el equilibrio en sus ventas y poder sastifacer las necesidades diarias.
texts.en:
Maria Fidelina is 55 years old and has 3 children with her husband, who has supported her in her efforts to make progress. He works in Managua, supervising trash collection. Maria sells Omnilife products and lottery tickets on a busy street where there is much traffic and many pedestrians, because it is near the banks. This allows her to sell her products to her regular customers who use Omnilife to improve their health. With this loan she will purchase the Omnilife products and lottery tickets, which are expensive, in order to increase her sales inventory and gain new customers. She hopes to make improvements to her home, which still needs a floor and to be painted. With little money she has not been able to make these improvements, and these loans are the only way she can improve her home. She has invested solely in her business so as not to lose capital and in order to maintain balance in her sales and meet her day-to-day needs.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Jancuk Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Omnilife products and lottery tickets, to increase sales

loans.name: C2343 Abadatenguha Group

texts.en:
Petronille is 25 years old and is married with two children, the first being 2 years of age and the other 6 years. Petronille and her family live in the Gasabo district of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda where her business is located. Petronille is the leader of her group which contains five people, all of whom are women.

Petronille has two years of experience in the business of selling fruits and vegetables; her business is very organized. She is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more fruits and vegetables to attract more customers.

Petronille hopes that this loan will change her family situation by enabling her to earn enough for their basic needs. Her business is open every day from five in the morning to two in the afternoon, except on Sunday.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Adelia Silvino

texts.pt:
Adélia Silvino L. nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Província da Maputo, fronteira com a Suazilândia, tem 38 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 4 filhos de 18, 07,04 e 2 anos de idade, os 2 mais velhos é que vão a escola. Fez somente 8ą classe não continuou devido a Gravidez precoce. Vive na casa própria com a sua familia, e não sustenta mais ninguém para alem da sua família. 
Saiu de Namaacha para Boane ainda jovem com os pais, depois do casamento continuou a viver nesta cidade com a sua família. Tem um negócio próprio que exerce desde o ano de 2007, aprendeu esta actividade sozinha em sua casa, onde conta com uma empregada. Vende mais perfumes, deodorantes onde trabalha das 07h as 18:30horas todos os dias. Consegue um rendimento diário de cerca de 800.00mt a 1.000.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (perfumes, pomadas de beleza, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade do seu produto e satisfazer o seu mercado. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 12.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros créditos. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para adquirir um meio de transporte próprio.
texts.en:
Adelia Silvino L. was born in the district of Namaacha, in the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique. She is 38 years old, married, and is the mother of 4 children who are 18, 7, 4 and 2 years old. The two older children attend school. She only studied through 8th grade, and didn't continue because of an early pregnancy. She lives in her own home with her family and she isn't responsible for supporting anyone else financially. She left Namaacha for Boane with her parents when she was young. After marrying she continued to live in Boane with her family. Adelia has owned her own business since 2007. She learned how to run a business on her own at home, where she has one employee. She works selling perfumes and deodorants from 7:00 AM to 6:30 PM each day. She earns approximately 800-1000 Meticales a day, and uses this money to pay for household expenses. She also saves some money in her bank account. Adelia has never taken out a loan with another bank. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through a friend who also works with the institution. This is her 2nd loan, for the amount of 25,000 Meticales. She plans to use this money to buy merchandise (perfume, beauty creams, and other items) in order to increase the products she sells and satisfy her customers. Her earlier loan was for 12,000 Meticales and was used for the same purpose. She promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future she would like to apply for more loans in order to buy her own means of transportation.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products, paper and other goods

loans.name: Ret

texts.en:
Mr. Ret T. (pictured above) and his wife, Mrs. Nun Chheng, live along National Road Number One, about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh. The couple was married in 1965 and has five children: three sons and two daughters. Four of them are married and live outside the family home and the other works in a garment factory.
Ret and his wife are farmers. They grow rice on their farmland in the village, and hope to continue the business as it is their main way of supporting their standard of living. Therefore, Ret is requesting a loan of $600 USD to purchase fertilizer, seed and pesticides to maintain his rice farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seed and pesticides

loans.name: Vilma Raquel

texts.es: Vilma Raquel C. C. de 26 años de edad, reside en Cojutepeque, ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Vive junto a su hermana quien trabaja como comerciantes, junto a sus dos hijas y una sobrina, todas menores de edad, las cuales se dedica a estudiar. Desde hace 6 años que Vilma se dedica a la elaboración de queso, el cual posteriormente lo comercializa en el mercado de Cojutepeque, lugar en el cual también vende diferentes tipos de carne de pollo congelada. Este ha sido un negocio muy bueno para ella, ya que ha sido a través de este como ha podido salir adelante junto a sus hijos, brindándoles todo lo necesario a sus hijos como alimentación y estudios. Vilma solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar todos los ingredientes necesarios para poder elaborar el queso, el cual lo elabora en su casa de forma artesanal, este tipo de queso es muy vendido ya que hay una gran variedad de ellos y sus precios son un poco más bajos que los quesos procesados. Vilma desea mucho salir adelante y poder mejorar sus ventas para beneficiar a su familia de una mejor manera.
texts.en:
Vilma is 26 years old and lives in Cojutepeque that is located in the department of Cuscatlán. She lives with her sister who works as a merchant along with her two daughters and a niece who are all minors and are studying. For the past six years Vilma has been making cheese. She sells her cheese in the Cojutepeque market, at a place where they sell different types of frozen chicken. This is a good business for her as she is able to provide for her children’s food and education. Vilma is asking for this loan so that she can buy the ingredients she needs to make her cheese. It is artesian cheese that she makes in her home. She is able to easily sell the cheese as she provides a large variety of it and her prices are a little cheaper than processed cheese. Vilma would like to progress and improve her sales, which will greatly benefit her family.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy ingredients to use to make cheese

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon O. A. is thirty-three years old, married, and has two children aged seven and three years old. His business is located at Majengo market in Mombasa, Kenya. 

Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well-known for its many many tourist attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian Ocean's white beaches. He has been selling fish for ten years to the local people. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is storage. Fish is highly perishable. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

He is using his loan of Kes 40,000 to buy more fish to expand his business. He hopes to own a room with a refrigeration facility where he can store fish. He is a very hard-working man.

loans.use: buying more fish for resale

loans.name: Mr. Chheun Saem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of thirteen people who live in Thnal Louk village in Takeo province. Mr. Chheun S. is the group leader, selected by all the members who will use the loan for different purposes to improve their businesses in the future.

Mr. Chheun S. is a village chief and a farmer who owns 2.5 hectares of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. His problem is that his rice field is ready to be plowed, but he does not have enough money to get it done. To improve rice production, Mr. Chheun S. is requesting a loan to hire laborers to plow his field. His wife, Mrs. Sopha M., is a merchant and he has three children who are studying at school.

loans.use: To hire laborers to plow his rice field

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Merciditha D. is a 49-year old married woman who lives in Brgy. Mahilum, Calatrava, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by engaging in a retail store and food vending business.

Merciditha’s 52 year-old husband, Roberto, is a jeepney driver, and they have seven children who are between 10-27 years old. Two of their children go to school and also help their parents in the businesses as part of their daily chores.  They have one child who is already married while the others have work that helps the family.

Merciditha joined Kiva partner NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in a retail store and food vending business. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 10,000 from her business activities.

Merciditha is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 12,000 was used to fund the operations of her retail store and food vending, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 17th cycle loan in the amount of Php 10,000, which she intends to use for her retail store and food vending. Merciditha is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the poverty alleviation program, NWTF is empowering women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To provide additional capital

loans.name: Aide

texts.es:
