Aide pertenece al Banco Comunal Los Claveles hace 12 años y lo que mas le gusta es el incentivo del ahorro, le enseñaron a ser responsable y puntual.
Aide es casada, tiene 4 hijos que están estudiando, Aide tiene un Multiservicios llamado Angélica que esta en su casa, vende abarrotes en general, artículos de escritorio, gas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos. Además Aide brinda los servicios de cocina para diferentes eventos. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de gaseosas, detergentes y gas.
Aide con sus ahorros construyo su casa y ahora sueña con construir el segundo piso de su casa, terminar los acabados de su casa y comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Aide has belonged to the communal bank "Los Claveles" for 12 years, and the thing she likes most in the incentive of saving money. They have taught her to be responsible and punctual. Aide is married and has 4 children who study in school. She has a multiservice business called Angelica, which she runs from her house. With the help of her children, she sells groceries, stationery, and gas. Furthermore, Aide provides cooking services for various events. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of soft drinks, detergent, and gas. With her savings, Aide built her house, and now her dream is to build the second floor of her house, tie up other loose ends in her house, and purchase a car.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, detergent, and gas for her store

loans.name: Muharram

texts.en:
Z. Muharram is a hard working woman. She is married and has two children. For the past 14 years, Muharram has dedicated herself to selling office supplies. She started her business after her husband's employment contract with a construction company ended. With her husband’s income missing, bills started to pile up and she decided to generate her own income to try to fill the gap. She likes what she sells and has developed a stable enterprise. Muharram has requested a loan in the amount of 8,000 TJS to help purchase a new supply of items to sell. This is an important matter for this family's well-being. Please help Muharram’s business grow. She truly appreciates your generosity.     


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase office supplies

loans.name: Lane Kuru - V Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Lane Kuru - V” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Abie B. is the leader of this group. The 40-year-old is married to a businessman and they have four children – two in secondary school and two in primary school.

Abie has operated a small business for many years now. She sells palm-oil (the country’s favorite cooking oil), rice, salt, Margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), corn, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy more of the above mentioned items wholesale to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy more palm-oil, rice, salt, Margi, corn, etc., to sell

loans.name: Clémence

texts.fr: B. Clémence est née vers 1971 à Hozin au BENIN. Mariée à HOUNKPONOU, Clémence est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Clémence vit avec son mari et ses enfants depuis une dizaine d'année au quartier Sègbèya à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Clémence assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la famille. Clémence n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Clémence vend divers produits (conserves de tomates et de sardine, vinaigrette, mayonnaise, sucre, lait, huile, bougies, pâtes alimentaires, œufs , farine de manioc, et les condiments de sauce) dans sa boutique située à son domicile. Clémence exerce comme activité secondaire le vente de charbons de bois. Clémence est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant obtenu antérieurement trois crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus importante de sa clientèle, Clémence désire augmenter son fonds de roulement et élever le niveau de son activité afin de se faire plus de revenus. C'est ce qui l'a conduit à solliciter un nouveau crédit.
texts.en:
Clemence B. was born in 1971 in Hozin, Benin. Married to Hounkponou, Clemence is the mother of four children, all attending (or having attended) school. For the past ten years, she has been living with her husband and children in the Sègbèya borough of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She shares responsibility for family expenses with her husband. Clemence has only attended primary school. To make ends meet, she sells various products in a shop located in her home (canned tomatoes and sardines, salad dressing, mayonnaise, sugar, milk, vegetable oil, candles, pasta, eggs, cassava flour, and sauce condiments). She also sells charcoal as a side business. Clemence is a regular ALIDé client, having already been granted three previous loans, all successfully reimbursed. Facing increasing demands from her customers, she wishes to increase her working capital and raise the level of her activity so as to generate more revenue. This is what prompted her to request another loan.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products (canned goods, pasta, sugar, soap, eggs, tomatoes, onions, hot peppers, etc.)

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
Marleni nació en la comunidad de Cajamarca del distrito de Cachimayo y tiene 29 años. Actualmente, Marleni vive en la ciudad de Cusco junto con su esposo y su hija Frinney. La ciudad de Cachimayo  se encuentra ubicada a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.   

Marleni se dedica a la venta de aretes y mochilas en el centro comercial “El Paraiso”, ella tiene un puesto de venta en el mismo centro comercial, donde la pueden encontrar los 7 días de la semana, desde las 9 de mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Marleni nos cuenta que hace 6 años vendía de forma ambulatoria pero ahora tiene un stand en el centro comercial.  

Con su próximo préstamo, Marleni que espera recibir S/. 500 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar aretes. 

El banco comunal “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” tiene tres años y medio de funcionamiento, Marleni pertenece desde hace tres años al banco comunal y le va muy bien. Los socios de este lugar son devotos del Taytacha Ccoyllority (El señor de la Nieve Brillante) y por esa razón le pusieron el nombre al banco comunal.
texts.en:
Marleni was born in the community of Cajamarca in the Cachimayo district. She is 29 years old. Now Marleni lives in the city of Cusco with her husband and her daughter, Frinney. The city of Cachimayo is located 30 minutes from the city of Cusco. Marleni sells earrings and backpacks in the "El Paraiso" shopping center. She has a stall in that same shopping center where you can find her every day of the week from 9 in the morning until 8 at night. Marleni tells us that 6 years ago she was a street vendor but now she has a stall in the shopping center. With the next loan, Marleni hopes to receive 500 Peruvian soles. She would like to use the money to buy earrings. The communal bank "Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” has been in existence for 3 and a half years. Marleni has been a member of the communal bank for 3 years, and it is going very well. The members of this group are devotees of Taytacha Ccoyllority (The Lord of the Brilliant Snow), and for this reason they have used this as the name of their communal group.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy earrings

loans.name: Khaem's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of fifteen members, located in Pratheat village, Kandal province. Mr. Khaem K., born in 1948, was selected as village bank president by its members. Each member of this village bank loan will use their portion for different purposes. 
       
Mr. Khaem K. and his wife, Mrs. Lorn Ork, are farmers who own a plot of land that they use to cultivate sesame and peanuts to earn a living. Besides farming, Khaem K. is also a government worker who is able to earn a small salary to support his family. His spouse is also able to earn a small income through their children's selling beautician's goods. 

In order to improve the family's living standard, Mr. Khaem K. will use the loan that he has asked for from AMK to buy more beautician supplies for his children to sell. This couple has six children: Three are seamstresses in a garment factory and two sell beautician goods in the local market while one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more beautician's supplies for his children to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John O. is 43 years old and married to Millicent Adhiambo. They have six children who are all in school. They live in Migori town.

John sells second-hand clothes and is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after completing repayment of the first loan. His major need right now is to get more bales of second-hand clothes to add to his stock as the previous one is running out due to the great demands of his clients. His business is doing well and he earns an income of Kshs 20,000 per month. He plans to use the profits to buy a motorcycle and probably diversify into that business.

His hope is to expand and have a stable business.

loans.use: Buy more clothes to add to his stock

loans.name: Purevtsengel

texts.en:
Purevtsengel H. lives with his wife and three children in their own house in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His two sons are currently unemployed and stay at home with their mother. His daughter attends university.  He had been operating a consumer goods trading business since 1998 and had stopped his trading business due to his wife's health condition in 2009. 

He used to work as a driver for a local organization, therefore he had gained experience in this profession. Purevtsengel started his transportation business with help of his two sons in 2010 after purchasing a new truck.  He is a very modest man and says, “ All I want is to restart my previous business.” He needs more funds to complete construction of his store that costs 1,500,000 MNT and therefore he is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan both to purchase a trailer at 1,500,000 MNT for his big van and to use in the construction of his shop.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer for his big van and for construction materials for his shop

loans.name: Ditas

texts.en:
Ditas A. is 40 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She is from the village of Bungad, a part of San Pablo municipality, Isabela province on the Luzon islands. Ditas makes and sells food, primarily dirty ice cream (ice cream sold on the streets, thus exposed to pollution, but not actually dirty). Ditas has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Ditas joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. Ditas successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase ingredients needed to make her ice cream. Ditas is requesting a new loan, her second from ASKI, of 15,000 PHP that will be used to buy needed ingredients. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay tuition fees for her children.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients needed to make her ice cream

loans.name: Hadbaatar

texts.en:
Hadbaatar J. is 45 years old and lives with his wife and adult daughter in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in Huvsgul province of Mongolia. His wife stays at home due to poor health and receives a pension of disability. 

Hadbaatar operates a public transport service between the local towns. He started this business in 2000, after purchasing a new microbus. Today, he works for the Nuhurlul Zam Friendship as a driver to offer public transportation two or three times per month. After many years of owning this business, he has been supporting his family as well as to pay his son's tuition fees with his business profits. 

Hadbaatar works very hard and is a quick and self-asserting man. For the future, he hopes to upgrade his car by buying new one. He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to improve his car.

loans.use: To improve his car

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.en:
Ana is 38 years old. She lives along with her partner and their two young children in their own home. They reside in the village of Buenaaventura Siale, located in the district of Pueblo Nuevo in the province of Ferrañafe. It is a rural zone east of the major northern cities of Chiclayo and Lambayeque.

Out of the front of her home, Ana manages a small general store. She sells general needs items including detergent, hygienic supplies, dry foods, candy, vegetables, beverages and beer. She has been running the store for over five years and she is quite well known in the area. She has a loyal client base and stable sales. Her husband works as a laborer for the municipality.

This will be Ana's first loan with Edpyme Alternativa. She plans to use the loan proceeds to increase her inventory in anticipation of the holiday season. She expects sales to increase during this period and she wants to take advantage of current prices and ensure that she is able to supply for her clients' needs. Ana is a dedicated businesswoman and mother. She hopes to be able to continue providing for her children and maintain their schooling, even through university.

loans.use: to increase her inventory in anticipation of the holiday season

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Expand his business

loans.name: María Teresa Martel

texts.es: María Teresa Martel C. D. P. D. 61 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo con quien resiD. en San Juan Opico en el departamento D. La Libertad. Ella una señora muy alegre y amable, la cual posee muy buenas referencias por parte D. sus amigos y vecinos, ya que se destaca por ser alguien responsable y respetuosa, la cual siempre ha trabajado junto a su esposo por sacar adelante su hogar. María posee una tienda en la cual comercializa todo tipo D. productos D. primera necesidad, en la cual ha trabajado durante años para poder surtirla y D. esta forma obtener todos los beneficios posibles D. su negocio. Es por esto que María, solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con los recursos necesarios para comprar muchos más productos comestibles como: pan, golosinas, huevos y otros más, D. los cuales son los que más se venden, así mismo comprar productos D. primera necesidad para el hogar. Todo esto es con el fin D. mejorar las ganancias obtenidas por la tienda y así poseer un negocio más rentable.
texts.en:
María Teresa Martel C. D. P. is 61 years old and lives with her husband in the town of San Juan Opico, located in the department of La Libertad. She is a friendly and amiable woman whose friends and neighbors speak highly of her. She stands out as someone who is responsible and respectful, who has always worked alongsiD. her husband to keep their family moving ahead. 

María has a store where she sells all sorts of everyday products, She has run this store for years, always varying her merchandise to make the business as efficient as possible. This is why María is now asking for a loan to buy more food products, such as bread, candy, eggs and other items. These are some of her bestselling products. She would also like to buy more household goods. All of this will help her increase her income and make her business more profitable.

loans.use: Purchase of everyday products.

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Braxides Maruja

texts.es:
Braxides es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo II” ubicado en el distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene 07 hijos (02 independientes), la señora estudió hasta 4º de educación primaria.

Trabaja con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace más de un año, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 200.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio de venta de salteñas, espejos y pomadas.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizará para comprar mercaderías por cajas como peines, pomadas, espejos, etc. trabaja junto con sus hijos y su esposo, también su esposo trabaja  de albañil.

Su sueño es tener un capital propio y que sus hijos salgan profesionales para que no tengan problemas económicos en el futuro.
	
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el préstamo de la cuenta interna y lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
Braxides is a member of the "3 de Mayo II" community bank which is located in the district, province and department of Puno.  She is 38 years, lives with her partner and has 7 children (of whom 2 live independently).  She studied up to the fourth year of elementary school.

Braxides has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for more than one year.  Her first loan was for 200 Peruvian soles which she used in her business selling 'salteñas' (a type of Bolivian empanada), mirrors and creams.

Braxides is requesting a new loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles which she will use to buy merchandise by the box load such as combs, creams, mirrors, etc.  She works together with her children and husband.  Her husband also works as a construction worker.

Braxides' dream is to have her own capital and for her children to become professionals so that they no longer experience economic problems in the future.  What Braxides likes about her community bank are the internal account loans and what she makes on her savings.

loans.use: To buy merchandise wholesale such as combs, mirrors and creams

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en: Beatha is 30 years old, married and has two children. All her children go to school. Her husband is also a businessperson who sells shoes. Beatha sells clothes especially for women; she has been doing this business for eight years. Beatha needs this loan to buy more clothes and she hopes to reinvest the profits she anticipates in the growth of her business. She dreams of becoming a supplier of clothes in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
la joven Margarita E. H. es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la fabricacion de  ropa casual y  ropa escolar, todos los dias se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para ponerse a fabricar su ropa, Margarita es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos bien pequeños, nada mas cuenta con la ayuda de sus papas.
su negocio lo tiene instalado en su casa de habitacion en la colonia Sagrado Corazon.
sus tiempos libres se los dedica a jugar con sus hijos y visitar la iglesia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales de fabricar los uniformes y trajes, ya viene la epoca escolar y necesita estar preparada para poder cubrir con todos los pedidos que le hagan.
texts.en:
Margarita E. H. is an enterprising young woman who manufactures casual and school clothes. 

She rises every morning at five to start making her clothes.  Margarita is a single mother of three, very young children.  She gets help only from her parents.

Her business is in her home which is in the Sagrado Corazón neighborhood.

During her free time she plays with her children and goes to church.

She will use the loan to buy materials to make uniforms and outfits.  The school term is approaching and she needs to be prepared to fill all the orders she will get.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, lace, foam, buttons, zippers, rulers and sewing machine parts.

loans.name: Zhizho (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Zhizho esta formado por un grupo de 11 mujeres alegres, carismáticas y muy trabajadoras que siempre estan en la lucha y busca de un mejor futuro para sus familias, laboran en diferentes actividades que les permiten tener sus ingresos propios. Viven en la comunidad de Zhizho que  pertenece a la parroquia  Victoria del Portete, este sector es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la ganadería y a la agricultura y muchos salen a la ciudad a realizar diferentes trabajos.

La Señora. María Manuela D. es socia del banco comunal Zhizho y vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre, se encuentra en la banca comunal hace 2 años y se dedica la ganadería vendiendo la leche que obtiene de ellas, también se dedica a la cría de animales como cuyes y pollos que los vende y también son para su consumo. 
Doña María Manuela tiene 53 años, es casada y tiene 8 hijos de 30, 27, 25, 21, 19, 17, 13 y 8 años de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive independiente, 4 de sus hijos trabajan y le ayudan en la economía de su hogar, su hija de 21 años pasa en la casa y le ayuda en los quehaceres, su hija de 13 años estudia en el colegio y su ultimo hijo estudia en una escuelita del sector. Su esposo labora en la agricultura, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa. 
El dinero de su nuevo crédito lo van a invertir en la compra de más pollos para su negocio. Su meta es  crecer más en la cría de animales.

La Señora. María Luzmila Sánchez vive por la comunidad de Zhizho, tiene 31 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 12, 10 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuela de la localidad. Su esposo labora como albañil y con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
Doña María Luzmila se dedica hace 11 años a la actividad de los bordados lo que aprendió por habilidad y ahora trabaja realizando obras en su hogar, no tiene un horario fijo y trabaja  de lunes a viernes.
Se encuentra en su octavo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y esta orgullosa de pertenecer a el ya que tiene muy buenas amigas y compañeras,  el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una nueva maquina de coser para su trabajo. Su sueño es que sus hijos se superen y darles los mejores estudios.
texts.en:
The Zhizho community bank is made up of a group of 11 cheerful, charismatic and very hardworking women who are always striving  and looking for a better future for their families. They work in different activities that allow them to have their own incomes. They live in the community of Zhizho, which belongs to the Victoria del Portete parish. This area has a cold climate and its people work with cattle and in agriculture and many of them go to the city to do different jobs.

María Manuela D. is a member of the Zhizho community bank and lives in the community of the same name. She has been in the community bank for  2 years and she works with cattle, selling the milk she obtains from them. She also raises animals such as guinea pigs and chicken and sells them for consumption.  
 
María Manuela is 53 years old, married, and has 8 children aged  30, 27, 25, 21, 19, 17, 13 and 8. Her oldest daughter is married and lives on her own. 4 of her children work and help her with the family budget, and her 21 year old daughter helps with the housework at home. Her 13 year old daughter goes to high school ad her youngest son goes to the elementary school in the area. Her husband is a farmer, and with both their work, they were able to build a home.  The money from the new loan will be invested in more chickens for her business. Her goal is to expand the raising of animals. 


Mrs. María Luzmila Sánchez lives in the community of Zhizho. She is 31 years old, married, and has 3 children aged 12, 10 and 8. Her oldest son goes to high school and the two youngest are in elementary school in the area. Her husband works as a bricklayer and with both their work, they were able to build their own home.  

For 11 years, Mrs. María Luzmila has done embroidery, which she learned on her own. Now she works at home without a set schedule from Monday through Friday.

This is the eighth loan she has taken out with the community bank and she is proud to belong to it since she has very good friends and companions there. She will invest the money from the loan in buying a new sewing machine for her work. Her dream is for her children to get ahead and to give them a better education.

loans.use: To buy chickens/ a sewing machine.

loans.name: Fokaben Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Fokaben, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 48 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Siemana, préfecture de Barouéli ; Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, d’argile blanche et des céréales.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Fokaben sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter du sel de cuisine, du riz et de l’argile blanche.                                                                         
SITAN T. compte acheter des sacs de sel de cuisine avec les revendeurs de Barouéli. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement sur place à la maison et le plus souvent au marché de Konobougou, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en: The women in the Fokaben group are all married and on average are 48 years old with 3 children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Siemana, Barouéli prefecture, Ségou Region (fourth administrative region of Mali). They know one another through ties of community, kinship and friendship. They sell condiments, white clay and grains.  The women in the Fokaben group are on their sixth solidarity loan, which will be used to buy cooking salt, rice, and white clay. Sitan T. plans to buy bags of cooking salt from Barouéli retailers. She sells her products daily at home and most often at the  Konobougou market, in cash and on credit, to a clientele of men and women. She expects to earn a monthly profit of 20,000F CFA which will be used to pay the loan installments and to make contributions to social ceremonies.  The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy cooking salt

loans.name: Mrs. Mom Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of seventeen people who have selected Mrs. Mom to be the village bank president. All members will use their portion of the loan for varied ways to improve their family living.

Mrs. Mom weaves silk cloth to sell in order to earn some income to support her family. Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand. Therefore, Mrs. Mom is asking for a loan to buy more silk for weaving. Her husband, Mr. Thy, owns a car which he uses for a taxi. She has eight children, one of wH. is a driver, another two are weavers, and the others are studying in local public school.

loans.use: to buy more silk

loans.name: Amunifa Group

texts.en:
Here we see the members of the Amunifa loan group. Each is a small-scale businesswomen who lives in the city of Kenema. This is the first time they have requested a loan from SMT/Kiva lenders, and they each hope to use their portion of the funds to expand their businesses, make more sales and earn larger profits. 

Massah M. leads this group. She was born in Kenema, is 41 years old, is married to a miner and has six children. For many years now, she has made a living selling pepper. She will use her portion of this loan to expand her business by buying more pepper to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To expand five small businesses

loans.name: Javzmaa

texts.en:
Javzmaa is a 33-year-old woman who lives with her daughter and younger brother in their own house in Songino-hairhan district, Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. Her younger brother is a welder in a private company and her only daughter, who is age 10, attends secondary school. 

She manages a grocery shop near to her home. She started her business in 2007. With four years in business, she has gained much experience and wants to expand her business in the future. She is an honest woman who says, "By depositing my earnings, I want to pay the college tuition fees for my daughter." 

She is requesting a loan of 1,800,000 MNT to purchase meat and meat products in order to sell them in the coming spring period when meat sales are higher compared with other seasons.

loans.use: to purchase meat and meat products

loans.name: Ong

texts.en:
Ong S., 54, is a married woman and the mother of four children, two of whom are married and living independently. The other two are single. 

To make a living, Ong S. and her husband are farmers and they always work together in the farming business. 

Ong S. has begun sowing a new rice crop, but she needs fertilizer. Ong S. is applying for this loan to buy fertilizer so that the family will grow a larger crop. She will also use some percentage of the funds to pay for the documentation fee for her child to work in Thailand.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay the documentation fee for her child to work abroad.

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: Cette dame a débuté son activité depuis 2003, elle est  revendeuse d’objets de piété à savoir livre de prière, bible, chapelet à kpogan agbétiko (un quartier de la ville) juste à coté d’une église catholique. A 46 ans, elle s’occupe seule de ses trois enfants et ce premier crédit lui permettra d’améliorer ses conditions de vie et de travail.
texts.en:
This lady started her business in 2003. She sells religious articles (prayer books, bibles, and rosaries) in Kpogan Agbétiko (one of the town's neighborhoods) next to a catholic church. 

She is 46 years old and looks after her 3 children by herself. This first loan will help her to improve her living and working conditions.

loans.use: to buy religious articles

loans.name: Munhjargal

texts.en:
Munhjargal is 34 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband is a driver who owns a transportation business.
Munhjargal manages a goldsmith business in her town. She started her business at beginning of 2010. Previously she used to work as a guard in a private company. She is an honest woman who always takes care of her children and provides all the necessities of life for her children. She says, "In the future I want to have my own workshop where I can work comfortably." She is requesting an 800,000 MNT loan to purchase variety of molds for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of molds.

loans.name: Ytalo

texts.es:
Ytalo de 31 años, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertnece al departamento de Piura. La zona se caracteriza por ser de mucha actividad agricola, ganadera y artesana.

Ytalo se dedica  a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas ) y aves de corral desde hace 4 años, su corral donde se encuentran sus ovejas y aves son apropiados y espaciosos; se encuentran  en la parte posterior de su casa, los cría con alimentos balanceados como con pastos y granos naturales  y una vez que tengan el peso y el tamaño ideal las ofrece en el mercado de Tambogrande y Piura.  Con el dinero que va adquirir por sus ovejasy aves podrá atender sus necesidades de su hogar.  Su padre le a dado en herencia unas tierras de cultivo donde siembra mango en temporada de verano, es otra forma como se ayuda económicamete.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más ovejas y respectivo alimento asegurando un buen crecimiento y engorde de sus animales.  Ytalo es una persona responsable y trabajadora con la única intensión de ayudar económica a su familia para que sus hijos salgan adelante.
texts.en:
Ytalo, 31, and his wife and children live in a house they own in the Peruvian "departamento" of Piura.  Local people earn their living from farming, raising livestock and selling traditional crafts.

Ytalo has operated a business raising and selling sheep and poultry for 4 years.  The yard behind his house, where he keeps the sheep and birds, is neat and spacious.  He raises the animals on a balanced diet of grass and natural grains.  When they reach the right size, he takes them to the markets at Tambogrande and Piura for sale.  The money that he gets for the animals is enough to pay the family's expenses.  He also operates a farming business on land left to him by his father.  The income from the mangoes that he grows there in the summer help too.

Ytalo is applying to Edpyme Alternative for a 1000 new soles loan that he will use to buy sheep and the supplies he needs to raise them.  He's a responsible and hard-working person and his only goal is to help his family and give his children the best possible start in life.

loans.use: to buy sheep and supplies for his livestock business.

loans.name: Paris Group

texts.es:
El grupo Paris lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedoras y empoderadas una de ellas es  la señora María José de 22 años quien tiene un niño de 3 años y se dedica al comercio de ropa el cual inicio con una pequeña cantidad de dinero y poco a poco con su arduo trabajo empezó a salir adelante.
Ella invertirá el crédito en mercadería en ropa (camisas, pantalones, camisas…etc.)
Las otras integrantes son Iliana Patricia  de 42 años tiene una pequeña venta la cual inicio recientemente y Vilgen de 37 años vende comida hace 2 años.
texts.en:
The Paris group is comprised of three hardworking, entrepreneurial, and empowered women, one of whom is María José, 22 years old. She has a three-year-old son, and she sells clothes. This is a business that she started with a small sum of money, and little by little, through hard work, started to see succeed.

She will use this loan to purchase clothing for merchandise (shirts, slacks, etc.).

The other members are Iliana Patricia, 42, who has a small sales business that she recently started, and Vilgen, 37, who has been selling food for two years.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for merchandise

loans.name: Castle Of Hope Group

texts.en: Alberto, Maria, and Doris all reside in San Lorenzo, Honduras.  They formed the "Castle of Hope" solidarity group in June 2011. Alberto and Maria both make a living by selling new clothing. In addition to clothing, Alberto also sells school supplies. Both are requesting loans of HNL 8,000 to purchase merchandise. Doris runs a small convenience shop in her village, selling basic foodstuff and household consumer products. She is requesting a loan of HNL 6,000 with which to purchase merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, pants, shorts, skirts, blouses, shoes, sandals, pens, pencils, paper and notebooks.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
El señor Eugenio tiene 43 años de edad, esta casado desde hace tiempo con la señora Rosalina de 53 años de edad, con la cual tiene dos hijos en edad escolar que dependen económicamente de ellos. Viven en su propia casa que está situada en Ciudad de Encarnacion.
El señor Eugenio es panadero, junto con su esposa poseen una Panadería desde hace tiempo en su domicilio,. Ellos producen diariamente galleta y coquito y distribuyen en el barrio y también en otros barrios de la ciudad, además de vender desde su casa. El señor Eugenio posee su moto en el cual se moviliza para hacer sus repartos. Gracias a esta actividad ellos han podido salir adelante, educar a sus hijos y solventar cualquier gasto que se les presente.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de otro horno que les resulta necesario para aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Eugenio is 43 years old and has been married to 53 year-old Rosalina for some time.  The couple have two school-age children who are financially dependent on them.  They live in their own home which is located in the city of Encarnación.

Eugenio is a baker and he and his wife have owned a bakery in their home for some time.  They produce cookies and 'coquitos' (coconut cakes).  They distribute their products in their neighborhood and also in other neighborhoods in the city.  They also sell from their home.  Eugenio has a motorbike which he uses to make his deliveries.  Thanks to this business, they have been able to get ahead in life, educate their children and cover any expense that should present itself.

Eugenio is requesting this loan to buy another oven which he needs in order to increase his production.

loans.use: to buy an oven to expand his bakery

loans.name: Nan

texts.en: To help the family gain prosperity, Mrs. Nan works as a sewing factory worker in Phnom Penh. She earns about $3 per day. Her  husband doesn’t stay at home; he goes to their farm everyday. Both of them have given birth to five kids. But now some of them are working and earning suitable salaries each month. Mrs. Nan wants a loan of $1,100 to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials to earn more than other years.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Jocelyn has a retail shop that sells clothing like t-shirts, blouses and underwear. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy t-shirts and blouses to sell.

Jocelyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts and blouses to sell

loans.name: Netdap Karina

texts.es:
Karina nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 30 años de edad. Actualmente, ella vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Ella es secretaria del colegio Sor Ana de los Ángeles de la ciudad del Cusco. También, ella se dedica a la venta de chocolates y elabora manualidades. Ya son tres años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. El crédito que requiere Karina es para comprar materiales como por ejemplo tela, adornos y muchas cosas más. 
 
El Banco Comunal “Virgen de Chapi” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Karina was born in the city of Cusco, Peru, and she is 30 years old.  She now lives in the city where she was born, and where she has her economic activities.  She is a secretary in the "Sor Ana de los Angeles" school in the city of Cusco.  In addition, she has a business selling chocolates and making crafts.  She has had this business for 3 years already, and it is going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her business.  Karina needs a loan to buy materials such as fabric, trimmings and many other things.

The communal bank "Virgen de Chapi" meets every 30 days in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Cusco is known for being an area with a lot of tourism and trade,  for its traditional Inti Rami festival (Festival of the Sun), and for being the gateway to Machu Picchu, one of the Seven Wonders of the World.

loans.use: to buy materials such as fabric, trimmings, and other items

loans.name: Massan Yawa

texts.fr:
Massan  est une femme âgée de 52 ans. Elle  est mariée å un sociologue. Elle  a 5 enfants, dont tous  à l’école. Le premier a 25 ans et le dernier a 10 ans.  
Massan  travaille comme revendeuse de charbon de bois, de bois de chauffage et du gravier depuis 2008. Elle  vend du charbon de bois, de bois de chauffage et du gravier pour tout le monde à la maison.  
Massan  a requis son premier crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter et vendre du charbon de bois et de bois de chauffage. Elle  veut investir dans son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Massan  voudrait agrandir le marché. Elle  dit qu’avec les profits, Elle  prévoit avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Massan is a 52 years old woman. She is married to a sociologist. She has five children, who all go to school. The eldest is 25 years old and the youngest is ten.
Massan has been retailing charcoal, firewood and gravel since 2008. She sells charcoal, firewood and gravel for everyone's home usage.
Massan requested her first WAGES loan in order to buy and sell charcoal and firewood. She wants to invest in her business.
In the next few years, Massan would like to grown her market. She says that with the profit, she foresees having a happy family.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal, firewood and gravel.

loans.name: Samol

texts.en: Samol, 35 years old, is a motor taxi driver earning $6 per day. His wife is staying at home and taking care of their one child. The child is one year old. Every month, he has to spend $50 on food, $25 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $700 to buy fertilizer and hire some farmers to plow his field for farming. Before, he was a construction worker and his wife was selling fruit at the market but now she stopped selling because she just had a baby and needs to take care of him. He plans to help his wife sell fruit when their son can attend kindergarten.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire some farmers to plow his field

loans.name: Monje

texts.en:
Monje is a married woman with nine children, three of whom attend school, and six of whom are all grown up. She has a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Monje has operated a retail shop for the past year, selling household consumable items like maize flour, wheat flour and rice to her customers, who are local area residents. A major challenge she faces in her business is the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business into a wholesale shop in the future.

With her 30,000 KES loan, Monje wants to purchase ten bundles of maize flour for her retail shop. She decided to join Yehu to access business loans.

loans.use: to purchase ten bundles of maize flour for her retail shop.
